"Yes do that." said the elder voice, the one in charge, though his tone was clipped, as if interrupted from deeper thoughts. "Collect at least a pint and spin it down. Run a full Magicka Spectrum Analysis on the plasma and have the results on my desk by this evening."

There was the sound of footsteps departing, now quite clear. It was about this time that Blaze realized that he was not dreaming these strange voices. For one thing, he could smell the occupants of the room, five distinct scents, all elvish. Blaze's powerful nose strangely gave no hint of the larger room around which seemed polished and sterile. He only caught the whiff of disinfectant, clean oiled steel and one or two bottles of odiferous chemicals not stoppered properly.

When the young dragon realized he was conscious, it was only the caution ground into him over the last few months as well as his innate wiliness that kept him from opening his scaly eyelids. Listen. Observe. They don't know I'm awake... yet. Blaze thought and the allure of what the elves might let slip while they thought him unable to hear was far more tantalizing than the thought of punishment.

Blaze kept his breathing slow and even. And through fine movements in each of his limbs, came to realize that he was strapped securely down to the floor. Not as cruel as the sheer iron manicles he was used to, these restraints were leather padded. However, they were all quite snug and Blaze hadn't a hope that he could break free of them.

While Blaze was coming to realize that all his legs - and his neck and tail as well - were pinned to the floor and his wings were hobbled by some leather harness fixing them to his back, someone lifted his scaly jowls and ran a palm down his filmy teeth. "Second set of incisors fully set..." The hand traveled farther down his snout towards his jaw. "Third set of molars just breaching the surface. Indicates age of forty to forty-five years." Another set of hands at the front of his snout pried his mouth open. A hand gripped one of the serrated fangs in the side of his mouth. "Roots... firm. No obvious signs of decay. Gum discoloration indicates vitamin deficiency. Liander?"

"Yessir?"

"Prescribe supplement plan A for this drake. Make sure the feed officer doesn't short change this one. We can't afford to cut corners in getting this one healthy."

"Sir? Permission to speak freely?"

"Granted" said the elder voice.

"Do you think this one has... potential?"

There was a pause and then the voice said, "Perhaps. He certainly made quite a show of himself activating the shock collar just an hour after containment."

"Speaking of that, Sir. The shock collar is going to need to be replaced. The power supply is dead."

"Dead? He hasn't even been here a day. How can it be used up already?" For the first time, the elder voice, the one who was probing his teeth, sounded surprised, maybe even concerned. "How many seconds did it discharge?"

"S-sir. It's impossible to say. The capacitor was overloaded as well."

"Hm... intriguing..." The voice said the words like melting wax.

Another voice cut in, higher pitched, perhaps female. "I wouldn't make too much of it, Doctor Moridin. The capacitor probably just shorted out from exposure to salt water near the docks."

"And dear, Auyandrith. If the capacitor was indeed shorted, how do you explain this dragon surviving the entire discharge?"

Blaze could imagine her waving a hand in dismissal. "Oxidation. The power supply was probably weak to start with."

"All possibilities..." said the doctor vaguely. "However, undoubtedly, this young male has surv-"

"Doctor, the screen reads-"

There was a snap and then a high pitch yelp of pain. "How dare you interrupt me?!" roared the doctor, whose fingers left Blaze's mouth

"B-but sir..." mewled the assistant. "The n-nueral map. It reads heightened activity in cognition areas A through D."

Another aide spoke from the opposite side of Blaze. "Heart rate has increased to 42 bpm... and is still increasing!"

And how could Blaze keep his hearts from pounding? They were on to him! If only he could force himself to sink back into the safety of unconsciousness.

The one called Auyandrith said. "That means he's waking up!"

There was a low chuckling from the doctor and Blaze heard footsteps approach his head while all the rest were backing away. "No, my dear apprentice. It means he's been awake. Haven't you... Blaze?"

The sound of his name, dripping from foreign unreverant lips snapped open the young drake's eyes. His pupils immediately went slit in the white sterile light. All around was white floor, white, crisply glowing ceiling, white coated elves with fair skin and fair hair. Blaze almost thought he'd gone blind. But his clever eyes began to adapt and he noticed the metallic surfaces of the steel tables around him, but also the unusual silver instruments lying on them, many of which were sharp or pronged.

In those first few moments, Blaze strained against his bonds, but soon gave it up after a few futile pulls, deciding to conserve his energy. The elves returned now that it was proven that his restraints would hold. Mirth lay in their eyes at his helplessness, except the eyes of the elf before him.

Heavy scaled lids hooding his eyes, Blaze observed a tall, straight elf. His face was comely with the ageless features common to his race, however the lines about his eyes betrayed a great age and even greater experience. His white buttoned coat was flawless like his silver hair tied in a neat pony tail behind his head. On his hands the elf wore skin-tight purple gloves of a type Blaze only ever saw at a large hospital, but above the wrists, the skin was marred, the only imperfection, scarred as if by acid burns.

Blaze breathed slowly, cautiously. Blaze relaxed into his bonds and looked up at the elf with one eye, expecting some sort of trap.

The doctor spoke again. "Blaze." The name rang in his ears, unheard for so long! "That was your name wasn't it?"

'was' 'wasn't' past synonyms. One of the crystal screen somehow displaying Blaze's vitals betrayed his growing anxiety. Blaze had only been punished for daring to address an elf before!

Was this one different? Could it possibly be? He has spoken his name. Not his 'real' name granted, but one he identified with just as strongly. Somehow the elf had known it. How? "H-how?" The word escaped him and the elf did not deliver pain. Blaze continued with his question. "How did you know my name?"

The elf lifted his head nonchalantly and sniffed. "I know many things and it is because my job is to know them." said Dr. Moridin condescendingly, as if Blaze were simple, but also as if he held a great store of compassion for simple beings.

Blaze was almost quaking with fear of the elf, feeling as though he were entering a game which he did not know the rules and offered steep penalties for missteps. Perhaps he did simply have a knack for getting into trouble, but he could not stop himself from asking carefully, "Why are you speaking to me?"

The doctor clasped his hands together. "Well, why wouldn't I speak to a fine young drake such as yourself? My job is to collect information after all."

The elf was lying. Blaze could smell the subtle odor in his sweat. But it was just a partial truth. Blaze took this to mean that the elf did more than just collect information... he probably used it as well.

Blaze settled his jaw on the floor, it was easier than feeling the padded brace against the back of his head. It didn't matter if this elf had decided to speak to him. If he were free this moment, he'd slaughter the lot of them and try to break for the main-shore. The doctor probably knew this as well.

After another period of silence, Dr. Moridin continued, "I would like to ask you a few questions, and it would be helpful if you could answer to the best of your ability."

Blaze narrowed his eyes, sure that they were going to start torturing information out of him.

But no. One of the aides brought forth a small ice box which rolled along the floor. From it, the doctor removed a fat hog shank before sitting on the lid of the low chest. He waved it in front of Blaze's wide nostrils. "There will be rewards for your cooperation of course."
1112111211211111.title: Doctor Moridin

choices: Dr. Moridin sends Blaze back to his cell
11121112112111111.content:
If they had been in New Alveri just a few days after his capture, Blaze would have refused flatly. It rankled to be forced to the level of revealing information in exchange for food. It didn't matter what information it was, if the elves wanted it, then they should be prevented from having it. He should have resisted their organization at any level it was possible to resist.

But then had come the long months of slow starvation, isolation and cramped, inescapable confinement. The whips and the long, lubricated wooden poles...

How Blaze long for that fat, juicy hog shank. It wasn't even fresh, but it was untainted, preserved in the ice box. It was far more than Blaze had known for months and right now he'd have given anything to bite into it.

Doctor Moridin, the tall thin elf in the coat before him was dangling the generous hunk of meat from the bone in front if his eagerly sniffing nostrils. There was no hope of resisting, he might have even thought of taking the pole again to have a proper meal at last!

The elvish doctor's eyes glinted at the absolute lust in Blaze's. He snapped his fingers with his free hand. "Bring me the glove. It seems our patient is willing to cooperate."

A young female elf sauntered up from the side, carrying a small wooden box carefully. She opened it and removed the tight purple glove on the doctor's right hand, replacing it with one of grey cloth. It was a glove of unusual style, for sure. The fingers were laced with silver fibers which wove in arcane designs on the palm and came back each finger in fairly thick wire. It almost looked like some sort of device. Blaze even imagined he heard a faint *click* when it was pulled down to the elf's wrist. "Now loosen the drake's neck restraint, Auyandrith. Carefully, mind you. We want our guest to be able to eat more comfortably."

And she did as she was commanded by her senior, standing behind Blaze's head and unbuckling the restraint several notches. Blaze kept still. Ancestors only knew what would befall him if he tried to take advantage. Besides, all his other limbs were still firmly held in place.

Once the padded restraint was adjusted, Dr. Moridin tossed Blaze the shank with an easy underhand throw. He snapped it up in his jaws and devoured it greedily, his teeth snapping right through the thick bone. He decided to feel degraded later.

"Good... Good..." said the doctor in drawn out syllables. "That was a gift, in good faith. Let it not be said that there is not a single good-hearted person on this gods-forsaken island."

Blaze rumbled assent, chewing and savoring fresh meat for the first time in months. With some more decent food like this, he might even be able to pass the plug of dried jerky which had been clogging his system for the last week of the sea voyage.

Dr. Moridin then reached into the ice chest he was sitting on and retrieved - wonder heaped on wonder! - a long, whole beef tenderloin, still bloody and dripping on the floor. The elf set it down, Blaze's nose snuffling in its direction. The shank had only rekindled his former hunger with a vengeance it seemed just then.

"This one you will have to work for." said the doctor, and Blaze shuddered, knowing that he would indeed answer anything the humanoid asked. "Tell me, have you been sexually active in the past? and if so, with how many partners..."

The elf proceeded not to ask about possible secrets of the inner workings of New Alveri, as Blaze had expected, but questions about Blaze himself. He inquired about his prior sex life (non existent, but come on! he was just entering puberty!). He asked about past illnesses, allergies, injuries. And then came the psychological questions which were far more difficult.

Sometimes, the doctor would toss Blaze a small steak about the size of his hand, but a tidbit to the young dragon. All the time, the long tapered tube of soft tenderloin continued to slowly leak its juices across the floor. Dr Moridin constructed hypothetical scenarios and asked Blaze how he would react. They ranged from finding a lost female, alone and gravid out on a distant trail to carrying out executions if he were a soldier in the military. For the most part, Blaze did not have any problems answering the questions. They seemed innocuous enough. When it came to decisions between duty or authority and moral values, Blaze typically sided with his morals, even when faced with possible punishment. When it came to punishing wrongdoers, Blaze tended to be lenient, trying to understand the others' position. Dr. Moridin's face was a flawless mask, not revealing what sort of answers he was looking for, if indeed he was looking for a certain type of answer. Everything Blaze said was recorded on paper by his female assistant, that Auyandrith. Slowly, Blaze became more comfortable with the questions and the steady rewards of food, waxing more eloquent and detailed in his responses. He was relieved to have someone to actually listen to him! Soon the words were simply spilling out of him with hardly any thought.

That line of questioning seemed to end all too soon. Dr. Moridin did not reward Blaze after the last question. Instead he put his elbows on his knees and stared at Blaze for a long time. His eyes were hard, calculating. Undoubtedly, he was trying to figure out where Blaze was going to fit into his grand scheme. "Young Drake..." said the doctor who had not used Blaze's name since the first time. "You do like females, don't you?"

"Yes!" emphatically answered Blaze, affronted by the notion that there might be any possibility of the alternative. Nasty ideas of rumors concerning how many times he'd needed 'subduing' circulating around the compound filled Blaze with illogical dread concerning the fate of his perceived masculinity. "Of course I do."

Dr. Moridin traced his thumb down the strip of beard at the bottom of his chin. "And what would you do, if there was a fertile female, here. Right now."

Blaze hesitated at the unusual question. "I'd... I mean, I'd be interested of course... but... I don't understand what you're asking." Blaze finally gave up. He rested his jaw on the ground, wishing the elf would just give him the tenderloin already.

"It's really quite simple. If there were a receptive female, here. Would you... fuck her?"

That was the first time Blaze saw the madness stirring behind those intelligent knowing eyes. Something deeper even than the sadist elf who had accompanied him from New Alveri, something corrupt at the very core.

"....n-no." Blaze stammered. "I-I'd want to get to know her first." Honesty came more easily than expected. The amount of time he'd been interrogated already was hard to remember.

The elf stood. "Well that's too bad, really. I was hoping you were a strong, virile young male. Females like initiative, you know..." He walked closer to Blaze's snout. "But then, perhaps you aren't being fully honest with me. Maybe you just need the right stimuli..."

The elf fearlessly rested his hand on Blaze's nose, the one with the silver glove. Blaze flinched at the touch, which was like an electric spark. His left eye twitched and he felt suddenly strange, as if there was tension all along his body, under the skin. His nose filled with a wet, hot musk. Blaze sighed, smelling the pungent perfume of a female in heat. It called to his bones and filled his muscles with tight, pent-up energy. But the smell was just a little off, it sparkled, it had just a slightly metallic after-scent. It wasn't real!

And of course it wasn't, there was no female here that Blaze could see, but his body was convinced. The reaction that doctor was looking for happened swiftly as Blaze extended out of his penile slit. His full length throbbed hot against the cool floor, painful with his sudden, desperate need. This was a new form of degradation, not as painful as the other, but just as harmful to his soul. The elf sniffed. "A fair size, and I imagine you still have growing to do, young one." laughed the doctor.

The smell suddenly abated, as if a switch had been pulled, but Blaze was left in his uselessly, and embarrassingly excited state. His jaw clenched, determined to make the elf pay for his trick. "You..." Blaze started, but, quick as a thought, the muscles in Blaze's body turned to stone. He couldn't even breathe.

"Naughty drake." chided Dr. Moridin, "But you'll learn. You'll learn if you want to keep that precious package of yours intact." The elf leaned down and stared into Blaze's eye. "I can play your nervous system like a musical instrument. I can make sweet music, or bend it out of tune... even break it." His hand slid up Blaze's snout, never leaving contact with his skin. "Your electrical impulses call to me, Flamer-7. They tell me your true nature. They tell me about the beast that you really are. The fragile intellect you cling to is just a fragile film over a monster within, easily broken. That's why dragons need control. You need US." Blaze felt horror at what the elf was saying, at the fact that it could possibly be true. "We're here to give your kind desperately needed order. We're here to save you from yourselves. Never forget that."

Blaze gasped as his diaphragm was allowed to relax. However, he was still filled with mortal dread at the elf whose hand rested lightly on his brow and yet could probably kill him with a thought.

111211121121111111.content:
"Now then, Flamer-7. It would seem that our meeting has come to an end," said Dr. Moridin.

Blaze did not dare respond, too deeply humiliated to even look at the elf's face. The next moment, a gray tube descended near Blaze's jaw. It smelled foul and made him woozy.

"Drink the contents that come from the spout..." ordered Auyundrith with no expression whatsoever.

"What?" cried Blaze.

Yet before he knew what was happening the metal tube was forced into his jaw and a foul tasting liquid, like a combination of aged piss and other unimaginable chemicals was dumped down his throat. His vision immediately began to glaze in and out, and before he could even think about fighting to stay awake, Blaze fell unconscious...

---------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----


Some undetermined time later, Blaze awoke groggily in his cell. His mouth still had the bitter aftertaste of that sleeping drug they had given him (or at least that's what he hoped it was all it was), and futhermore, a brand-new inhibitor was clamped around his neck.

He gazed around. All the other dragons were deep asleep, as well as Flamer-2. Otherwise, he had no way of knowing whether it was day or night. Blaze shook his head; he could not know what type of horrible ordeals he would be forced to endure, but it seemed prudent to get sleep when he could.

However, Blaze’s thoughts were consumed by what Dr. Moridin had just done to him. That also brought back the deep disgust that he had so easily allowed himself to be manipulated in that fashion. They’d tossed him food as if he were a rat or a monkey, but then again compared to the other outrages he’d already faced that was rather tame. However, he wondered why he had been so intent about asking him questions about females. He was interested, of course, yet Lady Ramoth had suppressed any possibility of sexual affections; and besides, it never really occurred to him to think too hard on the subject anyhow until now.

Then it occurred to him. If they had young drakes imprisoned within their stronghold, who was to say that they hadn’t kidnapped young drakka as well for some nefarious purpose? Maybe they intended to have the males breed with them? If so, that wouldn’t be quite so bad.

Blaze sniffed. That was pretty unlikely. Besides, why would the Kleaves do anything that would allow the drakes anything desirable like that? Probably it had only been a means of humiliation to bring them up like that. Yet Blaze couldn’t help but reflect upon the awkward questions that Dr. Moridin had brought up about young drakka.

The one thing he did know was that if there were any young drakka on this island, they were probably sad and lonely like he was. In a way, it was oddly comforting to think of this, and he was filled with a sudden longing that he could be there with one of them and tell her everything was going to be all right. He imagined her thanking him, and Blaze wrapping his body around her and keeping her safe.

It was shameful, but it also made him feel aroused to think of that… maybe there might be a mistake and he’d end up in the same cell with another female… He let out a soft snort, feeling desperately irritable. The smell from the Dr. Moridin lingered on in his nostrils.

Blaze let out a sigh as he ground his nether regions against the stone floor. He peered out through the bars nervously, making sure that all the other drakes were still asleep, before retreating to fondle himself again. He never would have done something like this back in New Alveri, but after the last few months of constant humiliation, squalid conditions and suffocating boredom he was desperate for anything reprieve. Besides, there wasn't much to be self-conscious of anymore.

Before long, he felt his body quiver, and Blaze had to make a concentrated effort to suppress his cry. He took a few seconds to catch his breath, and slowly and somewhat mortifyingly looked for a way to hide the mess he’d made. Over in the corner of his cell was a pile of sand that served as a litter box, similar to the ones felines used. He scooped his mess into the sand, and right when Blaze thought nobody had seen or heard him do it, he heard a slight laugh emerge from the cell next to him.

Blaze instantly tensed, hoping that whoever that was hadn’t heard him. Whatever small reputation he had gained from his outburst against Flamer-2 could fizzle out right then and there.

“Don’t be embarrassed Flamer-7, everyone here does it once and a while…” said a voice to the side.

Blaze flashed a disdainful look at the dragon from the cell to his left, too enraged and mortified to answer the voice. The fire drakes eyes were open and vapid, as if he had snorted an entire barrel of cinnabar.

“I’m Flamer-4. Anyhow, best to enjoy what you have for the time being. You do know what I heard what’s going to happen to us males after a while right?” he whispered, that indolent grin on the drake’s face.

By now, Blaze could imagine all sorts of horrid possibilities, but he really did not want to be dragged into this incredibly awkward conversation right now. Still, he thought it best to give an answer, if only to make sure that the weird dragon wouldn't decide to hold this over his head.

"Well, what's going to happen to us then?" he asked.

“Well, I heard that they cut off our balls after a while…” he said, his gazed tilted up toward the ceiling. Blaze instantly squeezed his legs together, which once again made Flamer-4 giggle. The reaction instantly made him outraged.

“If you’re trying to screw with my mind, then go bother somebody else…” Blaze hissed. There was a chance that it could be a bluff, yet Blaze did remember Dr. Moridin hinting about something about him keeping ‘that precious package of his’. If that was to be his fate, then Blaze would definitely start looking for the first possible way to escape, no matter how suicidal the odds, or more likely, find a way to quickly commit suicide.

“Just thought you’d like to know Flamer-7. In anycase, I thought it was very brave of you to stand up to Flamer-2 like that. He always makes things harder for everyone else…” he said in a tone that Blaze wished didn’t sound so fond.

“Whatever…” sighed Blaze, curving his head away and back toward the ground. Perhaps he was gay, which stood reason why he might have been listening in like that and not minding as much of having his balls cut off. Or perhaps it was the fact that in a place like this, young drakes were slowly and irreversibly losing their minds in this period of desperate boredom.

Right as Blaze settled in to daze some more, the ceiling torch instantly turned bright, and Blaze had to cover his gaze for the time being. Everyone who wasn’t already close to death rose awoke with a snap.

A team of ragged humanoids burst into the rooms, brandishing their usual array of whips and clubs. They began shouting at the top of their breaths, announcing that
111211121121111111.title: Desperate boredom and idle reflection

1112111211211111111.content:
The party consisted of as many dwarfs as humans, all dirty and soot-flaked. The leader of the bunch, a beady eyed dwarf with a wild brown mane, walked down the aisle with a clip board in hand. He gestured to select cages as his underlings banged their clubs against the bars, the walls, anything within reach. They obviously wanted to startle and intimidate with the racket. They certainly succeeded with the first part, but so soon after his experience with the dread doctor, it was going to take more than apes with sticks to frighten him; even if they had earned his grudging respect.

The head dwarf only walked partway down the wing which terminated just beyond cells seven and eight, both currently unoccupied. He looked down at his clipboard and then again at a young drake in the wall opposite Blaze's cell, to the left of the one opposite his. Flamer-2's cell. The Fire-lord scowled as he was selected. He was made to place his paws through the bars of his cell so that he could be manacled. It was rather laborious since they insisted on shackling the forepaws to the rear, the chain spanning them left with only enough give to allow one step at a time. This was done under the threat of spears an a single glistening pole, though Blaze was fairly sure these were just for show. They all had around their necks all the disabling power their captors really needed. But Blaze mused that perhaps wooden poles were still cheaper than inhibitor power supplies; he didn't really care to find out which method was prefered.

In time, Flamer-2's cell door was slid aside and the dragon was led out down the hallway out of Blaze's wing to the main passage. Blaze's heart sank when the hairy dwarf looked his way. With a nod and a lazy point of the hand, Blaze was soon coerced to put his paws through the bars. He desperately wanted to know where he was going, but he didn't dare open his mouth, not with the pole glistening wetly just half a dragon-length away. Besides, I'm probably going to find out in just a few moments… He thought resignedly as he was led away.


The heavy weight of the inhibitor collar slid down the length of his neck as he paced slowly down a descending stone passage. It stopped just below his neck heart where the leather padded iron ring was just tight enough to be uncomfortable, the iron plated cube which housed the collar's machinery was a clumsy necklace that he had to bear for he could not lift a forepaw high enough to adjust it and keep walking at the same time.

From the humans cajoling each other in an undisciplined manner at his flanks, Blaze had already gathered their general destination. He was heading towards the bottom of the facility, to aid in further excavation and expansion. Flamer-2's scent trail hung heavily in the air, his unwashed spoor tickling his nostrils with its unpleasantness. All in all, it did not sound unbearable. Blaze was tired of being cooped up and constantly restrained, if he could vent some of his frustration on the unfeeling rock of the mountain… that might be all right.

Gradually the tunnels lost the straight edged dwarven precision of the levels above, the floor and walls growing uneven, the passage more constricted. The air was denser and warmer, the ventilation poor. The sounds of scraping and the almost musical ping of picks against rock grew in Blaze's ears.

They rounded a bend and Blaze was startled to see a large dragon ahead. Most definitely not a Fire-lord, this tall drake looked like cross between a Sky-swallower and a Bronze. He was digging with a slow, but steady rhythm against a sheer stone wall. As he scratched at the stone, trolls, and sometimes chained humans, shoveled away the debris and carried it away in wheelbarrows back up the way they came.

Blaze tried to meet the dragon's eyes, but he did not look up from his work as he bent his broad back into the task. That was when Blaze noticed his scent. It was altered somehow. If smell were light, it would be as if the normal brazier of another healthy male had been toned down to the level of a single candle. His scent was watered down, inoffensive, but strange, neither male nor female to repertoire of his nose.

Then Blaze guessed the truth. They do neuter drakes here… he thought with dismay. His internal testicles seemed to slid up into the cavity of his abdomen. The thought of being maimed in that way, of becoming half a dragon, was enough to send hot tears sliding down his snout.

One of the human escorts jabbed Blaze's shoulder with the butt of his spear. "This way." he barked and Blaze dragged his chains down a side passage.

His pads crushed rocks which were strewn all over the floor here. He coughed once, the air filled with dust. The picks and claws banging against he stone echoed around in a crushing din. Perhaps Blaze might have preferred to stay in his cell after all… And he was beginning to feel a little nauseous, undoubtedly some after effect of the brew Dr. Moridin had slid down his throat. Also, as the fresh meat was making its way down his system, Blaze was hit with the urge to shit for the first time in over a week. It was a relief from the torture of cramping, yet it couldn't have come at a more inopportune time.

Finally they reached the end of the branching, growing tunnels. Blaze groaned in a complaint unrelated to the choked rumbling in his lower abdomen. There ahead of him was Flamer-2. He was having his manacles taken off in preparation for digging work. Blaze found it hard to believe that Flamer-2 would not try to reassert his dominance over him while they were working together. The younger, more inexperienced drake did not feel confident in testing their relative strengths. Blaze bent down in pain, trying to contain himself. Especially not now.

Should he mention his pressing need to the guards? The hairy dwarf was still following behind, walking beside the man wielding the hated pole. Surely they had some provision for this if they kept drakes working down here for long periods of time? Maybe he could even get assigned a different tunnel to work on or a different partner.

But then again… Something in Blaze did desire confrontation. To have their conflict solidified in honorable combat, even if that combat had to be reduced to shoves and nips when the guards' backs were turned. He wanted to show Flamer-2 that he was not someone who he could push around. With all of the threats around here to his masculinity, Blaze thought that it might even be an opportunity to be relished.
1112111211211111111.title: The Mines
