It had actually been rather pathetic, now that he thought about it, and felt embarassed and emasculated that he'd conducted himself in that manner.

“Make no mistake, the trial you have endured has been cruel, but would you not say that you have emerged as an individual of much stronger resolve, stronger of body and able to endure so much more hardship because of it? Would you not agree that situations that you would have quailed at before you would have jumped forward to take on now?” he continued on.

Blaze could not help but gape with stunned silence. Thinking back upon it, were he the individual he was now when the attack came, he would have killed those kidnappers on the spot, or rather he would have tried to help Darzhja and Kaj rescue people from the rubble no matter what it took.

“So you see Flamer-7,” said Fang, “This is what the Kleaves are all about. We are cruel because we want you to be strong. If you prove yourself, then you shall be the first of a master race of Dragonkind that will sweep away the decadence of New Alveri and herald in a new order…”

Blaze grit his teeth. “I’m not so easily convinced as that Fang. I’m not that gullible or that stupid…”

Fang folded his arms, “I didn’t expect I’d be able to convince you of our mission so easily Flamer-7. However, the point is that I made you think about it, I made you doubt, even if for a brief moment, whereas before you didn’t do so at all am I correct?”

Right then, Blaze realized that he’d underestimated Fang. He wasn’t a madman like Moridin, or a cruel brute like Wolf, but the way he spoke was calm and logical. He could read emotions and get the sense of who they were, and could do so without seeming intimidating. Of all the Kleaves he’d met so far, he was certainly… different from the others.

“Anyhow, its been rather interesting speaking with you Flamer-7. I’ll go check upon the other subjects, and you should probably get some rest. Once you’re fully recovered you can expect that you’ll be put to work straight away,” said Fang. The young elf walked away to check on the others, and Blaze thought upon what he had just said.
11121112112111111112111111111.title: If I can put even a bit of doubt into your mind...

111211121121111111121111111111.content:
Wolf was back by the beginning of the week. By then, Blaze had recovered by his initial weariness, and in fact was itching to leave his cell. He’d been given a perfunctory check-up, testing his vital signs and his basic motor skills, in which Blaze was relieved to find that he didn’t have any complications.

"The official trials are beginning today. We are going to take each of you to the obstacle course, where your overall performance will be judged based on speed, accuracy, technique and endurance," said Wolf.

As usual, the handlers came with their cuffs, in which Blaze grudgingly held out his claws to be cuffed.

From the other side of the room, there was a roar. "You think you can hold me down puny humans!! Come on then!! I dare ya to try!!" boasted Flamer-2. Blaze found the outburst incredibly odd. Flamer-2 was the aggressive sort, but even he had better sense than to openly antagonize the handlers. Wolf was forced to use the shock collar to get Flamer-2 to grudgingly obey, yet his eyes continued to have a wild beast-like glint. Blaze narrowed his eyes; something in Flamer-2 had fundamentally changed following the surgery. He seemed more feral, aggressive, uncontrolled.

Flamer-6 was a different story. During the past week since the surgery, Flamer-6 had hardly spoken, and though he was quiet to begin with, more alarming to Blaze was the vapid expression in his eyes, lacking any sort of focus or concentrated will. Blaze could only suspect that he had come off worse from Dr. Moridin’s experimentation.

"Flamer-6!!"

"Eh?" he said hazily.

"Flamer-6!! Stick your claws outside the cage so you can be cuffed!!" repeated Wolf. Flamer-6 continued to stare blankly, as if he hadn’t heard a word the handler said. It took a collar shock to finally get him moving.

“Sorry Master Wolf…” he stammered, “I do not know what came over me. I’m still not quite 100% since the surgery.”

“Then you better shape up quickly then!!” growled Wolf.

The quiet, intelligent drake seemed absolutely arthritic as he raised his trembling claws to be cuffed. Once he was led out, he stumbled out of his cage, murmuring something incoherent to himself.

Blaze dug his claws into the rock. He would never forgive the doctor for what he had done.

He was snapped back into focus when Flamer-8 tapped him with his tail. “Come on Flamer-7. There’s nothing we can do right now…”

Blaze merely gave a nod to Flamer-8, before numbly being led toward the obstacle course. Out of all the drakes, Flamer-8 had experienced the least amount of side-effects. Blaze wondered if the reason behind it was the fact that he was the oldest of the remaining Firedrakes, and was already close to fully-grown. Privately, Blaze was glad that Flamer-8 had remained mostly himself following the surgery. However, that wasn't going to stop Blaze to concede anything to Flamer-8. One could not afford to make friends here.

Upon arriving at the volcanic obstacle course, the usual small team of elves was gathered with clipboards.

“Who will be going first?” said Wolf.

Wolf pointed toward Blaze. “Flamer-7. Come forward…”

Blaze stepped forward toward the start line and took off. He was surprised at just how much lift and momentum he got, and swept forward with such speed that he almost over passed the first target. Yet faster than he had ever known, Blaze snapped his gaze around and spouted out a powerful bout of flame. Blaze sped through the course, amazed at the ease in which he flew and flamed, how quickly he was able to react and the tightness of his turns. Apparently, the doctor’s surgery had been an enhancement; not that he would ever thank the doctor for it.

“How was that!!” roared Blaze triumphantly. He didn’t even feel fatigued afterwards, and could easily have had another go at it if necessary.

Flamer-8 merely gave a head nod, while Flamer-2 seethed. Blaze averted his gaze quickly.

Once new targets were set up, Flamer-8 took his turn. Blaze couldn’t help but be impressed with the older drake as he traversed the course. He wasn’t quite as quick or agile as Blaze was, nor was his flame as potent, but he hardly missed whenever he did flame. When he landed, Flamer-8 gave Blaze wink. Perhaps he’d underestimated Flamer-8 as a potential rival. Blaze would really have to step it up a notch.

Next came Flamer-6. Blaze had almost forgotten that the quiet drake was even there as he numbly stepped forward. It was pretty sad to watch. Flamer-6 flew as if he were an old wyrm. He made only half-hearted attempts to flame the targets, and when he did, he usually missed. Blaze could only shake his head. In his gut, he knew that Flamer-6 would not last much longer.

Then, came Flamer-2’s turn. He took off like a beast unleashed. He rampaged through the course rather than navigated through it. He was frighteningly fast; faster than all the others, and when he flamed, he flamed as if he were trying to burn down New Alveri all by himself. Blaze did not see a conceited bully anymore; what Blaze saw was a monster.

And once he cleared the course, he wouldn’t stop. Flamer-2 continued to fly and thrash about, randomly flaming in all directions.

“Burn!! Everything must burn!!” Flamer-2 exhaled. Blaze immediately scampered back toward the entrance, watching wearily as Wolf frantically slammed his fist upon the supressor, but to no avail. Flamer-2 was completely out of control.
111211121121111111121111111111.title: Back at it again

choices: A couple days later, Blaze is taken to see where the females are kept
Blaze and the others are put through a rigorous physical in the lab
11121112112111111112111111112.content:
The first thing that Blaze was aware of was pain. Before sight, sound or even precious smell, there was pain the infected his body. It rose and fell like the tide, swelling like a terrible, blistering fruit and then easing, though never quite gone. Blaze twitched his legs in response, but then tried not to, twitching caused the pain to spike like nails driven into his spine. And he did carry most of weight of the pain on his back, although it spread icy tendrils of hurt all along his torso as well. Blaze thought that his back had been laid open between his wings and when he was able to begin recalling things from just before the surgery, he figured that that was a fair approximation.

Blaze lay in his cell on a clean pile of hay, his legs sprawled out and his wings jumbled in boney, leathery heaps to either side of him. He didn't move his head, not yet, but with some effort he worked at opening his eyes. They were crusty, even at the heavy scaled outer lids. He'd been asleep already for some time. He also realized that the ebb and flow of the pain in his back was due to his slow intake and exhale of breath. Blaze tried not to breathe in too deeply, to lessen the aching.

Though driven by an overwhelming need to inspect the damage the mad scientist's scapel had wrought on his body, Blaze was prevented by an odd contraption. Though he saw it in his peripheral vision, he didn't really notice what was around his head until he lifted his neck a little and it scraped across the stone floor. Slightly panicked, Blaze reached up with his paws to the thing which fanned out and alarmingly surrounded his head. Feeling it, he discovered what it was: a dragon-sized cone.

Blaze's empty stomach sank in humiliation. Humans put these things on their beloved canines to prevent them from chewing at their stitches. The red dragon snorted. He supposed it was meant to serve the same purpose here. He ran his forepaws along its cool surface. It was aluminum reinforced with ribs of steel. However, Blaze thought that he could remove the blasted thing without too much trouble…

Then his paws came to the base. Blaze realized dejectedly that the cone was affixed to his inhibitor collar. The young drake had no supposition that the two were not linked. He was sure that if he attempted to remove or break the cone, he'd be shocked brutally. Blaze let his head sink down.

Time brought added lucidity. From the cramping in his legs and the hunger in his belly, he confirmed that he'd been asleep for a long while, though how long exactly remained unknown. Also, he realized that the pain along his back was not that of a fresh open wound as he'd been fearing. It was the aching soreness of a healing wound. Blaze wanted to probe his back with his fingers, like a human would, but his limbs would not bend that way. The young drake was also still weary and groggy, though he'd only just woken up and had hardly moved. He was drugged, he realized, only just now coming out of the potion's after effects. As sensation returned, Blaze was able to isolate five centers of pain along his back. One each at the base of his neck and the head of his tail and three more along his long torso. Two for his upper body, and one at the small of his back

When he gave up trying to get anymore information about what had been done to him, Blaze suddenly had the bright notion of looking out across the aisle at his fellow inmates and potential breeder drakes.

All three visible dragons looked to be in a similar condition as he. Each certainly had silver cones around their heads. Flamer-2 however happened to be resting with his back towards the hallway and Blaze gasped at what he saw.

The slightly bulkier dragon did not have five wounds along his spine as Blaze had suspected. Instead, he had twelve! Twelve raw, swollen wounds lined the drake's back like a string of ugly pearls. Each little mound was stitched closed with black cord, making for a fearsome looking wound like something out of a hatchling's horror story; although more and more it seemed, Blaze's life was becoming a horror story. Flamer-2 moaned in his sleep, he had not yet awoken. Blaze grimaced, he did not envy Flamer-2 when he did. From here it looked like the horrid elvish surgeons had replaced every other vertebra in the poor dragon's spine. Blaze was only glad it wasn't him.

Despite their prior rivalry, Blaze couldn't find it in himself to feel that Flamer-2 deserved his fate. 'Nobody deserves this…' Blaze moaned in his mind. Then his eyes turned to Flamer-6. And they turned to him!

Flamer-6 was awake and had been for some time, as Blaze judged due to the face that he was resting in a normal recline on his belly, with his wings folded, rather than jumbled about and nearly filling his cell like Blaze's. The dragon across from him stared at Blaze and likely had been for some time. He snorted in recognition.

Blaze tilted his head in amiable acknowledgement. However, as he looked at the drake, he did not think that Flamer-6 looked very well. The first thing he noticed was that the drake's left eye was drooping while his right looked at him with his normal expression of depressed detachment. As Blaze looked on, he realized that the drake's left wing was not closed as tightly as his right, in fact the lowermost pinion sagged down to the floor. The same was true for his jowl on the left side. Flamer-6 even drooled slightly out of the corner of his mouth, something that was highly unbecoming for a dragon.

Flamer-6 sneered unevenly at Blaze's worried expression. He began to turn his head away, but he moved with a jerking motion more akin to a millennia old, arthritic dragon than a young drake.

Blaze subvocalized, using body language and deep-deep sounds to convey simple meaning. [Inquiry]:General physical condition?

Flamer-6 stopped his head sidelong, but still had trouble keeping it from bobbing around slightly. He answered in the same manner. [Agitated Reply]: No pain. Numbness and tingling. Muscles sluggish. Feel oddly ill. [Worried Inquiry]:Enemies maybe inflicted mortal wound?

The drake across from him had never given Blaze much of a reason to like him. But he had also never gone out of his way to make him miserable like Flamer-2. He couldn't help but feel horrible that the elf's procedure had apparently gone wrong somehow and that Flamer-6 was the one who would have to deal with the consequences of their blunder. [Sympathetic Encouragement]: Enemies did not strike you down. This is good. Hope for medicine from caretakers.

Flamer-6 gently nodded his head up and down, the jerking easing somewhat. [Serious Command]: Do not tell nearby rival of my weakness. Blaze knew that he meant Flamer-2. Then he added directly to Blaze [Intimidating Advice]: Do not underestimate me.

The dragon across from him then slid his head under his wing, sliding into an uneasy slumber. Blaze inclined his snout grimly. He didn't intend on brushing Flamer-6 out of the running so easily. However, he made a mental note of his new weakness on the left side of his body. It might come in handy if things came to him versus Flamer-6. He wasn't above using his opponent's weaknesses against them, even if they were unfair weaknesses.

Of Flamer-8, the oldest of the four remaining dragons, he could not see as much. His back was turned away and his cell was farther away from Blaze's than Flamer-2's. The young drake could see that he was still sleeping at least. Flamer-8 kicked his paws twice and snapped his jaws in the throws of some dream. If it weren't for the silver collar around his neck, one would think he hadn't even gone through major surgery. Flamer-8 was one to be wary of as well. Really, all of them were.

Blaze sighed deeply and carefully gather his wings to his back. Every movement was taxing with the drugs flowing through his veins. Carefully, carefully, Blaze rolled himself over onto his flank, his recovering back facing the wall. He held his tail in his forepaws and nibbled away a loose scale in a nervous habit. Eventually he was able to slide back into dreamless oblivion, a welcome repose from the horrid reality of being a living science experiment.
11121112112111111112111111112.title: After-effects

choices: Blaze encounters one of the breeder males
He is returned to his cell
111211121121111111121111111121.content:
The next few days went by without much incident. Thankfully, the handlers removed the cones, much to the relief of all the young drakes. They spent most of that time re-establishing eating habits and basic motor skills. Everyone, even Flamer-6, was able to handle these without too much trouble.

Blaze couldn't help but be curious when one morning Flamer-8 was led away by Wolf, and then returned to his cage with an especially smug and determined expression that same afternoon.

"So, where did they take you that made you grin like that?" asked Blaze.

Flamer-8 winked, "Not telling Flamer-7... I don’t want to spoil the surprise."

“Spoilsport…” grunted Flamer-6, lounging upon his belly.

“Spit it out you wretch!!” snarled Flamer-2, rattling against his cage, his eyes red and bloodshot, “Spit it out or I’ll kill you!!”

“Shut the fuck up you circus freak…” snapped Flamer-8. Out of all the young drakes, Flamer-8 had the least problems with his surgery; in fact he’d seemed enhanced. He seemed bolder, more decisive, steadier, and now more often than not it was Blaze looking toward the older drake for advice.

Blaze shrugged. He would find out soon enough, when the following morning, Wolf came to fetch for him.

"Flamer-7, you will follow me..." said Wolf coldly. Blaze nodded, not wanting to cause trouble.

Blaze was led through a series of corridors leading away from the caldera. They arrived on an elevator, which was then slowly and painfully cranked up by a team of trolls, before arriving upon the backside of the mountain. There was a little bit of light that filtered downwards between the cracks, and overall the atmosphere wasn’t quite as oppressive as down where his cells were.

“So…where exactly are you taking me?” Blaze couldn’t help but ask.

“You’ll see soon enough…” answered Wolf. Blaze had his suspicions though, based on Flamer-8’s odd expression that morning. His suspicions were confirmed soon enough when Blaze suddenly overheard a male grunt of exertion from one of the passageways.

“Yes you whore!! Take it!! Scream for me!! Scream for your master!!”

“Yes…M-master…” wailed a trembling female voice.

“What was that?” challenged the male voice.

“O-o-oh y-yes Master!!” strained the female.

“Whose seed will you take inside of you?” he growled.

“Y-yours Master!!”

“Whose little ones will you lay?”

“Yours Master!! Oh Master!!”

It took all of Blaze’s effort to keep his gaze focused forward as an animalistic roar echoed down the chamber. Privately, he wished that he was the one in that breeder males place, fucking that poor female. Yet it was apparent that some breeder males had already been chosen. That could only mean that time was getting short, and that the selection process was about to get even more urgent and rigorous. As he walked by, from one of the other corridors, a small team of humanoids and their accompanying trolls were rolling a large wagon, and Blaze caught the scent of unhatched eggs.

Blaze’s instincts told him to leap out and try and stop those crooks, but a shock from Wolf’s collar told him otherwise. One battle at a time Blaze… the young fire drake thought to himself.

Right then, Blaze stopped behind a large metal door, and his hearts began to pound in a mixture of abject fear and anticipation.

The sophisticated metal door opened, and Blaze rounded a corner, and his eyes went wide and his jaw went slack when he saw where he had been taken. There before him within their cells were five very pretty fire drakka. Their aroma immediately hit Blaze all at once and his body trembled. He couldn’t help but note they were all well-fed and healthy, not to mention the sweet curves of their figures and the smoothness of their scales. A hunger unlike he’d ever known burned inside of him, and at that moment he wanted to do nothing else but to be as close as possible with each of them. His loins pulsed hot between his legs, so much so that they ached. It took all his concentration not to simply rush forward and immediately mount the closest drakka he could find.

“Ah, so you’ve noticed that this is where we keep the females of your species…” said Wolf with a wry grin.

“Desirable aren’t they?” he prodded. Blaze could only nod numbly.

“Well, I suppose this would give you some added motivation for you to succeed. Becoming the breeder male is not without its rewards after all. However, I will give you the chance to interact with them if you so wish, but do not touch or fondle them you understand?” he snapped.

“R-right…” answered Blaze. For all that he was concerned, the handlers voice could have come from a hundred miles away. Blaze slowly made his way toward each of them, and as he did so he could not help but inhale each of their unique aromas. The females merely sat there, unmoving, too fearful to do anything but lie there and shiver.

In the corner, there was one that was especially beautiful. Whatever the reason, there was something about that drakka in the corner that drew Blaze in and wanted to know more about her.

“Um…hello…” cried Blaze.

The drakka let out a high-pitched squeal and lashed at Blaze with a defensive wing-slap. Blaze hardly felt the blow, but the fact that he’d been slapped by a drakka rankled. His eyes narrowed furiously and growled as his claw tensed.

Yet when Blaze saw her shiver, bracing for return blow, Blaze’s anger suddenly cooled like a hot iron being dumped into a vat of freezing water.

At that moment, he was overwhelmed by a sense of pity and shame. He must have looked like an animal; a beast to her eyes, and indeed that’s probably how each of the drakka viewed the males. They were base creatures that thought only about slaking their lusts.

“Are you… are you scared of me?” he asked. The drakka stared at him with those wide eyes of hers.

"I…don’t blame you if you are. The fact of the matter is, I’m…we’re…all just as sacred as you are." cried Blaze awkwardly. “I know its hard, but you all can’t give up...” he continued. “So that one day…one day…”

Blaze couldn’t go on, gritting his teeth together.

“Its all right…” she sighed. “You don’t have to try and make us feel better with false hope and other things like that.”

Blaze couldn’t help but hack out a laugh. “Guess I probably sounded like a total sap…”

“A bit, but thanks for trying anyhow,” she responded, with a slight smile. It was the sweetest thing Blaze had ever seen. Blaze couldn’t help but put on his best encouraging smile of his own.

“Yeah…well… I suppose it just helps me stay sane, um…” answered Blaze.

“Its Fi-…” she began to respond, but then paused, claws going to her slightly glowing shock collar. “Its Honeysweet…” she sighed glumly. Blaze grunted. Apparently, the females had their own naming system designed to turn them into sexual objects.

“Don’t take this the wrong way, but Honeysweet’s a nice name,” answered Blaze. That indignant frown she gave him only served to excite him further.

“Anyhow, I’m Flamer-7…”

Yet right then, Blaze felt a jolt against his neck. He shifted his gaze toward Wolf, who stood there holding the shock amulet. Blaze briefly shifted his gaze back toward Honeysweet, “Just stay alive all right?”

Then, just for emphasis he extended his gaze toward all the drakka, “All of you!!”

“You too Flamer-7…” answered Honeysweet.

With that, Blaze was led out of the drakka chamber, his thoughts fixated upon them. He wondered why Honeysweet had attracted him more than the others. She hadn’t looked for his special attention, or for special favor. Maybe it was her scent that radiated a bit differently compared with the others. Perhaps it was the fact that the shade of red on her hide was a little bit brighter and more luminous than the others. Or, maybe it was something in her gaze. Those red eyes seemed more aware and lucid than the others. Or perhaps, there was something that reminded Blaze about home; he got the sense that she could have easily fit in with the rest of his fellow orphans. Or, it was the fact that she had almost said her real name, and that Blaze wanted to protect her so that one day he could learn her real name.

Regardless of the real reason, the thought of her being taken by any of the other males, especially Flamer-2, immediately brought forth a surge of rage to his hearts. None of them would be able to understand or empathize with her; they’d treat her like a piece of meat. Blaze’s eyes furrowed; he was the only one that could protect them, to keep them alive and prevent them from falling into despair.

Off to the side, Wolf couldn’t help but chuckle. It did not occur to Blaze that it was exactly this possessive, protective attitude that the Kleave’s had wanted to foster within the young drake…

Right then…
111211121121111111121111111121.title: A sneak peek

1112111211211111111211111111211.content:
Blaze
The scent of the females in the locked room lingered in Blaze's nostrils even after he was escorted. At least one of them had been receptive just now and the love-scent made his loins hurt with unfulfilled desire. Blaze tried not to think of sleek red scales and long elegant wings… he partially succeeded. The smelly human walking in front of him help bring keep his mind on more important matters.

Blaze snuffled as he walked. Walking without an armed escort was new, however with his back still recovering, walking was as much as he could manage comfortably, he was still not in any shape to fight. Wolf walked ahead of him and an assistant several paces to the side and behind him. Both of them had control amulets for his collar he knew. It wasn't safe for one human to escort a grown drgaon, Blaze figured. But with two, they could watch each other's backs. Wolf's second certain kept a pair of muddy brown eyes on him most of the time. He stank of fear and aggression and was more likely to give Blaze a mild shock for stepping out of line than Wolf was.

Blaze walked slowly after the humans, their pace slow for his longer legs. He had a lot of opportunity to reflect again on where this hive of Kleaves kept the precious females hoarded. They were closer to the surface for starters, almost on the same level as the wonderous half ring where the elves and dwarves dwelled. The air was better and there were even skylights on the main walkway. The dwarves painted the walls and floor there white, so better to diffuse some of the precious sunlight into the side branches. Blaze sighed. He thought it was nice that the females were housed communally, though seperated by breed, rather than individually as the males where down in the pits below even the human warrens. "Even the small privileges should be cherished in this situation," Blaze thought. He couldn't abide the thought of those beautiful, attractive... lucious, voluptuous... females being abused.

Blaze ground his teeth when he heard beastial roaring echoing down the halls again. The male in question seemed to think his job was to make as much noise as possible while performing the act. That the females here were, in fact being abused - and brutally at that - was without question. It filled Blaze with a deep unreasonable rage to hear the crime in progress and hear the dragoness sigh and squeal in distress, no matter if she was his own species or not.

Blaze turned his head as they passed by the reinforced door leading into the harem wing off the main branch they were walking. Through the grate, Blaze could spy black wings and a sleek, muscular back scaled in black so rich and deep it seemed to drink in the light. He had a smaller black scaled body under him. She writhed on her back, though whether in pleasure or pain, Blaze couldn't tell. The red dragon sneered as the large black male grappled with the female, holding down her arms and plunging himself brutally down on her.

"Take it!" he roared, "Take it you worthless cunt! You whore!"

The female Deathwing did not scream so much as moan and Blaze still could not tell if she was distressed or pleased. Blaze snarled and ground his teeth silently. Dragons were made to make love in the air or in the water as a second best choice. The way he was doing it must had been extremely uncomfortable for the female.

Blaze wanted so badly to force his way through the door and confront the terrible breeder male. The Deathwing was bigger than him, but he had his flame and enough anger to melt the entire chamber into slag...

A seething pain in his neck choked him, a medium level shock. Blaze reluctantly turned his head to see Wolf waiting for him down the hall.

"No free peep shows." said the bearded human. Then he grinned and removed his thumb from the center glass plate of the amulet. "You'll have your chance later... if you're lucky." The man laughed as Blaze stepped forward

They almost made it out of the female dorms when another dragon was being escorted on foot through the single exit and entrance. He came with a large entourage and even a mounted unit. The humaniods who followed in his wake took up the entire breadth of the wide hallway. Wolf's eyes went wide and he directed Blaze into a side passage so as to be out of the way. The fellow was quite large and sported a gleaming hide of bronze, definitely a full blooded regal. Blaze frowned, that breed was not one he would have suspected the Kleaves would be interested in or had as much luck converting.

The male snarled at Blaze as was trying to back into the little corridor. His head rose a good four feet higher than his own and his many horns higher still. He must have been more than double Blaze's weight, all of it muscle. "Out of my way, ember-baby." the arrogent Bronze snapped. In a flash like a snake-strike, he reached out his head and nipped Blaze on his haunches. He jumped and the Bronze laughed.

Blaze stood panting and quivering with anger in the corridor. He'd never felt this angry before! Only because the dragon litterally had a small army at his back was Blaze able to reign in his desire to burn the guy and rip his chared corpse asunder. The anger made his head hurt... what was wrong with him?

Wolf looked up at him, his thumb over the control for his collar. "We going to have a problem here, Big Guy?"

The breath shuddered in Blaze's throat, all he saw was red. He focused on the dimness of the narrow corridor ahead. He was fortunate that it was built for humanoids, not dragons. He would have to back out again to turn around. "No... I'm fine."

Wolf looked up at him suspiciously. "Well, for a second there it looked like you were ready to take on Lord Azimoth himself." Wolf said the name with obvious irreverence, wiggling his fingers in the air as he did so.

Curiously, Blaze looked down at the man. "And what if I was...?" he said cautiously.

Wolf snorted and palmed the control amulet. "Then you got bigger balls than brains and that's saying something for such a smart-ass as you."

Blaze looked over his shoulder and snaked his tail into the hallway around his legs. "Master Wolf. Do you know what they are doing?" Sounds were coming down from the hallway, mostly of iron doors clanging and chains rattling.

Wolf waved his arms about. "Transporting dragon bitches. What else do they do these days? You'll see." The human walked up and socked Blaze hard in the chest - which was like a tap for the dragon - his oil filled fire bladder sounded like a drum when he did so. "Just a warning. If Azimoth catches you even looking at his females, he'll kill you on the spot."

Blaze thought he was kidding, but the man's voice betrayed his very real caution. Thus the fire drake kept his head low as the procession returned, this "Lord Azimoth" at the head and keeping an eye on the bronze drakka who walked behind him. From the sound of it, she walked covered in chains all over her body. Blaze allowed himself only a small peek from between his legs. Though she was larger than him once over, he wanted to reach out to her, to comfort and make her know that someone cared... his loins ached.

Wolf gave him a mild shock, staring up at Blaze with wide eyes. "Stoppit, you'll get us both killed!!" he said in a harsh whisper. Blaze realized that his penile slit had begun to swell, the first stage of desire. Blaze shook his head again, wondering desperately why he was feeling this way so strongly.

Azimoth was utterly disdainful of Blaze as he walked by, offering a quick warning growl in his direction and that was all. Apparently he thought Blaze not even worth the time for a proper chastisement.

Blaze let out a breath when the dragon, drakka and the human guards surrounding them passed. He asked dully and without thinking. "Where are they going?"

Wolf sneered and looked up at the fire drake. "Some place you'll never see them again. That was the last bronze left on the island." The human rubbed his mouth with the side of his hand and sniffed. "With any luck I'll get a bigger office when they start moving things around..." he grumbled mostly to himself.

Blaze was returned to his cell and the young drake sat down limply on his bed of hay; it felt softer than usual. He was weary, though excited still, but his excitement frightened him. His own bodily responses were becoming different and he knew the reason why. Blaze closed his eyes and sighed. It almost felt as if his mind were unraveling, almost as if there was another Blaze inside of him, a different Blaze... the Blaze that the Kleaves wanted to get to know better.
1112111211211111111211111111211.title: Splitting By Breed

11121112112111111112111111112111.content:
Blaze rushed back up when he saw who Wolf was escorting next. He pressed himself against the bars as Flamer-2 stepped out of his cell. Wolf glanced at the big fire drake uneasily and selected three more assistants to join him on the trip; he made them walk between him and Flamer-2. A vile grin hung on the drake's face. "I smell drakka..." he said lustily and didn't even bother to hide his reaction to the trace odor.

Blaze gripped the bars, forcing his snout through the gap. "Don't you touch them!" he cried.

"What?" said Flamer-2 rounding on him, setting his shoulders forward. "You want all of those whores to yourself?"

"They're not whores, you don't even know what you're talking about!" shouted Blaze

Flamer-2 sniffed, "Maybe not... But I aim to find out."

Blaze was judging how much fire he could put out between the bars of his cell when suddenly both he and Flamer-2 were shocked so hard that their legs gave out. Blaze lay gasping on the ground as Flamer-2 was forced to crawl back into his cell. "You'll go last for that." decried Wolf, and selected Flamer-6 in his place.

The dragon limped out of his cell. It was the first time that he'd seen Flamer-6 walk since the surgery. Elvish medical staff had been in and out of Flamer-6's cell ten times more often than the rest of then since they'd awoken, however whatever they'd been doing seemed to have only moderate success. The dragon's left wing still sagged, though at least it did not hang on the ground. His face was less lopsided now, but always his expressions were uneven, the left eye never opened all the way. When Flamer-6 lifted a paw, it shook a bit as it moved in its normal arc. However Flamer-6 set a grim expression on his face. Looking at that alone, one would never tell that he was unwell.

Flamer-2 spat at him when he walked by. "You better leave some for me-ack!"

Wolf shocked the dragon again, sending Flamer-2 to the floor. The human growled. "Know your place, freak! If it were up to me, you wouldn't even get to see them at this point."

Flamer-2 lifted his head, outrageously against everything they'd learned so far about surviving in this place. "You're... next, human." He yelled as Wolf zapped him again. The human seemed ragged as he stepped long legged up the corridor. His sweat smelled of a heightened sense of fear. He patted Flamer-6 on the foreleg as he walked on by. "Come along." he said briskly. "Not much time left for sight-seeing."

Blaze lifted his head from where he lay collapsed against the bars. He could hear Flamer-2 chuffing. He couldn't imagine the pain the dragon must be in now, after being shocked three times; but then he'd asked for it. "Ack-ack-ack-ah-ah" when the sound he was making. It was a long time before Blaze realized that Flamer-2 was laughing, chuckling to himself in a deranged way.

The young fire drake pulled himself achingly to his feet and stuck his nose through the bars. "Flamer-2?" he asked uncertainly.

The other Fire-lord lifted his head, as if the sound of Blaze's voice had broken his trance. He sneered at Blaze. "Damn humans don't know their place..." he muttered.

Blaze shook his head. "What's wrong with you?"

Flamer-2's eyes looked momentarily distant, as if he were asking himself the same question. "Mind your own business, brainiac." unsteadily, the muscular fire dragon got to his feet, leaning against the bars. "I'll see you broken or dead before this is over, mark my words, Flamer-7" he said dangerously, slurring just a bit. "Same goes for you, Oldster!" he shouted in Flamer-8's direction. His head bobbed almost drunkenly. "All them females they got back there will be mine... they are mine..."

Flamer-2 weaved his way onto his bed of straw and did not move again until Flamer-6 had returned with Wolf. The human dragon tender did not let Flamer-2 back out of his cell until he had several armed guards at his back. Although Flamer-2 left with a grin on his face, he returned unconcious and being hauled on a wagon. As they were removing his big body to his cell, Wolf sauntered over to Blaze's cell. He nodded towards Flamer-2's limp body. "Told him look, but don't touch. Bastard couldn't keep his claws to hisself."

Blaze's nostrils flared and he raised his head from where he'd been curled on his straw pile. "Did he hurt any of th-"

"Didn't let him get close enough for that." Wolf sniffed again and rubbed his mouth, a trifle more confidently.

Blaze quirked his eyebrow. "Why are you telling me this?"

Wolf looked at him shrewdly. "Cause you know how the system works. Him?" he threw a tumb over his shoulder. "He's an animal. You make my job easier."

Blaze curled the corner of his mouth. "Are you saying you want me to be the breeder male?"

Wolf showed his teeth momentarily. "I ain't saying nothing. The wigs upstairs get the final say anyways."

There was something in the human's tone... "But you do get some of the say, don't you?" Blaze said, lowering his voice a little.

The human scratched his beard. Instead of answering, he said. "Breeder males get pretty prestigeous around here, you know. A lot of them get real chummy with the elves and they talk about grand things. New Alveri this... and Invasion that... But hardly any of them remember they used to be down here in the pits with us in the end."

Blaze snorted, "Lord Azimoth seemed like he had a pretty big stick up his vent."

"Exactly." said Wolf.

There was silence between them for a long moment. The human looked up at him almost expectantly. Blaze thought about what was being unsaid. "I don't think I'd be like that." said Blaze. "I couldn't forget..." that much was certainly truth.

Wolf rubbed his oily nose. "Glad to hear your the sort of person who'd remember where he came from..." he said vaguely and then wandered off. Dinner was served late that night and cold, but Blaze didn't mind. He had an appetite.

He thought a long time about Wolf and what he may or may not have been saying. Was it possible that he could help him become the breeder male... in exchange for favors later down the road? Wolf seemed like the sort to offer that to anyone who looked like a potential candidate, however. Blaze was unfamiliar with this kind of subterfuge and the possibilities made his mind twist over on itself. As he ate his fish, however, he was sure of one thing. "I remember where I came from." he said under his breath and he greedily devoured the saltwater fish.
11121112112111111112111111112111.title: The Animal

111211121121111111121111111121111.content:
It was about three weeks after Blaze's life altering surgery when the young drake awoke one night to a soft tapping on the bars of his cell. Blearily, Blaze lifted his head, both lids slid over crusty eyes and revealed a strange sight. It was a young elf. A more preposterous sight, Blaze could scarcely imagine and he decided that he must be dreaming.

The elf was a young man. If he were human he couldn't have been older than 16. As he was an elf, however, he may have been as old as 25 already. Still, it was the middle of the night and he was here alone with no torch or light source to guide his way. He might have been some ruffian here from the upper rings to poke and prod the captive dragons, but his dress belayed that idea. The adolescent was richly dressed in an embroidered robe of scarlet. Dragons and flame motifs were emblazoned on his sleeves and chest.

When Blaze sniffed and smelled the elf, he decided that he was not, in fact, dreaming. This was no illusion and from the smell of things, the elf was only a few short years away from adulthood, much as Blaze was; in a dragon's sense of time, that is. He smelled tense and excited.

The young elf reached out and gripped the bars - which were widely spaced for him - and spoke. His voice offered no hint of the emotions that Blaze detected. He seemed as calm and confident as any elf Blaze had yet seen. "Good evening." the rich tones dropped with a surprising basso that belayed his years as well as the fact that he was an elf.

But Blaze didn't forget. He couldn't. Elves were dangerous, even more so when there were no other witnesses around. Blaze watched him carefully and grunted acknowledgement to let him know he was listening.

"My name is Fang." said the elf. His eyes lit up with expectation. Blaze cocked his head in interest, bringing a large orb around to look at the small elf. This was the first he had met - besides Dr. Moridin - who seemed to want a response from him.

Blaze cleared his throat and spoke softly - for a dragon - mindful of the other sleeping in their cells across the wide hallway. "Fang?" he asked incredulously, both because the elf had interrupted his sleep and because he had a strong sense that this adolescent was not supposed to be here.

The young man cocked his head, apparently surprised at Blaze's irreverence. The dragon expected to pay for his slight, but instead the elf defended himself. "Indeed, that is my name." he insisted

"I take it that Fang is not your real name," snorted Blaze, "I find it odd that an elf would take a nickname so… dragony."

The young elf’s gaze narrowed with intrigue. He grinned. "You're actually the first dragon to ask me about that. Let's just say that I find it easier to relate to the dragons I meet with a name that might be less alien to them. I take it that this show of curiosity means you would be Flamer-7? Not that that is your real name either." he added proddingly

“Yeah, what about it?” asked Blaze, cocking his head and studying the young elf with one eye. "It's not like I chose to be called 'Flamer-7,' you know. Though, I am sure that you chose 'Fang' for yourself."

“Indeed, that is true, but really, who around here uses their real names? Names are powerful you know." The elf winked up at him. "But enough with semantics. The good doctor said that you were more clever than any of the other specimens here.” The elf sniffed, "He told me to be cautious around you."

Blaze rumbled deep in his throat. "Caution around a dragon is never a bad idea."

"Quite so." said Fang. "Now listen, I've been offered a small opportunity to expand my skills and familiarize myself with dragons in general by Dr. Moridin. It's time you got your stitches out and I'm the one who's to remove them."

Blaze narrowed his eyes. He was so used to being treated like an animal that he wondered whether Fang was setting some sort of trap.

“So, where’s Wolf and his cronies?” asked Blaze. "Why don't they do this?"

“He’s been given some much needed time off…” answered Fang with a sly grin. Blaze snorted. "The Fire-drake handler has been making noise about some time off to see his wife and child down at the port. Or some silly thing like that" said the elf with a wave of his fair skinned hand.

Blaze silently regarded the elf before him. "Who is this kid?" he thought to himself.

"I'm going to enter your cell now." said Fang. "You wouldn't do something stupid like try to harm me would you?" he asked, and his voice wavered just so.

Blaze shifted and adjusted his wings a little. "You have my word."

Although the elf was skinny enough to slip between the bars of the cell, he waved some kind of emblem or broach over the recognition plate that was connected to the small door set in the larger, dragon sized portal leading out of the cage. It seemed that he was indeed who he claimed to be. As he was entering, the elf said. "Some say the word of a dragon isn't worth its toenail clippings."

Blaze sneered, showing many sharp fangs. "And in other places, a dragon's favor is considered more valuable than gold." The door clanged shut. "And isn't it foolish for one so small and… flammable to say such a thing while entering a dragon's lair?"

Fang snorted and walked with carless grace into what might have been for him a rather spacious room. "You aren't going to hurt me." he said and proceeded to step over Blaze's tail.

He fought down a strong urge to lift it and trip him. "And why do you say that?" asked Blaze, still eyeing the elf as he moved around his body, orange irises almost seeming to glow in the dark.

The elf came around, walking on the deep straw to Blaze's back; the dragon was able to keep a close eye on him still due to his long neck. He studied the hideous black threads which had been binding his flesh together over the mounds where the implants were buried. They were much smaller and smoother now that the swelling had gone. "Because you gave me your word." said the elf and then removed a small knife from his pocket.

The elf dipped the knife's blade into a vial of clear, strong smelling fluid and then approached Blaze's back. He used it to cut off one of the knots and then - after dabbing some of the fluid on his hands and rubbing them together - proceeded to draw forth the thick thread with both hands, steadily and carefully. "You show good scale regrowth." remarked Fang when more of the wound had been exposed after the threads were gone. "It should be seamless with some diligent pruning of the edges here."

The cutting didn't hurt at all, although the drake experienced discomfort when the elf pulled the threads loose, even more when he sparkled some of his disinfectant onto the wound where it oozed a little thick ruby blood. Blaze swallowed and said, "What are you, some sort of dragon surgeon in training?"

The elf chuckled to himself and cut the last string on the wound at the base of his tail. He drew out the stitch and said, "Not really. Although the skill set is a little similar." he threw the bloody black string aside and wiped up the area with a damp cloth. He let out a little breath now that the first implant was done. "Illustrations in books and moving glyphs don't do justice. I believe that to understand dragons, you have to get down here and do the job yourself."

"And what job is that?" Blaze persisted.

The elf smiled quirkily. "Maybe another time… if you can keep your testicles long enough." Blaze's half smile immediately vanished and both were silent for a long while as the elf worked steadily up Blaze's back.

It was a simple task, although since Blaze was such a large creature in comparison to the elf-lad, it was still a lot of work for him. Blaze chewed on the quandary of the elf's presence for a long while. When Fang took a break after finishing the third wound, Blaze turned his head about and asked, "So, do you know what the doctor did to me exactly?"

"Didn't he tell you?" asked Fang. "Dr. Moridin is famous for talking to his patients."

If mad ramblings count as talking… thought Blaze. He said. "I didn't understand his technical speech. I just know that he put something in my spine… five somethings." Blaze could not hide the disgust in his voice.

Fang seemed to mull this over, obviously weighing what to share and how to put it in terms Blaze would understand. “The doctor has given you implants that are designed to make you grow faster than you normally would. But not only that. They should also increase your strength, speed, agility and even your adult size; all designed to make you the perfect fighting machine.”

Blaze could tell that the young elf was being deliberately vague, and of course, there had to be side effects that would soon become apparent. He was not even half a century old, but in the span of a year he'd grow up to larger than his normal adult size? A hot surge of anger burned through Blaze as he thought about how Dr. Moridin had violated him so. What the doctor had done, it was far worse than being whipped, having the pole shoved up his butt or any like that, but to be manipulated on such a basic level with no control meant that he would never forgive him.
111211121121111111121111111121111.title: Fang

choices: The fire drakes are moved a new communal pen
The drakes are moved somewhere else
1112111211211111111211111111211111.content:
“I suspect that you don’t care for what the doctor has done to you though, and that you wish you could flame us all to the powers below if you had the chance,” said Fang, taking a step back. “That you’d rather be back where you came from and none of this had ever happened.”

"What ever gave you that idea?" said Blaze sarcastically

“Yet ask yourself this, was your life back then anything truly worthwhile?” said Fang, now rising from the straw and puffing his thin chest a little.

“What are you talking about? Of course I’d rather have never gone through this crap!!” retorted Blaze angrily. He expected Fang to immediately reach for a shocking rune - or whatever defense he undoubtedly had with him - yet he did not.

“Really? Back then, you were a nobody, no different from any other drake and probably would have lived your life in obscurity. Feel free to tell me otherwise, but back then, I suspect you were probably a coward and rather timid and would have remained so most likely had we not intervened,” said Fang. Blaze was about to respond, but somehow he found himself paralyzed. Though he hated to admit it, in some ways he was right. Back at the orphanage, he’d always depended on Darzhja and Lady Ramoth to protect him, and when they weren’t there he’d panicked. When he’d been captured, he remember how much he had cried and whined and begged somebody to save him. It had actually been rather pathetic, now that he thought about it, and felt embarrassed and emasculated that he'd conducted himself in that manner.

“Make no mistake, the trial you have endured has been cruel, but would you not say that you have emerged as an individual of much stronger resolve, stronger of body and able to endure so much more hardship because of it? Would you not agree that situations that you would have quailed at before you would have jumped forward to take on now?” he continued on.

Blaze could not help but gape with stunned silence. Thinking back upon it, were he the individual he was now when the attack came, he would have killed those kidnappers on the spot, or rather he would have tried to help Darzhja and Kaj rescue people from the rubble no matter what it took.

“So you see Flamer-7,” said Fang, “This is what the Kleaves are all about. We give you hardship because we want you to be strong. If you prove yourself, then you shall be the first of a master race of Dragonkind that will sweep away the decadence of New Alveri and herald in a new order…”

Blaze grit his teeth. “I’m not so easily convinced as that Fang. I’m not that gullible or that stupid…”

Fang folded his arms, “I didn’t expect I’d be able to convince you of our mission so easily Flamer-7. However, the point is that I made you think about it, I made you doubt, even if for a brief moment, whereas before you didn’t do so at all am I correct?”

Right then, Blaze realized that he’d underestimated Fang. He wasn’t a madman like Moridin, or a cruel brute like Wolf, but the way he spoke was calm and logical. He could read emotions and get the sense of who they were, and could do so without seeming intimidating. Of all the Kleaves he’d met so far, this one was certainly… different from the others.

Fang let out a large breath. "Anyways, enough with that. I still have two more of these things to fix."

And Fang did fix them, wielding his knife and his hands with great skill and care. The last two were not even as painful and the previous ones. Fang obviously learned quickly and also cared about Blaze's comfort at least enough to improve his style. Once, he used a pair of tongs to remove an ingrown scale. It hurt worse than a hair being plucked - the roots reaching far deeper than the mammalian counterpart - and it bled significantly. Blaze noticed that Fang sopped up this fresh blood with a different cloth as he applied pressure. When it stopped, he pocketed that cloth along with the removed scale. He apologized for the discomfort, but said that it was better to take care of that now, rather than waiting. Blaze said nothing of the tokens the elf had pocketed from his body.

The door clanged shut as the elf departed. He had tossed the rags and old strings into Blaze's sandbox to be picked up later, so he carried nothing more with him than he came with; again aside from the scale and the cloth soaked in Blaze's blood. "It's been very nice speaking with you, Flamer-7." said Fang. "Good night."

Blaze eyed the young elf. "Aren't you going to go see the other drakes?"

Fang paused in his step and looked around them. "Who? Them?" Then the elf got a rather devious smile on his face. "Let me just say that I have a special interest in you, New Alverian." He winked at Blaze as the dragon's jaw dropped slightly. "Why do you think I'm here in the middle of the night?"

The elf said nothing more as he stepped soundlessly out and down the dark passage. As he turned the corner out into the main branch, Blaze saw a sudden illumination flicker to life down the way the elf had gone. The drake figured he must have lit a torch.

The young fire-drake had a lot of things to think about as he rose from the straw, turned several times and resettled himself on his hay pile. The least of which was the prospect of somehow reaching his adult size in just one year and whatever physiological side effects he might suffer for Dr. Moridin's experiment. However, Blaze did not think about that so much as he thought about Fang and his words. He put an interesting spin on what was happening here in this hidden mountain facility on a faraway isle. The idea that the Kleaves were actually trying to make him into a better stronger dragon was slightly more contemplative now that he was not having a stick shoved up his vent every other day. But still… Fang was crazy if he thought he was going to come around to their view of things… ever? Yes, ever! thought Blaze determinedly. He sighed, feeling exhausted mentally as well as physically.

Staring emptily across the darkened chamber, Blaze tried to drag himself back down into peaceful sleep. He was interrupted, however when he noticed a pair of faint glimmers. They were in Flamer-8's cell! One of the glimmers winked at him. Blaze winked back. What else could he do?
1112111211211111111211111111211111.title: Doubt

choices: Wolf and Blaze enter the former harem
11121112112111111112111111112111111.content:
Three days after Blaze had his stitches out - and after being serviced by medical assistants trimming the uneven scales over the healed wounds - the drake's back was as smooth as comely as it had ever been... save for the five, small smooth mounds where the implants lay instead of his natural vertebrae. Dr. Moridin himself came down to the pens that day to perform the last physicals himself. The silver haired elf looked at their tongues and teeth, examined them in arcane ways with his silver neural whip, and drew blood. At the end of it all, he declared Blaze healthy and fully recovered. "He's ready for stage two." said the elf to Auyandrith as he exited the cell.

She entered his cell then as Dr. Moridin moved on. The lithe female pacified him without even speaking to him. As Blaze lay tormented on the ground, quivering and afraid to move for fear of eliciting more pain from the cruel assistant, they brought out the needles. Auyandrith and four other elves used frighteningly large syringes, almost a liter in volume, on each little mound along his spine. They injected just to the side of the hard lumps and to Blaze it felt like ice that spread first along his spine and then creeping outwards into his body. It was over in a few moments, but Blaze was dealing with the aftereffects long after the elves left his cell.

They did the same for all of them, one injection for each implant; which meant three for Flamer-8, seven for Flamer-6 and a dozen for Flamer-2. The muscular fire-drake was done last and he howled for hours after the elves had left, screaming that his insides were freezing, screaming for mercy.

As for Flamer-6, Blaze was surprised that Dr. Moridin declared him healthy and approved the next step. He felt sure that the doctor should have noticed his issues when he was examining them with his fiendish device. But then, as Blaze recalled, Dr. Moridin had not used the word "healthy" when he dictated his status to Auyandrith for transcription. He'd only said "recovered from surgery." Flamer-6, if he was in great pain, suffered in silence. Blaze noticed, during the scant times when the dragon moved - that his jerky motion, which had been getting better, was now as bad as it had been right after surgery; if not worse.

Blaze was envious of Flamer-8 who stood at the bars apparently oblivious of what each drake was going through. He tried several times to ask what Blaze was going through, but the younger drake ignored him. He just wanted to lay on his mat and wait for the hurting to go away... if it would.

The coldness crept through his veins, speading down his shoulders and huanches. Blaze shivered and even resorted to blowing embers onto his limbs and torso to relieve the pervieced freezing. It didn't really help, the oily fire sliding off his scales, now restored to a healthy luster with a healthy diet. In time, the dread cold left his spine and eased in the rest of his body. Instead rather than cold, Blaze felt a strong tingling as well as pins and needles in the muscles of his shoulders and back and his haunches as well. Blaze shuddered and twitched his legs uncontrollably off and on through the night. it hurt. Ice turned later to heat that Blaze could feel in his muscles and bones. Muscles rippled up and down his body, twitching of their own accord. The drake tired and fatigued, even though he was just lying there, but the twitching would not stop.

The worst, however was the aching in his skeleton. It felt almost as if the bones were being pulled on by some phantasmal force. Blaze almost thought that his bones were being broken, micron by micron and that by morning, he would be a scaly sac of broken pieces and nothing more.

But by morning, most of the symptoms had passed. Blaze got unsteadily to his feet afraid of broken bones, but having to confirm for himself what had happened. His legs felt fine, they ached, but felt stable, strong. Blaze lifted his head and wobbled a little. The room looked strange. It was the same... but different. After careful analysis, Blaze realized the difference. He was looking down on it from a slightly different vantage. He'd grown several inches in the night! He realized one other thing. He was ravenous.

Wolf came walking down the hallway, a shovel over one shoulder, the chain of a troll slave connected to the collar of another. Despite the fact that he'd eaten last night, his pangs were so bad, Blaze was moved to speak to the handler. "Master Wolf, Dr. Moridin did something to us yesterday and now I am dying of hunger. Please can you bring us some fish?"

The man stopped and yanked on the chain to bring the troll to his knees. As he was looking at Blaze, Flamer-6 spoke. "Please, some fish for me too, Master Wolf!"

"Get me some beef, human!" Flamer-2 commented as well.

Wolf covered his ears with the dragon voices booming at him. "Alright! Alright!" he shouted over the din. "The doctor told me you'd all be needing extra rations anyways." The human stomped down the hall to his office, left the troll chained outside like a dog and jogged down to the main course. It took too long, but everything seemed to get better when Blaze had a big tunny in each paw.

While he was eating and standing, Blaze was free of pain, however when he laid back down, the twitching and aching in his muscles and bones slowly resumed. Standing and pacing helped as well as excercise. Blaze saw Flamer-2 doing push-ups in his cell across the way and the young drake copied him. Physical activity kept the pins and needles at bay... However, Blaze foresaw another long night ahead of him.

Blaze shuddered when Dr. Moridin returned that day to see the effects of the injections. He had only to lay a hand on the muscles of his shoulders, which were hot to the tough, before a wide grin spread on his thin face. "Success!" he declared and gave Blaze a pat. The dragon struggled to keep from snarling down at the dread doctor. "One step closer to greatness, my friend. One step closer..." he said.

The check-up was cursory, but there would be more to come. That one day had one final surprise in store for the restless drakes. A dwarvish courier came puffing along the hallway and entered Wolf's office about three hours before regular feeding time; Blaze was already getting hungry again. Fifteen minutes later Wolf burst out of his tiny closet office with a huge grin on his face. He rattled his regular beating club along the bars of the cells. "Congratulations, drakes! We're moving out!"

It happened quickly. Blaze not having any worldly possesions to speak of, was simply walked to his new living place. Blaze noticed that Wolf chose him as first to go. Walking felt better than pacing for keeping the weird effects of the drugs he'd been injected with at bay. Despite having been moving about all day, Blaze felt energetic and restless as he walked along with Wolf down the twisting stone hallways of the complex. His tail waved high behind him. The prospect of a new living place - much better than his old cell, Wolf assured him - seemed almost like a grand adventure. Blaze spoke with anticipation in his voice. "Master Wolf?" he started.

"You may speak, Flamer-7" said the human, continuing to lead the way through the tunnels.

"Where is this place we're going? Why are we being moved now?" The words tumbled out of his mouth and caused the human ahead of him to look over his shoulder back at him.

Shaking his head slightly, Wolf said, "Well, as for where we're going, it's actually Lord Azimoth's old harem. It'll be your temporary quarters until the final decision is made."

That seemed to answer both questions. The prospect of living in a former harem tickled oddly in the back of Blaze's mind and seemed a little funny. However he had no real problem with it, as long as it meant more space to move around in. Flamer-2 on the other hand... Blaze smirked, imagining the more macho drake's reaction to being housed in former female quarters. His thoughts still prickling in his head, Blaze was moved to ask, "What's going to happen with our old cells?"

Wolf responded more readily. "That space is being converted into more living space for our warrens. It's been years coming. The elves seem to think it fine and proper that our ring has devolved into slums through over population. Arrogant bastards."

Blaze knew better than to comment of Wolf's irreverence. They were both subsidiaries to the elves... some more than others, unfortunately.

Blaze and Wolf entered the main course several levels higher than where they had been. However, this passage was a little different from the level where the fire-drakka were being house. Wolf brought Blaze to a heavy iron door much larger than what a fire-drake needed. Wolf, in leiu of trolls slaves to assist him, commanded Blaze to open the door after he unlocked the thing with a pass-brooch. Blaze was eager and put his back into the effort to move the heavy thing. It was three feet thick and solid dwarvish construction. A more effective barrier, Blaze had not yet seen. Despite its being well balenced, it took his dragon's strength to fight the door's sheer inertia. Once it began to move, it shifted gracefully and silently, revealing a grand chamber beyond...
11121112112111111112111111112111111.title: Stage-Two

111211121121111111121111111121111111.content:
Blaze's eyes went open with wonder as he surveyed the new facility. Of course, compared to his quarters back in the orphanage it was still rather spartan, yet having been enclosed in a smelly cell this was almost heaven. The chamber was roughly circular in shape. In the center of the chamber was a flat platform, and surrounding it was a odd assortment of uneven ledges and rock formations.

"I'm going back to fetch the others now... feel free to look around if you want..." said Wolf. Wolf retreated through the thick metal doors, leaving Blaze alone. It was a very odd feeling to be by himself, without a human watching over him. Yet Blaze paused; he could not make the assumption that he was not being watched; the Kleaves were anything but stupid. Still, there was a new sense that he was more in control of his own destiny now.

Hanging from the ceiling were strong metal beams, which by the looks of them were easily strong enough to support the weight of a full-grown Sky-Swallower. Blaze peered down one of the side passages, leading to latrine. Having a real bathroom with even a modest amount of privacy was a real improvement than shitting into a sand-pit, and decided to take the time to relieve himself. The large pool, though, looked very inviting. Briefly, he fantasized about jumping in with one of the females, while fucking her all the while. The slight, lingering scent of females suggested that for Lord Azimoth, this had not been but an idle fantasy…

That wasn’t something that he could afford to fantasize about. Yet the most distinguishing feature of the former harem was the lack of walls. There would be nothing to separate from himself and the others, in particular Flamer-2, which nobody wanted to be close to even with a moistened 15 foot long pole. They would have to share the chamber, and while he didn't expect too much trouble from Flamer-6 or 8 Flamer-2 was a different story. He needed a good spot where he could draw the line.

He dashed to one of the corners. It was a raised outcropping of rock that gave him a clear view of the chamber, with relatively close access to the latrine chamber. One of the most deeply ingrained instincts for dragon-kind when searching for territory was to seize the high ground.

Right then, Flamer-8 entered the chamber, and like Blaze was at first taken aback by the size of the former harem chambers.

"I claim this spot!!" Blaze declared, his body crouched down to defend all comers.

Flamer-8 gave Blaze a strange look, but he quickly realized what was going on.

“Fine…whatever,” he stated. He shifted his gaze toward a similar raised outcropping toward Blaze’s right.

“I’ll get this corner then,” he stated, eyes narrowing. “So long as you don’t try and get into my space, we won’t have any problems right?”

“Nope…” answered Blaze.

Right then, Flamer-2 burst into the chamber, smoke billowing from his nostrils.

“All this side is mine!!” roared Flamer-2. Blaze puffed disdainfully. It was very like Flamer-2 to immediately take the rest of the territory for himself. Yet Blaze wasn’t willing to fight Flamer-2 for it; he was the physically strongest after all.

Finally, Flamer-6 limped into the chamber. He gazed toward each of the drakes, yet Blaze could tell there were plans going through his mind.

“I’ll…get this spot then…” he stated. Flamer-6 made his way toward a depression in the ‘no mans land’ between Blaze and Flamer-8. Blaze was puzzled. This was not a very advantageous spot, from the look of it

“Ha!! I still got the most territory out of all of you combined!!” boasted Flamer-2.

“Yet also the least defensible…” commented Flamer-6.

Flamer-2 tensed, “What was that?”

“N-nothing,” answered Flamer-6, curving his head away submissively.

The big drake snorted and puffed out his chest, “That’s what I thought cripple…”

Yet Blaze sensed that Flamer-6 had some sort of plan in mind; one that would make up for his physical handicap. Blaze could freely admit that out of all the drakes, Flamer-6 was the most intelligent among them, and now he was in an environment where he could make use of it. Blaze took another look at the spot Flamer-6 had situated himself in. Flamer-6 must have anticipated that he and Flamer-8 would array themselves in such a manner that would best be able to counter Flamer-2, and that Flamer-6 placed himself in between to be an arbiter between the two.

Right then, the door opened again, revealing a huge cage filled with trolls. They looked understandably frightened, gazing up at the drakes with watery eyes. The grate opened and they wandered out dazedly.

“Trolls?” growled Flamer-8 with disdain, “Why will there be trolls in our chamber?”

Wolf grunted, “They’re here to pick up after you. In fact, you may do what you wish with these slaves.”

“I guess its unavoidable then…” snapped Blaze. He curved toward the trolls. “You can pass through my territory but I don’t want you sleeping in my spot. If any of you defecate in my territory you’ll pay for it got it?”

They all nodded.

“You all look so tasty…” snarled Flamer-2, his teeth showing. Blaze immediately expected Wolf to reach for the shocker, but instead, answered casually, “You are allowed to eat them for sustenance if you so wish…”

A bestial glint emerged in Flamer-2’s eyes. “Don’t mind if I do then…”

That immediately sent forth a burst of panic through the troll slaves, scattering in all directions. Flamer-2 reached forth and snatched one of them with his jaw, snapping it shut and chomping down with relish.

“Yeah!! Get in my belly!!” he bellowed through bloody teeth.

“By the Ancestors!! Y-you fucking savage!!” growled Blaze, both outraged and horrified. In New Alveri, eating a humanoid was a crime that resulted in centuries-long dungeon sentences at the very least and oftentimes death, not to mention a taboo amongst all civilized dragons. The thought of eating a humanoid, even trolls who had once rebelled against the dragons, was utterly abhorrent to him.

Flamer-8 looked similarly horrified.

“May Gyramond save his poor soul…” he muttered under his breath. Blaze wasn’t sure whether Flamer-8 was talking about the poor consumed troll, or Flamer-2. Blaze and Flamer-8’s gaze met and they gave each other a mutual nod. No matter what happened, Flamer-2 could not be allowed to become the breeder male.

Yet Blaze had the horrible sneaking feeling that sooner or later, a troll may one day be filling his belly. When put in that sense, perhaps the change of venue wasn’t that much better at all…
111211121121111111121111111121111111.title: Territorial ambitions

1112111211211111111211111111211111112.content:
Blaze was especially watchful that first night for an attack by Flamer-2. However the muscular fire-drake's bloodlust seemed satisfied - for the moment at least - by the killing of the first troll slave. Flamer-2 was content to wander about his half of the former harem, pacing up and down the uneven ridges and curves of the natural stone. He pissed on every prominance like a dog, his acidic reek filling the large vault and threatening to overwhelm the other subtler scents. Blaze grimaced at the base activity - in New Alveri, dragons had learned to carve glyphs into their property and no longer used crude scent marks - however, Flamer-8 soon crawled down from his ledge and scribed his scent mark at the base. Flamer-6 followed suit. With a sigh of disgust, Blaze realized that his claim was in danger if not thoroughly marked as well. Gripping the stone with his paws, he creapt down and made his liquid mark. Flamer-2 looked on smugly and seemed to relish in the fact that this debasement hurt Blaze. It only took about about five hours for Blaze's nose to adjust to the melange of combating smells in the room.

The other occupants in the large chamber either huddled down naked, or nearly so, in the flat tiled center of the room - which by fast instinctive consensus was now common ground - or else had crawled into the cracks in the other three dragons' small territories. They shivered and stunk so Blaze did not want them on his ledge. When one came crawling up, he poked it gently in the chest with the tip of his tail. The troll got the message, although Blaze allowed the trolls free passage through the rocks at the base of his prominence. Honestly, though, Blaze was not even certain why the trolls were here. He'd gotten along just fine so far with no slaves, either here in captivity or back at the orphanage. Indeed, there seemed little use for the creatures except for the one which Flamer-2 had already exercised, much to Blaze's horror.

Flamer-8 was largely indifferent to the trolls as well, though he let them up on his smaller and more uneven ledge. However, Flamer-6 who had situated himself on the low ground between Blaze and Flamer-8 actually went out of his way to develop rapport with the poor wretches. Blaze figured that Flamer-6 recognized his own weakness and was trying to foment strength whereever he could. The young drake sniffed in mild pity both for the trolls and for Flamer-6. Some of the symptoms which had been getting better with treatment came back with a relish for the maimed fire-drake. When he moved, it was with a palsy and he had developed a stutter now as well. At some point in time, he'd seemed to have another stroke for his left wing was always hanging a little open now and his limp was worse. Blaze gritted his teeth every time he examined him like this. The Kleaves had done this to him. It could have just as easily been Blaze himself!

He sat down there, chatting with four trolls in a language that Blaze did not understand. Blaze realized that he still knew next to nothing about Flamer-6's background. The trolls laughed then, holding their bellies. A couple looked up from the "safe" ground in the center of the room and wandered over, expanding Flamer-6's crowd. He worked fast, Blaze had to give him that.

Looking across the room, Flamer-2 sprawled, seeming to try to take up as much space as possible. He'd taken all of the remaining space beyond Blaze and Flamer-8 mounts as his own, but there was nothing much in the way steep defensible ledges in his area. He probably assumed he'd be the one attacking rather than attacked. He'd probably be right. The trolls kept well away from him, that is, until Wolf came back that evening.

Before in the cages, Wolf and his team of dwarf butchers had divvied up each allotment of food to each dragon. Now, however, he rode in on a mule driven cart with just one assistant. Using some sort of magical motor, the cart's bed tilted and dumped a pile of fish onto the floor. The trolls there scattered and Flamer-2 immediately began snaking his way towards the food.

Wolf, obnoxious as ever, rang a cow bell before turning his cart about. "Come and get it!" he shouted and then turned the cart down the straight tile path which led through Flamer-2's side of the room to the big iron door. All of the dragons were moving before it clanged shut.

Flamer-2 was the closest, but Blaze and Flamer-8 approached him from the high ground and on opposite flanks. He growled and showed fangs as long as a troll's forearm, eyeing them both. "I-" he started, but Blaze interupted with a roar.

The young fire drake puffed out his chest, a feeling of power coursing through his body and said. "You'll not claim anything, Flamer-2! This is all our food."

Flamer-2 sneered. "It's in my territory."

Flamer-8 opened his fanged mouth and snapped rudely in Flamer-2's direction. "This is common ground! We agreed earlier!"

"I don't care..." growled the muscular drake menacingly. He hissed. "It's all mine, so go back to your rocks, fags or get in my way."

Blaze chose the later of the two. He glanced aside at Flamer-8 and the older drake nodded slightly. They were agreed... for just the moment.

Flamer-2 snarled and snapped, and lifted his tail aggressively as the other two walked towards him on opposite sides. "The dragon must be mad!" thought Blaze. "We're giving all the signals and he's still not backing down! Does he really think he can take us both?"

Apparently he did and needed to be taught a lesson. With another glance at Flamer-8, they attacked. Blaze when high, Flamer-8 low. Blaze half expected to topple the dragon, but his new weight in muscle kept him grounded. Blaze tackled Flamer-2 at his shoulder, his heavy claws banging against the surface of the dragon's armor. Blaze didn't even try to break through, but he knew from scuffling that bruises under the scales hurt nonetheless. Flamer-2 would have retaliated with a bite, but Flamer-8 threatened him from below with his own jaws. Flamer-8 made to bite Flamer-2's leg, but the heavier drake whipped his tail around and gave the older one a good bash right on his shoulders. Blaze made good use of the opening and bit down on Flamer-2's exposed haunch.

The dragon yowled and elbowed Blaze in the jaw. Blaze hissed and let go before he could recieve another blow. Surprisingly, it didn't hurt as much as he thought it would have. Flamer-2 retreated, threatening with jaws and tail, but it was already over, the two dragons backed away slowly to where the fish was. Flamer-2's eyes swivled madly between the two of them. Obviously he had expected them to follow when he backed away. Now he realized his error. He roared beastly at them, but neither he nor Flamer-8 paid him mind, though both kept an eye on him as he sulked in his rocky territory.
1112111211211111111211111111211111112.title: Feeding Frenzy

choices: Go for a swim in the morning
11121112112111111112111111112111111121.content:
By old tradition, the fish pile now belonged evenly to Blaze and Flamer-8. However, Blaze raised a paw as the older drake began to divide the pile with his tail. Flamer-8 showed his teeth at him. "You too? I'll teach you. If you need teaching."

Blaze shook his head. "No. I don't want to fight. But we can't take all the fish."

"Why not? We won it." said the former feral drake. Blaze supposed it was not uncommon to settle disputes like this out in rurals surrounding New Alveri.

Blaze sighed, trying to find a way to explain this. He turned an eye to Flamer-6 who had not moved during the whole affair. Most of the trolls cowered behind his bulk. "If we take all the fish, it's going to be non-stop war between us. We'll be doing this every meal... which is exactly what they want!"

Flamer-8 lowered his head in thought. Blaze noted that the older drake had put on weight as well, showing in his shoulders and haunches; though his change in height was not nearly so dramatic as any of the other drake's. when he lifted his eyes, they burned slightly.
