"Do we have to share with that animal?" he asked.

Blaze let out another sigh. He pushed his head forward emphatically. "We have to. Or else he's going to be even more vicious next time... and he'll probably kill more of the trolls as well."

"We're just placating him..." said Flamer-8 with disgust.

"No." said Blaze more assuredly than he felt, "We're just... working out a truce."

Flamer-8 shook his head. "That's not the way he'll see it. He'll think we're offering him tribute."

Blaze snarled at the thought, but said. "There's no helping that. But we're the ones with the opportunity to at least try not to live like animals."

Flamer-8 hissed and twisted his neck, agonizing over the decision. It finally seemed that his old self won out in the end, for he spat, "Fine! We'll share... with everyone."

In the end, Blaze and Flamer-8 took about 65% of the fish with three and a half tunnies for each of them. Both of them remained overseeing the flat arena against Flamer-2 who continued to pace and eye them like a tiger in a pen. Blaze invited Flamer-6 to eat. "Eat half and no more." Blaze instructed.

Flamer-6 limped up, walking as straight as he could over the uneven rocks. He nosed his portion of fish, then glanced back to his hollow. "W-what about the t-t-trolls?" he asked eyes sharp despite the new stutter.

Flamer-8 glared at him. "If you feel like sharing, go ahead." Blaze did not contradict him. So Flamer-6 ate right there, gulping down what the other two had left behind. Blaze growled at the lame dragon when he approached his quota. Flamer-6 scooped up the last three fish, some small saltwater bass only 2.5 feet in length, in his mouth. surprisingly, he carried these back to his new friends and dropped them on the floor. The trolls fell on the fish and released loud tribal howls of gratitude. Blaze frowned.

Together, Blaze and Flamer-8 climbed up to their seats of power, both of their bellies full and visibly distended. Their pact just now was at an end, the young drake knew. but Blaze thought that Flamer-8 and he shared a lot of the same goals, one of which being to make sure that Flamer-2 was soon parted from his testicles and left the vicinity for good. However, that did not make Flamer-8 his friend. Only one drake was leaving here intact, that much was impossible to forget.

Flamer-2 came to the center of the room as soon as it was apparent Blaze and Flamer-8 had left. He greedily devoured the remains of the fish, even going so far as to lick some of the slime off of the tiles. As predicted, he showed no signs of gratitude, but rather exuded smugness that they'd left him something at all. He eyed the trolls sitting around Flamer-6 hungrily like an animal. However, he had the sense to see both Blaze and Flamer-8 sitting above him and so moved back out into his rocks. Apparently even the mad dragon had had enough fighting for one evening.

Blaze slept, but kept one eye open for danger. It was an old dragon art and one that Blaze had never taken very seriously in his life. However now, he saw its invaluableness. Blaze doubted he'd be shutting both eyes again from now on...
11121112112111111112111111112111111121.title: Albacore Conventions

choices: Blaze is further disciplined for his defiance
111211121121111111121111111121111111212.content:
“What!? No food!?” screamed Blaze with outrage.

“Orders came from higher ups Flamer-7,” cried Wolf, “In fact, you’re scheduled to take a trial right now.”

Blaze ground his teeth. A couple of days before, he’d been administered a new round of injections, leaving him with that horrendous, ravenous hunger. He was in no mood for a trial whatsoever. Yet he was disciplined enough to keep his cool and follow Wolf down the corridors. If Wolf didn’t have food after completing the trial, then there’d really be hell to pay…

He was puzzled when Wolf was leading Blaze back to the old prison block. Blaze made his way inside, and a moment later he found himself in the center of the room, while Wolf and his handlers ascended from a protected viewing block.

“What’s the meaning of this?” he snarled.

That’s when he spotted a group of trolls languishing within the prison blocks. Even considering the typically squalid condition of them, these looked in especially bad state. They groaned and trilled and hissed like rabid animals.

“These trolls are all condemned to death for various misdemeanors. They’re murderers, cannibals, rapists, thieves and outcasts even amongst their peers. Their only chance at freedom is if they kill you,” explained Blaze.

Blaze dug his claws into the dirt. “So, its either I kill them or they kill me is that it? You’re testing me to see how well you can fight…” he growled. Wolf nodded.

He was both anxious and excited. Excited, because he’d finally be able to put his body to use, but also worried because of his lack of actual experience. Back at the orphanage, Darzhja would force Blaze to be her sparring partner at Markus’ fighting ring if there was nobody else available at the moment. He’d lost every single time against her, and rather badly at that, but he had memorized a few basic moves. Hopefully, those would do him good here.

Fortunately, the opponents he faced weren’t exactly what you would call formidable. There was a group of about ten half-naked, emaciated trolls surrounding him, armed with rather crude stone axes. Yet there was a bestial desperation in their eyes, mixed in with their obvious fear and dismay. He wouldn’t take any pleasure in killing them, but it was one of those things he had to do.

“Fine, but you better give me some food afterwards you hear!!” snapped Blaze. His gnawing hunger really put him in the mood for killing. Wolf let out a barely suppressed chortle through the voice amplifier. Blaze then shifted his gaze back toward the trolls, not able to help but note how tasty they looked…

Blaze’s eyes suddenly went wide with horror. The trolls… were to be his food.

“Ah…so now you understand what’s going on now eh?” grunted Wolf with a cruel chuckle. “The higher ups have started to get worried that you might be getting a little squeamish. You don’t have to eat them if you don’t want to, but unless you prefer to starve that’s all the food you’re getting for the next week!!”

Blaze ground his teeth together. This wasn’t a test purely to see how well he could fight, but also a test of his ruthlessness; in order to turn him a little bit more into Flamer-2.

There was no more time to think though, as the prison door sprung open with a squeak. All ten of the trolls instantly charged at Blaze with a blind, desperate rage, axes raised over their head. Their desperate ferocity caught Blaze aback for a brief moment, and it sank in that these trolls truly did mean to kill him.

Instincts kicked in. Eyes narrowed, Blaze reared back and threw his neck forward and let loose a powerful beam of fire. The unfortunate trolls in the center of the blast were instantly vaporized into charred, blackened husks. A couple others that had been on the outskirts of the flaming breath screamed and howled and writhed about as their bodies caught fire before mercifully falling still.

That left only three trolls left.

One of the trolls that managed to avoid the fire blast was now within range with his axe. Even though a blow with a crude stone axe would have been pathetically futile, Blaze wasn’t going to let his scales be touched if he could help it. Not by these troll scum. He swiped at the troll with his claw, and sent the troll’s corpse flying across the arena and smearing against the wall of the prison.

Two left.

Blaze snapped his gaze toward another troll, and it quavered under his gaze. His predatory instinct kicked in as his gaze focused on the troll prey. The humanoids often spoke of an innate draconic ability known as ‘Dragonfear’, which would render a foe into a state of panic. The dragon would emit brain waves to paralyze the nervous system of its intended prey, and this applied to the unfortunate troll victim here. Blaze leapt forward and bludgeoned its body with its tail, feeling its bones break from the blow and its skull cracking open as it hit head first against the wall.

One left…

The last troll, panic seizing it, threw down its axe and tried to make a run for it. Unfortunately, there was nowhere for the troll to run. Blaze quickly caught up to the troll, and as his shadow loomed over the troll, it stared at him with fearful eyes and uttered a pitiful whine.

“I…no want to die…” it uttered in broken basic tongue.

The pitiful response actually angered Blaze. It should have already known what type of place this was, and that it could be stupid enough to think that he’d get away with it. In fact, he may well be condemning his fellows by this act of fecklessness.

“Neither do I…” snapped Blaze. With that, Blaze crushed the troll under his claw with a roar, gritting his teeth. His forearm tensed as he pressed his weight down against the ground.

Blaze then took a step back and let out a grunt, surveying the carnage around him. There was an astonishing amount of blood, not to mention the smell of burnt meat. It only just occurred to Blaze that he had killed sentient creatures for the first time in his life, even if they were condemned troll slaves. As for how he felt about having taken the lives of those trolls, he hadn’t exactly felt especially proud of his grisly feat (and besides, killing trolls wasn’t exactly a feat of prowess that a drake would brag to his peers about) but he wouldn’t have lost sleep over that. Eating them on the other hand…

He gazed down at the troll corpses. His mouth watered desperately. Oh Ancestors, why did he have to be forced into that sort of position? Perhaps he could just wait it out. Yet he could not make that assumption. If he starved for morality’s sake, Flamer-2 would take advantage. No…he had to survive, even if it meant eating trolls. Besides, they were criminals, murderers… Nobody would miss them. At least they’d be put to good use by serving as sustenance. Or so Blaze told himself over and over.

“Forgive me Ancestors…” sighed Blaze.

He scooped up the unburnt corpses and dragged them to the corner of the former prison block, where as little of him as possible would be seen conducting the grisly deed.

“Just put it in your mouth…” he whispered to himself. Shutting his eyes tight, he tossed the troll corpse into his mouth and began to chew. As the blood and guts sloshed in his jaw, he felt horrified that the taste was not bad at all. Despite all his misgivings, his hunger got the better of him and swallowed. Before the establishment of the knights, dragons eating humanoids was far from uncommon. Had they tasted awful, it wouldn’t have been so widespread.

Eating the second corpse was not nearly so hard as eating the first, and then Blaze scooped up the third, swallowing it right afterwards. He spat upon the ground, desperately trying to get the taste of troll off his tongue, yet it would not go away. Yet his stomach didn’t protest the same way his mind did, as the consumed troll settled nicely in his belly.

“I’m not a beast… I’m not a beast…” Blaze whispered to himself.

Blaze glared up at Wolf with hate-filled eyes.

“Don’t…ever…make me do that again…” he snarled.

“I don’t see what the whole fuss is about. They were going to be dead anyhow nor are they little more than animals…” said Wolf casually.

“So that’s how you see it? When you put it that way, humanoids may well be little more than animals to us dragons. One day if you’re unlucky, you might be the one who finds himself on the menu…” growled Blaze.

“Is that a threat?” snapped Wolf, hand upon the shocking amulet. Blaze didn’t care if he did get shocked at this point.

“Think about it. Trolls are on the lowest level of the humanoid chart. Once we get used to eating trolls, then it’ll be orcs or hobbits. Who’s to say that in order to make us more savage the elves will decide to use… I don’t know, dwarves, or humans? You don’t think someone like Flamer-2 wouldn’t have any qualms about that?”

Wolf’s face darkened and Blaze was answered with a sharp electric shock. His vision went white as Blaze let out a scream as he kicked and writhed upon the ground.

“You shut that big mouth of yours this instant you understand Flamer-7? Be lucky that you’re getting off easy!!” screamed Wolf. Yet he no longer had that look of relish on his face, but one of uneasiness. Blaze had gotten his point through, which was all that mattered.
111211121121111111121111111121111111212.title: Hunger Games

choices: A scuffle breaks out between Flamer-2 and Flamer-6
Blaze is called to visit Dr. Moridin again
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.content:
Blaze returned to the communal lair feeling numb. He’d just eaten trolls. Sentient beings. The fact tormented him to no end, and the scene replayed in his mind again and again.

“So, how’d your trial go?” asked Flamer-8.

“I’d rather not think about it right now…” he sighed, as he retreated to his ledge.

Flamer-2 sniffed the air, and then grinned at Blaze's low spirits.

"I smell troll on your breath. They sure taste so good don't they?" he taunted. Flamer-8’s eyes widened with shock, and all Blaze could do was keep his head down and stew in his guilt as Flamer-2 lounged against the rocks and burst out in malicious laughter. His gaze flashed toward the trolls seeking shelter with a slumbering Flamer-6. They were murmuring and laughing with one another, like regular humanoids rather than slaves, and Blaze felt even guiltier than he did before. Thankfully, they were ignorant of draconic, so they didn’t know of Blaze’s grisly deed.

“I wouldn’t worry too much about it Flamer-7,” said Flamer-8, “You did what you had to do. If anyone’s to blame it’s the Kleaves…”

“Right…” nodded Blaze. That argument felt hollow though. Though he’d been starving, it had still been his conscious decision to eat the trolls. The Ancestors would definitely not look favorably on that. Their taste was still in his mouth while crusted blood still lingered on his claws.

“I…need to go use the wash myself off now,” stammered Blaze.

“Don’t you mean go and jack off?” Flamer-2 chortled, “That’s what you do when you get all emotional like that. Don’t deny it Flamer-7.”

Blaze eyes narrowed. When they weren’t being put through trials, physical labor or exercises, it was those unspoken things that the drakes did from time to time to stave off their extreme boredom, and as usual, only Flamer-2 was the one who was an asshole about it.

“No…I’m going to take a bath, not that you’ve ever heard of concept before” he snarled, before stalking off. There was a half-truth to that, as during the past few weeks they’d shared the chamber now, he didn’t remember Flamer-2 ever using the washing room once. The only good thing about it was that Blaze didn’t have to worry about sharing the washing room with Flamer-2, so the he and Flamers 6 and 8 had been able to designate a schedule.

When he arrived, he took a moment to pray to the Ancestor for forgiveness for his transgressions. He’d never been particularly pious before, yet in a place such as this the Ancestors gave him solace. Hopefully, when, or rather, if he ever got out of here with his balls intact, he’d get the chance to redeem himself of his sins.

He breathed a slight plumb of fire onto the bathing pool, satisfied when it began to steam merrily. Sighing, he stepped inside and began to furiously scrub himself. Of course, one never got truly clean as the plumbing and filtration wasn’t exactly up to New Alverian standards, but it was better than nothing. Besides, it was one of the few places where he could have the luxury to think idly to himself.

It had been about roughly half a year since the day of the attack on New Alveri. Half a year since the Kleaves had captured him. He thought about all of his friends back at the orphanage; Darzhja, Iskierka and Ophelia. Of course, this was assuming that Iskierka had survived after being crushed by the roof of the artist guild. Yet if she had, her fate was still far better than what Blaze had gone through.

Thinking back to that day, he remembered that Darzhja was about to leave the orphanage for good and that she had gone off to challenge Kaj to a fight before going to the Temple to become a Knight for real. Darzhja was an extremely stubborn and determined individual; Blaze wouldn’t have been surprised at all that she was a Knight by now. He wondered if she and everyone else all still were hoping to find him or that they had given him up for dead. Of course, if Blaze ever did reunite with his old friends, considering what he may well have become they may have very well wished that he had died during the attack.

Blaze let out a sigh. The mischievous, goody-two shoes Blaze they had known was no more, burned away by the cruelty, torture and hardship of the Kleaves. He wondered whether if he’d even have a place within the civilized society of New Alveri anymore, and if he didn’t, what he’d do with his life. Again, he still had to survive to reach that point, so he’d deal with that when the time came.

As he once again thought back on his voyage to the island of the Kleaves, he also reminisced about his ship-borne companion Jinx. If he was still alive, the small but cunning barbarian must have been somewhere on this very same island within a communal lair very much like his own. Yet even on those horrid days in the ship, there had not only raging, vengeful fire in his eyes, but a vengeance that knew exactly who he was to direct it against, along with each step in the plan along the way. Blaze didn’t have any doubts that he’d become the breeder male of his species, nor that Jinx would ever get turned by the Kleaves.

My name, is Jinxieregoth of the Colshek Clan!! And I will have MY REVENGE!! he pictured the nomad bellow with his trilling accent. The thought of a dragon that small having so much raging vengeance was oddly amusing, and he couldn’t help but cough out a laugh.

By now, the water was starting to cool down a bit. He decided he’d spent enough time in the bathing pool, so he stepped out and shook himself dry. Right then, as he exited, there was a flurry of commotion out in the communal lair.
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.title: Wash away the guilt

1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.content:
Blaze was still dripping when he emerged from the pool and walked around to one of the two opposing exits at opposite sides of the bath. When he came out from around the wall, it was to a scene of carnage.

Out in the center of the room. Flamer-2 had a troll in his jaws; it hung limply, like a rag doll as the big dragon tossed his head to and fro. Even as Blaze watched, Flamer-2's eyes seemed to glow with relish as he used his tail to fling a frail troll body to break against the stone outcropping surrounding the round tiled center of the room. Flamer-2's ire seemed spent then, however a third troll appeared from the stones surrounding the flattened area. As it stood, Blaze heard a dragon's voice call out, "V-vol'shik, No!" Blaze's eyes widened a little as the troll brazenly threw a bit of sharpened stone down on onto the dragon in the middle of the room.

The sharpened stone throwing axe hit Flamer-2 about half a foot above his left eye. Any lower and he might have been permanently blinded in that eye. The fire-drake growled viciously and chomped down on the troll he had in his jaws. The blue skinned body split in two, blood pouring out of the drake's mouth and entrails dangling from his fangs. Flamer-2 did not bother making an aggressive display he simply turned and began flowing over the tiles towards the troll, who was already lining up a final shot with another axe.

Blaze frowned and prepared his soul for the sight of another sentient creature being brutally cut down by overwhelming force. "Why do they have to be so small and frail?" Blaze lamented. However, before Flamer-2 could get his claws to bear on the offending troll, something big and heavy slammed into Flamer-2's haunches, even as he was rearing up on the raise stone surrounding the arena. It was Flamer-6! And the lame dragon was incensed. Blaze began to run forward.

Flamer-2 collapsed with a roar and Flamer-6 was on him, but the dragon under him was bigger and heavier and had a brutal strength. His initial advantage did not last long as Flamer-2 bucked and threw the crippled drake off of him. Flamer-6 recovered slightly in midair using his wings... but his left did not open up quite enough to entirely prevent a fall. He wasted several more moments struggling to his feet and Flamer-2 thrashed around recovering from the initial surprise attack.

When he saw who it was who had assaulted him, Flamer-2 sneered, blood and guts still hanging from his teeth like an animal. He stepped deliberately on half a troll, smashing it under his scaled paw as he sauntered forward. "Looks like the cripple has come to be taught a lesson..." he drawled. As Flamer-6 got up, Blaze could see the weakness and unsteadiness in his left side. Flamer-2 continued. "But why? For these animals?" the brute tossed his muscular neck towards the blue skinned humanoid who was even then racing around the wide arena, trying to get in position for another futile strike.

Flamer-6 growled. "Y-you're the only animal around h-here."

Flamer-2 didn't respond. He just rushed forward, going directly for Flamer-6's left side. However the lame drake seemed to anticipate this. He feinted and moved out of the way just in time. His outstretched wing revealed a stone wall where the tile ended. Flamer-2 drove into it like a runaway locomotive. He hit it so hard that his horns became lodged in the stone. He grunted and pulled, stone cracking and crumbling where he set his terrible strength to work. He wouldn't remain trapped long.

By this time, Blaze had reached the arena. He stood with his front paws braced on the stone overlooking where the floor was flat and tiled. He wasn't sure if he should intervene. He wasn't the police here. Looking above, Blaze saw Flamer-8 looking down on the conflict with a mild grin. Obviously this was little more than entertainment for him. And really, either way things went, one rival was simply weakening another. Still, Blaze ground his teeth together. This wasn't right matching a lame dragon against a bull like Flamer-2. However things seemed to be going in the cripple's favor so far. Blaze decided to wait to intervene. Mildly he noted another bare skinned troll running along the raised perimeter of the center arena.

Instead of making the most of the seconds that Flamer-2 was trapped, Flamer-6 surprised Blaze by speaking. The young fire drake winced as the injured dragon seemed to egg Flamer-2 on still further. "They've g-gotten to you, Flamer-2! They've t-t-turned you into n-nothing more than a beast. A raging d-d-dog of war!"

Flamer-2 strained against the stone where his horns were lodged. "Shut up, you stuttering freak!" More stone crumbled around his head as his twisted and pulled his thick neck.

"D-do you even r-r-remember?" Do you st-st-" Flamer-6 started, but was interupted when Flamer-2 jerked his head free. The bigger drake whipped his head around, snapping at Flamer-6's throat. The lame drake's reaction speed left much to be desired. Flamer-6 was soon overwhelmed by strength and sheer vigor. The drake with the drooping left eye tried deflecting Flamer-2's snout with his tail at first, but then his attacker's own tail came to bear, striking Flamer-6's left foreleg. What might have merely inconvenienced Blaze or Flamer-8 knocked Flamer-6 to the ground. His foreleg seemed to tense up, going still and outstretched. Blaze wondered if Flamer-2 had hit a fragile nerve or something.

Flamer-6 did not seem to be in a lot of pain but his foreleg was useless now. He scrabbled across the ground pitifully, barely warding off lazy, but still overwhelming blows from Flamer-2's tail and claws. Finally the big drake planted his heavy claws on Flamer-6's chest. The lame drake hissed and flailed with his hind legs. Flamer-2, grinning cruelly bashed Flamer-6 with his tail across the hips until the kicking stopped; he pressed down with more weight on the prone dragon's chest. "This'll teach you your place, you defect, you crippled freak."

Flamer-6 hissed in pain. "I f-f-f-feel s-s-sorry f-f-for y-you." he stammered, his stuttering worse than ever.

Flamer-2 bared his teeth and then slapped Flamer-6 across the face with his wing. "I told you to shut the hell up!"

Too late, Blaze saw Flamer-2 rear his head up and convulse his chest, a sucking noise emerging from his throat as his flame ducts filled up his long neck. The beast was about to break yet another taboo among fire-drakes, he was going to breathe fire on Flamer-6! Blaze ran forward, knowing he would not get there in time, his claws scrabbling across the tile floor.

Just as he was about to unleash his payload, however, several stone axes bashed into the dragon's face with surprising accuracy. One of them clipped the side of his nostril, cutting through the skin and causing Flamer-2 to bleed. Flamer-2 choked on the liquid fire in his throat; When the fire ducts were full, they swelled and briefly closed off the trachea, normally it didn't matter. However, the strike had been timed just perfectly and Flamer-2 couldn't breathe, even as his eyes darted, looking for new targets. He quickly found the two trolls. With bloodshot eyes and a grimacing expression, Flamer-2 redirected his fire and coated the area with burning liquid flame which spewed from his mouth and caught fire in the air. Needless to say, the trolls were reduced to cinders for their insolence.

Flamer-6 cried out as if he had lost a dear friend; Blaze supposed that he had. Before Flamer-2 could do anymore damage, however, Blaze jumped onto his back. His claws gripped the base of the dragon's wings and before Flamer-2 could turn, he had his jaws around the base of his neck. He growled, pinching the dragon's spine with his large fangs. Blaze eyed Flamer-6 who rose unsteadily.

With nothing left to protect, Flamer-6 hobbled off. Slowly he seemed to regain the use of his left foreleg. He allowed trolls to crawl all over him when he returned to his little hollow. Flamer-2 was carefully still under Blaze. "Well, well. The Smart-ass has come for his lesson now eh?" asked Flamer-2 even as he continued to bleed from the torn nostril. It was a rather big cut actually, he was going to have that cleft there for the rest of his life; barring magical intervention of course.

As an answer, Blaze bit down some more on the dragon's neck. He could actually feel one of the implants between his teeth. However, there was so much muscle here that Blaze doubted he could actually bite through. The young drake considered. How the hell was he going to get out of this one?
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.title: Emnity

choices: Blaze is taken out for formation drill
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.content:
Blaze knew he had to change his tactics if he wanted to live through this. At that moment he thought back to the orphanage, thought back to one of Lady Ramoth's little chats with Darhjza.

Blaze, while walking through the hallways of the rundown building, heard the voice of their caretaker in a nearby room. Curious, he quietly went up to the crack in the door and peeked through. He saw Ramoth pacing about and Darzhja in the middle of one of her elder’s strives. Darzhja had a pair of swords lodged in her chest, one on her forearm, another in her claw and she had cuts and slices all over her front. She showed Blaze a big smile on her face when she saw him spying on the two.

“I mean what is it with you Darzhja?" Ramoth had asked that day. “You’re not only too reckless, you could have been killed!! What would’ve happen if one of these things hit your hearts?” Ramoth continued as Blaze heard the sounds of metal hitting a stone floor.

“But Lady Ramoth…”

“Nope! I’m not hearing another excuse!” Ramoth interrupted. “Darzhja… You’re going to be the death of me one day.”

“I know.” Blaze heard Darzhja reply stubbornly. Lady Ramoth sighed. “Look Darzhja. Not all battles can be won with tooth and claw. Not anymore.” In these times, words can be just as painful. Sometimes even more-so.”

“How’s that?” Darzhja asked. Ramoth sighed.

“Darzhja, listen to me well. What a single word can do is very little…”

“See. Then why talk?” Darhjza interrupted.

“Darhjza!” Ramoth growled scaring even Blaze a little. “What a single word can do is very little or quite massive. A single word is capable of either putting a smile on someone's face, or when used in the right context, a single word can even topple Empires…”

Suddenly realizing where he was, Blaze came to and let go of Flamer-2’s neck. Blaze was quickly flung off but landed safely on his feet. If he was going to end this fight with Flamer-2, he’d have to use more than brute force against him.

“All right then. You want a fight!! I’ll give you a fight!! Come on you idiot.” Blaze shouted to get Flamer-2’s attention.

Flamer-2 let out a roar and charged forward. Blaze was ready for it though and dodged to the side at the last possible moment.

“What the hell was that?! I thought you were better than that!!” Blaze taunted. Of course, in his right mind, provoking Flamer-2 into further rage wasn’t exactly the smartest idea, but remembering the words exchanged during his fight with Flamer-6, Blaze had an inkling that this was the only way to get past Flamer-2's thick-headed mental guard.

“Why do you care about what happens to that cripple? It didn’t involve you…” Flamer-2 spat out as he recovered and turned to face Blaze again. The two started circling each other, Flamer-2 thumped the tile floor with his tail and snorted smoke.

This time, Blaze took the initiative and rushed forward. However, instead of dodging, Flamer-2 deflected his claw with his tail with surprising agility, while all in one motion delivered a punishing counterblow across his flank.

Blaze staggered back a ways, biting back the pain. There would definitely be a bruise, but he was far from being done.

“It has nothing to do with that!! The fact of the matter is that nobody here likes you. All you ever do is piss everyone off and make life in this shitty hellhole even shittier!!” Blaze decried, shaking out his wings.

“Humph!! All you ever do is piss me off with your fancy words and your whining. If anyone here needs to be knocked down a peg it's you!!” Roared Flamer-2. Blaze was surprised when he didn't come charging, but it seemed that the bigger dragon was waiting to perform another counter-attack.

“I’m just saying fancy words huh? That’s the problem with you. You never think beyond your own personal satisfaction. Or it because you just don’t want to think about things and that you’re fine with being the Kleave’s dog?” Blaze asked.

“Fuck you!” Flamer-2 roared back. The two continued to tussle. Despite Flamer-2’s obvious strength advantage, Blaze was able to hold his own by striking quickly before Flamer-2 could deliver one of his powerful counterblows. Yet though he landed more blows upon Flamer-2, the ones that Flamer-2 landed hurt far more. After a while of jostling, the two were left with a series of bruises, showing maroon under their red scales.

“Flamer-2… Didn’t you once have a home? A family? A real name?” Flamer-8 crept closer to the edge of his ledge and even Flamer-6 lifted his head from his recuperation at Blaze for asking such a question. Flamer-2 frowned.

“You think I’m dumb enough to fall for that trick again?! I’m not gonna shock myself like that." said Flamer-2, referring to the inhibitor collar around his neck, "Besides, you’re a fool if you think the past mean anything here!! In here, there’s only winners and losers. Flamer-6…he’s a loser. The weak die and the strong survive!! You’re a little prick that needs to be put in his place!!”

Flamer-2 roared as he lurched forward toward Blaze. However, right before he was going to strike, he quickly changed direction to swing at Blaze's legs. Blaze stumbled over and fell. Lashing out, he was able to swung out with his tail to ward off the larger dragon long enough for him to roll back on his feet.

“So that’s what you think its all about? If you win this fight, what will you have gained? Nothing!! The reality is that all of us are the losers, no matter which one of us wins this little fight we’re having and who ends up becoming the breeder male. Ultimately we’ll still be puppets of the Kleaves no matter what. In fact, they’re probably watching our little pointless fight right now and laughing at what losers we are…”

It was only for a second. Just for a second Flamer-2 stopped and seemed to hesitate. In fact, he actually turned toward the small glass-viewing window located near the top of the chamber. Indeed, both Dr. Moridin and Fang were watching with keen interest, and the sight of those two was enough to defuse all the rage Blaze had felt previously. Dr. Moridin looking very unhappy and Fang still had that same intrigued expression from the first time the two met. The Doctor then turned and stormed off, obviously mad about something, while Fang on the other hand merely gave a slight grin before following him.

Flamer-2 retreated, “Fuck you Flamer-7. Fuck you to the powers below.” It must have really rankled the big fire drake to realize that he found himself agreeing with Blaze’s point. “One day you’ll pay for being a smart-ass. When we fight next time, it’ll be on our terms. I also expect it will be rather soon.”

Blaze nodded. That was the first and probably the last time he’d ever agree with Flamer-2. “Fine…”

“Humph, we’ll see who’s laughing in the end…” grunted Flamer-2 before retreating back toward his territory.

Blaze let out a sigh of relief. He didn’t know how he was able to pull himself out of this one. Flamer-8 also shook his head in exasperated disbelief, while Blaze shrugged in return.

“If the Doctor is mad then I did good… I think.” he thought as he perched himself back upon his ledge and laid down. Furthermore, he’d gotten Flamer-2 to back off, and for the first time, seemed to be in deep contemplation, However, Blaze expected that all he’d really done was make Flamer-2 hate him more than he already had.

“I guess you where right Lady Ramoth.” Blaze thought. However, Lady Ramoth had likely never been to a cruel place like the island of the Kleaves, where using ones words alone was not enough…
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.title: Lesson Learned

1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.content:
Blaze looked down from his ledge the day following the incident with Flamer-2 and Flamer-6. Blaze kept imagining pain in his ribs where Flamer-2 had bashed him good. He had to imagine it because it wasn't there, the pain at least. The absence was especially odd because Blaze could tell that he had indeed several bruised ribs; all he had to do was press down on them with a claw and the tenderness would return. However the pain never lingered and soon faded. What might have been taken as a blessing, instead Blaze chose to view as evidence of yet more tampering by the mad scientist of the Kleaves.

Blaze was wondering how easy it might be to injure himself in the future if his sense of pain was dulled when he gave a ragged sigh. The restlessness - by now familiar - was reawakening in his muscles. After several weeks of this, Blaze had adjusted to the fact that his body never seemed to rest, but it ingrained in him an almost constant weariness along with a contradictory impulse to move. Blaze stood so he would not have to feel his muscles twitch by themselves where he rested; he had enough of that all night long, every night. He did some push-ups to help relieve the impulse.

Blaze had grown remarkably in the last weeks and put on a dozen stone in muscle around his chest, shoulders and haunches. If the growth continued, he would break his second ton in another couple months. His legs, wings and tail were all much longer than he was familiar with and Blaze had developed a slight clumsiness that seemed to increase the more he grew. The drake lamented the fact that, just looking at him now, most dragons would probably mistake him for a young adult rather than the adolescent that he was.

Although the change itself was remarkable, locked in a room with three other dragons who were going through the same experience, the experience was robbed of even its uniqueness. Blaze extended his wings and mock-flapped them slowly, stretching the muscles to work the spasming out of them. Over on his ledge, the young drake saw Flamer-8 rise and begin some calisthenics as well. The older drake seemed more proficient and controlled with his movements, as if he were working through a familiar routine. Blaze didn't bother asking him about it. The stirring which infected them all was a problem which each dragon seemed to be solving in their own fashion. Blaze liked stretching, for instance while apparently Flamer-2 liked carrying and breaking rocks. The sad part was that Blaze still did not enjoy the exercise, he did it only out of a need to avoid the disconcertion of muscles spasming randomly across his body when he sat still. Although... when Blaze looked at the sleek new muscle lining his formerly scrawny frame, he could not argue that it was an improvement in masculine aestheticism.

Looking below, Blaze saw that Flamer-6 was busy as well, however, he did not appear to be excercising so much as building something. His trolls - and indeed, all of the remaining trolls had formed something of a tribe around the lame dragon - had scavenged the vault for bits and pieces of metal, wood and stone. Raw resources were rare in the stone cave, but the trolls seemed to be remarkably resourceful. Blaze detected the presence of fish spines which the trolls seemed to be using as makeshift lashings for delicate parts of the apparatus; Flamer-6 himself welded together many of the stronger metal parts. Blaze shook his head and snorted. He had no idea what Flamer-6 was up to, but all it would take was one tail slam from Flamer-2 to wreck what the dragon had been laboring on for days now. Blaze hoped he would not be too disappointed when it happened.

They came in the morning on the second day after Blaze's fight with Flamer-2. Wolf strode in, leading a party of elves which included the dread Dr. Moridin himself. His eyes immediately caught onto a pair of green eyes in a young face which met his directly. Fang winked at him. Blaze frowned and pawed the edge of his platform cautiously, for some reason, he thought he felt a small burning sensation at the place on his back from which Fang had removed his ingrown scale.

Wolf stepped forward and spoke into a copper cone which greatly amplified his voice. He pointed right up at Blaze. "You! get down here." Blaze had no choice but to obey the summons. Before he even alighted on the wide tiled circle, Wolf turned and searched the room. "You too! Get over here." To Blaze's chagrin, Wolf had selected Flamer-2. He smuggled slinked across the stones, taking his time to approach. Blaze immediately heard elvish whispers concerning the breadth of Flamer-2's shoulders and the deepness of his chest. He had to stifle a snarl.

Wolf set his loudspeaker aside when both dragons were present. "You two have been selected for a new trial. We're going outside so you better be on your best behavior if you want to keep your balls and necks intact."

Several of the elves snickered and Blaze could tell that Wolf had meant to sound threatening, however, all the young drake felt was elation. We're going... outside?! It seemed too good to be true. Blaze hadn't been outside in months, not counting the time he'd spent exercising and being tested in the vast dome in the caldera of the volcano. As the party turned to depart through the grand iron door, Flamer-2 rudely shoved Blaze aside without a word, leaving him to bring up the rear of the procession... but not for long.

Immediately outside the door, both dragons were ambushed by four more drakes who took positions on either side of them. Flamer-2 hissed threateningly for space, and his two partners obliged. That washed over Blaze however, for he recognized one of the new dragons. It was Flamer-1!

Flamer-1 walked on Blaze's right side, his eyes as dour and uninterested as ever. He hulked alongside Blaze, even more muscular and large now than Flamer-2, however, his flame sacs also appeared much diminished. What tortures had he endured since he'd been kicked from the breeding program? He had more of the stocky build of a mountain drake than the slim specialized lankiness of a fire-drake now, though his face was still the same as were the dull red scales that covered his body. One thing was sure, however, as Blaze gave the bigger dragon a few cursory sniffs, his scent had markedly changed. He was a drake no longer, he was a eunuch.

Blaze didn't have to peer down at the dragon's crotch to note the change - besides, there was little exposed of the male genitalia unless aroused - the drake's smell was no longer that of a male; it was watered down to inoffensive levels, and yet also not female. The not-quite-either smell disturbed Blaze still despite having met eunuchs down in the mines previously. "Flamer-1?" tried Blaze as the elves and dragons made their way to the main concourse and began to walk down the levels. Blaze had to repeat himself before the dragon would answer.

The former fire-drake swiveled an eye to look down at Blaze. "I don't go by that anymore." he said in a gravely voice.

Blaze, who was still amazed to see the dragon alive, had little patience for semantics. "Well, what's your name now, then?" he asked briskly, tossing his head a little.

The big dragon grunted as he moved his thickly muscled legs and as usual, he took his time in answering. When he finally deigned to speak, he spoke with an expression that seemed to hurt even the big dragon, "I'm now called... Chimera-8."
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.title: Chimera-8

1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.content:
"Hmmm...." sighed Blaze, "But you'll always be Flamer-1 to me..."

He intended it as encouragement, yet the big dragon formerly known as Flamer-1 only sighed, "Call me whatever you want. It really doesn't matter at this point."

Blaze switched his gaze to the other neutered drake. He was of similar size to Flamer-1, except he was a silver drake. Like Flamer-1, he had a disinterested, depressed expression.

"Can I get your name?" asked Blaze.

"Chimera-12..." he uttered blankly.

"R-right..." answered Blaze. It was utterly depressing being around those two, and made Blaze more determined than ever to avoid their fate.

An elf ventured onto the ledge. He was clad in a thick leather outfit, and more prominently, he wore a pair of clear goggles over his eyes. In his hand, he wielded a short leather whip, which at the end of it held a small steel ball. Alongside the elf, a team of human laborers dragged forth a large leather saddle.

The elf gave one look at Blaze and sneered, “Typical that I get the weaker one…” He said it as if Blaze couldn’t hear and that he was nothing but a beast. Flamer-2 also heard the insult from the opposite side of the ledge and gave Blaze a smug look.

“So I take it that you’re going to be riding me?” snapped Blaze, with equal disdain.

“That is so. I am Melchoir. Now then, you will obey my every command without question. Consider it a privilege that you get a worthy individual such as myself as your test rider.”

Blaze narrowed his eyes. Apparently, this individual was one of the more run-of-the-mill arrogant elves who believed that their piss smelled like honey. Then again, if there were any distinctive qualities about the rider, then he probably wouldn’t be a trial pilot. Furthermore, Blaze got the impression that Melchoir was dissatisfied with his current position and felt himself qualified for more worthy endeavors.

“Now then dragon, bend down so they can put the harness on you,” he snapped disdainfully.

“Yes master…” answered Blaze. No need for the ignoramus to know what Blaze really thought of him, so he bent down. The contraption wound around the base of his neck. The material felt rough and abrasive, scratching uncomfortably against his scales. Part of his harness was wrapped around his shock collar, and Blaze did not think for a moment that there was not a device within the harness that could activate it at a moments notice. More harnesses were wrapped around his face. All in all, the harness was not only itchy, but also quite degrading, especially when the elf took his position upon the saddle.

“Now then, I am only going to say this once,” snapped Melchoir impatiently.

“I’m listening,” cried Blaze.

“When I hit you with my whip, that means I want you to start moving forward…”

The rider slapped him against his flank with the whip, eliciting a snort of displeasure from Blaze as he started moving forward.

“When I pull on the left reins, that means go left. When I pull on the right, you will go right. When I pull back on both reins, I would like you to stop. When I pull down on the reins, you will go up, and alternately, when I pull up I want you to go down. Even a beast such as yourself should be able to understand simple commands such as these…”

“I’ll do my best!!” said Blaze, with as servile a tone he could muster.

Blaze felt the rider tense against his back and deliver a mighty pull. The breath caught in his throat as he found himself short of breath.

“Don’t try and play the flattery game with me beast!! I know you do not mean your obedience in that animal heart of yours. Know that your only purpose in life is to serve us elves,” he harangued.

“Of course Master Melchoir…” answered Blaze with a neutral tone. Frankly, he’d already seen far worse to let something like that fluster him. Besides, there was no point in starting an incident with such a small-time, petty individual anyhow.

“You better not fail me then beast…” he warned. “Now!! Forward!!”

With that, Blaze made his way off toward the ledge. Flamer-1 and Chimera-12 flanked him on the side, each of whom were now harnessed and were directed by riders of their own now. On the opposite side of the ledge, Flamer-2 took off with his own rider in tow, along with his accompanying escort, heading in the opposite direction as Blaze.

Blaze emerged from the mountain, and despite the sneering commands of the parasitic rider, he could not help but roar with glee when he found himself truly outside for the first time in months. He found himself on the opposite side of the harbor, where down below, a series of tiny islands branched off from the main island. Part of him was tempted to fly away from the island and make his way toward freedom, yet he knew full well that he was being watched. If he was ever going to escape, he’d have to survive and cooperate for the time being.

The first part of the trial was simple enough. His test rider ordered him to obey simple aerial commands. When he pulled left, Blaze angled left. When he pulled right on the reins, Blaze angled right. When he pulled up, Blaze lowered his altitude, and conversely when he pulled down Blaze angled his way up. Blaze found that a little strange, how the elves favored inverting up and down. Finally, when he pulled back, Blaze slowed down.

The challenge, however, was to match his speed with his escort. Both Flamer-1 and Chimera-12 were inherently slower and clumsier than Blaze, and every so often he found himself angling to sharply or emerging out in front of the formation. Neither of the neutered drakes shared Blaze’s excitement or exuberance in being outside; to them it was just another drill, another day in their dull, dreary lives.

Just then, out of the corner of his eye, there was a blur. Before Blaze knew it, a small dragon stopped right in front of him. Blaze’s eyes went wide. It was Jinx!! It took all of his will-power not to call out for him right then and there. The way that Blaze could tell it was Jinx rather than any other copper dragon was his eyes; they burned with a smoldering, cunning vengeance. Like Blaze, Jinx had grown quickly during his captivity. He was still rather scrawny, but he didn’t look emaciated anymore. Blaze wasn’t surprised to see that Jinx had managed to survive the Kleaves up until now. They hadn’t broken him yet, so Blaze resolved that he would not be broken himself.

In the meantime, Blaze’s test rider was in conversation with Jinx’s test rider, concerning the trial.

“Ah, so it appears our paths have crossed again Comrade!!” called Jinx.

“I go by Flamer-7 now, how about you?” asked Blaze. He briefly wondered whether it was wise of Jinx to reveal that he had a prior acquaintence, but he’d managed to get away with it. The riders weren’t paying attention to what the drakes were communicating, as they were busy in conversation themselves as the drakes circled.

“Raider-6…” answered Jinx. Blaze grunted, by the looks of it they’d designated Jinx in a reconnaissance role.

“I’ve spotted a tribe of runaway trolls taking refuge on a small triangular island exactly 1.27 miles to east-south-east. Furthermore, the svotch have commandeered a number of old shipwrecks and are attempting to make them operational,” explained Jinx. He further elaborated in dragon-tongue the particular smell, the wind conditions and other details that could only be communicated in that speech.

“Are they armed?” asked Blaze.

“They have managed to procure a small arsenal of crude weapons. Beware that they are also concealing an improvised ballista upon one of the ships. While I doubt these will be effective, you should definitely keep this in mind,” continued Jinx. Blaze grunted in acknowledgment. He switched his gaze toward Flamer-1 and Chimera-12, “Did both of you hear what…Raider-6 described?”

“Of course…” replied Flamer-1 dully, “We go in and we take out some bothersome trolls.”

“Yes, but do you think this could this have been set up or are they really trying to escape?” asked Blaze. Obviously, by the blank stares of Flamer-1 and Chimera-12, neither of them cared, nor had the possibility seemed to occur to them.

Right then, Blaze received a whip across the flank. “Your only duty is to flame!! Not think!! You understand!?” screeched his rider. Blaze grumbled, before switching his gaze back toward Jinx. The small drake had a severe expression for a moment, before flashing back to one of pretend obedience, “I must be going now comrade!! I bid you good luck on your hunt!!”

With that, Jinx bolted off like a meteor. Blaze thus took off toward the direction that Jinx had indicated, wondering about those trolls. Obviously, Blaze was definitely going to have to flame them down; there was no helping that, but had they truly been trying to escape? It could have easily been a set-up by the Kleaves so that Blaze would have live target practice. Or perhaps the trolls really had attempted to organize an escape, and that the Kleaves had allowed it to unfurl so that Blaze could take care of it.
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.title: Flamer squadron

1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.content:
The water of the sea rippled and crested far below and all around them, a blue sky beckoned, parted here and there by banks of clouds, fellow air denizens. The clouds were not merely figments to Blaze, his wings could take him to them, if he had half a mind. And he did have a mind, but the elf on his back and the two dragons at his side were a strong deterrent against trying to make a break for it. Still, even the brutality of the Kleaves could not rob the world of its beauty. He would taste it again and with the freedom to soar where he would, this Blaze swore.

Jinx was directed away when the elves up top finished their conversation. The barbarian gave an odd salute with his paw from his head to his neck heart and Blaze attempted to copy him, though he felt a little foolish doing so. The sun was warm, the air cool and heavy with a mild breeze coming in from the west over the great ocean. More storms would approach in the next week or so. Even the thought of the conditions made his proud fire-sacs tingle with the prospect of flaming. The powerful organophosphate factories therein were adjusting the formula to fit the situation. Blaze was sure that Flamer-2 was getting ready as well.

He could see the other formation with his powerful eyes, more to the north and east than his own. Although to Blaze this seemed like a mock battle, he could feel the battle-rage working up from his bones, filling his strong muscles with tension for the coming fight. His fire-sacs pulsed where they sat at the base of his throat. He wanted to burn things. "Even if those things are sentient creatures?" thought Blaze uncertainly. He shook his head in midair, feeling the wind press against his cheeks. He couldn't afford to think like that. This wasn't about burning or not burning helpless trolls - who did not sound so helpless from Jinx's survey - it was about being better than Flamer-2 and not having his ball cut off and turned into… well, turned into Flamer-1.

He glanced at the dragon with his scientifically expanded frame. He subvocalized to the big "male." [Inquiry: Plan of attack?]

Flamer-1 rumbled his response. [Reply: Ally drakes fly in first. Damage resistance. We two fly interference. You destroy target.]

Blaze grunted, it seemed simple enough. And there, the island was in view below. The other formation was already dropping…

Melchior pulled up on his reins. "Down beast…" he muttered despite the rush of the wind. "You better empty your belly on those trolls, Flamer-7. We're only getting one pass." Melchoir revealed his ignorance concerning the origin of a drakes fire to Blaze's dry amusement.

The elf must have had some sort of magical assistance to his voice so he could be heard over the wind. Blaze replied in his own naturally deeper and stronger voice. "Understood."

Blaze's formation raced along the isle's coast northward. They were on the east side of the island, the mainland a tantalizing smear of green on the horizon. Blaze could not help but think how simple it might be to duck out of formation and make a run for it. But it couldn't happen. Blaze was sure that he had even more safeguards on him here than in his new lair. At last he saw the trolls ahead.

If it was indeed an honest escape attempt, it was a very shabby one. Their "camp" looked like nothing so much as heaped driftwood and stretched canvas. At the center, however, there did appear to be several ships hauled up onto the sand. Logs were placed under them and ran down to the water's edge. They was ready to be launched as soon as the repairs were made, it looked like. Too bad they weren't going to happen now.

Flamer-2's formation approached then from the east, cutting in from across the sea. Flamer-2's wingmen took the lead and swooped down, roaring dread and spreading their own limited streams of flame around the outside edges of the camp, drawing the counter-fire.

And there was counter-fire, Blaze was mildly surprised to see. The trolls were armed mostly with longbows fashioned from island wood, it seemed. Really that type of weapon only posed a real threat at close range and the big dragons were not landing and were moving quite rapidly. The most they could do, really was puncture a wing membrane. Blaze saw one of Flamer-2's wingmen assaulted by a sudden volley of arrows. He took it in his armored chest where one seemed to get stuck in his scales. Three hit his wings with two puncturing clear through and one getting lodged in the thick leather. Blaze snorted. Given what the trolls were attacking them with, it seemed more hilarious than threatening. That is, until Flamer-2 swooped in on the nest of archers on the south side of the complex.

Liquid flame dumped from the dragon's mouth as Flamer-2 angled his head down. Oily and greasy, it fell on the trolls and latched onto their bodies. They ran and screamed, many unwittingly spreading the flames about the dry wooden encampment. The crude palisade went up marvelously, a bonfire reaching 20, no, 30 feet into the air. Flamer-2 let out a terrific roar as some flaming balls with legs ran blindly to throw their charred corpses into the sea. He came around over the island to repeat the scene on the north side.

Blaze was still approaching the complex when they launched the ships. Flamer-2 ignored them, instead torching the remaining camp. It seemed as if the elves were not interested in recapturing any of these blue-skinned escapees. Of the five ships the trolls had reclaimed, two immediately sank. Trolls climbed the tilted masts as their bottoms ground to a halt on the sandy shallows. They had literally no where to go.

Melchior yanked on the reins and kicked him in the neck. "The ships! The ships, you fool dragon!"

Blaze bared his teeth, but suppressed a growl the elf could hear. He dipped his wings and prepared the fire swelling the proud sacs on his chest. Adrenaline pulsed in his veins when he dived towards the little wooden things bobbing in a vast sea. With the fire heavy and barely contained in the back of his throat, Blaze was blissfully unaware of his previous ethical concerns. He just wanted to see these wooden things burn down to the water's surface. The prospect filled him with an animal glee.

There were more archers on the boats. Blaze angled his wings against the wind and let Flamer-1 and Chimera-12 take the lead. Althought Blaze could probably have destroyed all of the boats in one pass on land, they had already spread too far apart in the water for that. In fact, the boats were actively sailing away from each other. With the two dragons forming a wall of wings and scales ahead of him, Blaze was free to note Flamer-2 approaching the ship on the far northern side.

Blaze snorted, determined to burn down this ship quickly and get to the middle one before Flamer-2 claimed all the glory for himself. Melchior kicked him again. "Hurry beast, or there'll be nothing left!" It was the first thing that Blaze actually agree with the elf on.

The two big dragons parted simultaneously and opened the way for Blaze to come screaming down. He blasted hellfire on them. Blaze held nothing back and doused the entire ship with nearly half of his full volume of fire. His mouth burned and tasted of sulfur for spewing that much fire. The young fire drake licked his chops and angled towards the middle ship, his two wingmen struggling to catch up. Blaze didn't even bother looking back at the destruction he had wrought. The ship disappeared in under four minutes below the waves. Needless to say, there were no survivors.

Blaze watched Flamer-2 destroy the northernmost ship, although his stream was getting thin for all the flaming. He set the sails and the deck on fire and while that was certainly enough to eventually destroy the ship, it'd probably take the better part of an hour for it to sink completely. Trolls jumped overboard and floundered in the water like rats all around it.

Now it was a race for the middle ship. The fire pulsed in Blaze's chest, but he grinned smugly. He had more than enough lead to get to the ship in time. Flamer-2 would not have all the glory this day…

Blaze flew far ahead of his slower wingmen. Even Melchoir didn't disparage him for the break. The elf seemed to sense that they were just mopping things up now and that lack of speed could only cost them now. Blaze thought nothing of the drums he could hear playing primitive music from the ship's bow and stern.

When the elf could hear them, however, he pulled down on the reins. "Abort! Abort! The exercise is over! Go up you stupid drake!"

Blaze ignored him, the battle rage blasting its heat behind his eyes. The young drake opened his jaws to deliver death to the last ship…

And was utterly shocked when the fire washed right over the ship and fell to steam and burn at the surface of the water. The greasy smoke outlined an intangible barrier mere inches from the surface of the boat. Blaze was utterly amazed. Melchior kicked him with both booted feet. "Up! Up!" he cried with desperation in his voice. "They're repelling the fire! Up, damn you!"

Too late, Blaze saw the troll crew bring the large ballista on the deck to bear… right on him.
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.title: Surprise Attack!

choices: At the ward having the bolt removed
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.content:
Desperately, he tried to swerve to the side, but then it fired. A moment later, Blaze let out a roar as a sharp pain exploded against his thigh. The weight of the ballista bolt dug down upon his leg as he struggled to maintain altitude. Blaze gasped, he wasn't going to be able to get clear away before it could fire again. He landed belly first into the water.

He felt more angry and embarrassed than physical pain; he'd been hit because he'd made a mistake. Thankfully, because the bolt was crude, rather than military grade, Blaze was able to drag himself back up to the surface without too much trouble. He’d also lucked out that the bolt hadn't hit any of the vital arteries in his leg, or at least that’s what it felt like.

"Blasted idiot Flamer-7!! Did I not tell you to abort the mission?" snarled a understandably enraged Melchoir as he emerged on the surface.

He floated about in the water, shifting his gaze this way and that. Up above, he spotted Flamer-2 and his squad heading back, as were Flamer-1 and Chimera-12. They'd given him up for dead, it seemed. And why not? He'd disobeyed orders and allowed his battle rage to get the better of him, and leaving Blaze by himself. He'd have to pay for the consequences.

"Damn you Flamer-7? Why did you not obey? I knew my luck was cursed today when I was placed with you…”

Blaze wanted to laugh and cry at the same time. What a stupid way to die. Even if the Kleaves came back to bail him out, a mistake this bad might have already cost him his balls. Damn Flamer-2 for baiting him. Damn those trolls.

“Fine!! You’re right!! I made a mistake!! Yet I’m not going to die or get gelded here!! Not to these troll scum!!”

Before, he’d been treating this like a contest with Flamer-2, letting his emotions get the better of him, and that’s exactly what led to this sitation. He remembered what Darzhja had told him; that in the heat of a big fight, being able to think clearly and rationally meant you’d already won half the fight. Now that he was faced with the very real possibility of being killed, with his mind free from any other thoughts than surviving, Blaze was suddenly able to focus with surprising clarity.

“The only way the situation can be salvaged is if we find some way of sinking that troll ship!!” he bellowed.

“Forget about sinking the ship!! You’ve got to somehow get out of range!!” growled Melchoir. Blaze growled. He’d have to think fast. Arrows were flying all around him, while more ominously, the ballista crew was preparing for a second shot. There would be no way for him to get out of range to avoid a second, and likely crippling shot, even if he already didn’t have a ballista bolt dragging him down like a dead weight.

“With a ballista bolt puncturing my leg?” snorted Blaze. No, his only option was to somehow sink the ship, yet he had to do it without using his fire. However, the ship was still made out of wood, and wood was not exactly the strongest material.

“We’ve got to get in close…” shouted Blaze.

“Idiot!! Did you not see that the ship is fireproof?” snapped Melchoir.

“I can still tear it apart at the base can’t I? It might be on the outside, but there’s a chance that we could still light it up from within. If I can stick my head through an opening, I can flame it from within.” reasoned Blaze. Of course, that was gambling on the notion that the troll shaman hadn’t foreseen such an eventuality, but it was the best Blaze had.

With all of his strength, he swam toward the exposed side of the ship, avoiding arrow fire all the while. He aimed his horns directly at the stern of the ship, using it as a battering ram. Blaze felt his head spin at the impact, yet he could feel the wood give way. The trolls on deck swayed from the impact, knocking a few into the water.

That gave Blaze enough time to implement the second part of his plan. He began to feverishly tear away at the wood with his claws. The hole quickly began to expand, and Blaze stuck his head through the hole he’d made.

He found himself staring at the crew decks, which were a smelly mess of bunks and hammocks. The troll crew, however, had descended down the stairwell, armed with axes and the like. With his body stuck halfway inside the ship, he didn’t exactly have room to maneuver.

“What are you looking around for!! Flame!!” he shouted.

He did flame. While it did roast the trolls to a crisp, unfortunately the inside was as fireproof as the outside. Worse yet, Blaze was pretty much out of fire now…

“Now what!! Any other bright ideas!?” snorted Melchoir with alarm and dismay.

Blaze had to think fast. “We…can still make it capsize!! If we can fill the chamber with water, eventually it’ll tip over!!”

There was no time for discussion, as he began to violently rock the ship. Water began to fill into the chamber, and the ship began to lilt upon its side.

“I can’t believe it!! Its actually working!!” cried Melchoir.

However, it seemed that Blaze had spoken too soon. The troll shaman himself now descended the stairway to the remainder of his crew to rectify the situation. He bellowed at his crew violently to begin to scoop the water out. Regardless of what happened, Blaze couldn’t help but admit that the shaman was a sharp and decisive individual, never panicking and ensuring that every troll was assigned to an essential task.

The troll shaman then shifted his attention toward Blaze. He raised his staff almost comically, and then, bits of wood, metal and other flotsam swirled around Blaze.

“By god, that’s no regular troll shaman we’re dealing with!! That’s a true witch-doctor!!”

Blaze hadn’t necessarily studied the history of the Troll Rebellions, but what he did know was that the witch-doctors were supposedly the equivalent of an elite shaman. Apparently, nobody in the Kleave’s had truly known what they’d been up against. Yet Blaze saw what the witch doctor was trying to do. He was going to plug the hole with the assorted flotsam, while at the same time wedging Blaze in so that he could not move, which would allow the rest of the crew to get in close and hack him to death.

He tried to think of anyway to get out of this situation. It was time to do something desperate.

“You’ve got the shocker amulet don’t you?” bellowed Blaze.

“Yeah? How’s that’s going to help!!”

“Water conducts electricity doesn’t it? Get on something wooden and dry before pressing it!!”

Melchoir leapt off the saddle onto one of the shifting cargo boxes and pressed down. His shock collar lit up, and a moment later, pain exploded through his body. The shock had only been for a couple of seconds, yet it had felt like forever.

Thankfully, Blaze found himself able to refocus and gain control of his body again without, hopefully, too much permanent damage. The same could not be said of the trolls, who were now a pile of floating corpses. The troll shaman in particular was floating face up, his expression still in the middle of chanting a spell, while his eyes had exploded within their sockets. Meanwhile, Melchoir was standing there upon one of the shifting boxes, not knowing whether to be angry, impressed or afraid of what Blaze had done despite all the odds. It then occurred to Blaze just what he’d done. He’d made a nearly fatal mistake, but then, whether because he was crazy, scared out of his mind, deluded, etc. he’d openly disobeyed his rider but managed to kill off that last ship along with a troll shaman.

"I can't believe what you just did you...you wretched beast!! Aye...there will be hell to pay for that.... In the meantime, lets get out of this stinking rathole and swim back to shore before you have the chance to pull off any more shenanegins..."

"Yes Master Melchoir, "answered Blaze obediently.

Ashe swam back to shore, he briefly shifted his gaze toward the now capsizing ship.
“Heh…heh…I’d love to see the look on Flamer-2’s face after he learns I pulled this off…” he chuckled. It was a very odd thought to have at that moment, but considering the absurdity of it all, he couldn’t help himself. The Kleaves would certainly take note of this event as well…
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.title: Making it up as you go along...

1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.content:
The other five dragons reappeared quickly as the boat began to list drunkenly as it took on water. Only when the trolls began sliding off the main deck and the ballista there was unfirable did Blaze feel a measure of safety. With a little help from his wingmates, Blaze managed to extricate himself from the water and fly back to Helburd Island. Fortunately the bolt peircing his thigh was made of wood and so it's weight was not much of a burden, however, Blaze handled it gently so as not to jostle it. Really, though, the young drake was more surprised at the lack of pain than what pain was actually there. The flight back was silent. Even Melchior did not feel entitled to comment on Blaze's failures and triumphs that day.

Blaze parted from Melchior as soon as they alighted on a conveniant shelf built into the mountain. For his part, Blaze would remember little of his first rider save the the elf's scent and the feel of his boots on his neck. The elf left Blaze unattended and stomped with soggy boots up to the Elvish circle. The young fire-drake had his saddle taken off by a couple humans hanging about the landing and was immediately directed down a side corridor when they caught a look at the wooden bold piercing his thigh.

Before he left, though, he noticed Flamer-1 departing with his rider holding his reins down a different direction. "Where are you going?" Blaze called to him.

Flamer-1 looked up only dimly and shrugged, not bothering to break his step. "Wherever he needs me." he said as if he didn't care one way or another. Blaze shuddered. He hoped someone would kill him if he ever became as broken and dejected as Flamer-1. As he hopped down the side passage, however, Blaze reflected that such an impassive attitude towards one's place in life had at least helped the big dragon survive obviously arduous trials and tortures.

A clean tiled room served as an emergency care ward. The Kleaves were certainly prepared to accept wounded dragons fresh from the air, if nothing else. There was only one human assistant on duty at the time, but at the sight of Blaze's wound, there were quickly dozens of the three main races filling the spacious, though low ceilinged chamber. Blaze laid himself on the ground and kept still. Medicine was best left to the humanoids. That much Blaze had retained from his life in New Alveri. He would have been much more anxious with another dragon there attempting to removed the bolt from his leg with huge, unwieldy claws.

The bolt was big for them despite its lack of metal sheath, chain or dragging weight. Saws were brought out to cut it down into manageable pieces. Then an elf magician appeared to coax the remaining bolt from the wound. Blaze would have preferred a stout orc or even a distasteful dragonborn to do the job with one good pull. However the elf drew a rune circle of separation under Blaze's leg which caused his own flesh to expel the bolt and any splinters which may have been caught in it. The muscle was good and thick and resealed the wound as soon as the bloody thing was out, fortunately. It was then a simple matter of stitching him back up on both sides of his thigh. Blaze would have two new scars on his leg as trophies of this day. He grinned crookedly.

Scars were considered beatific on male dragons back in New Alveri where sometimes a dragon could pass through even their species' long lifespan without accumulating many; there were, in fact, parlors where dragons could pay for scarring. Now Blaze seemed to be accumulating a small fortune's worth quite naturally the old fashioned way. What he had now would have set him apart in the orphanage... and there seemed much opportunity for more such "enhancement" in the future!

Blaze was smiling at the thought when he realized that the medics had left quite suddenly. Seeing as Blaze was hardly ever left alone, he was actually quite unsure of what to do now that the chamber really was empty. Blaze lifted his head. It surprised him that it actually took more than a minute before the thought of escape entered his head. The landing was right back out the way he'd come after all...

Blaze drooped his scaly eyelids at the sound of boots coming up the opposite passage into the first-aid room, the small hope passing. Grudging dispassion gave way to intrigue, however, when Blaze identified the newcomer as none other than the young elf self-identified as Fang. He clapped his hands as he entered the wide clean room. "Marvelous show today, Flamer-7!" he cheered almost believably.

Blaze snorted. He knew sarcasm when he heard it. "If you call getting shot through the leg by a sharpened tree trunk marvelous." rumbled Blaze, taking advantage of the liberty Fang had shown him.

The young elf stepped lightly over the tiles and towards Blaze. Even though his fire bladder was empty - and he had the hunger pangs to prove it1! - he remained a very dangerous creature. The fact that Fang apparently felt so safe around him was disconcerting. Not that Blaze really wanted to kill the elf despite his alignment with the Kleaves, he couldn't see how it might benefit him for one, and it was easy to see possible repercussions for two. However, it made Blaze wonder how much Fang really knew about him...

Fang put his hands behind his back and leaned back and forth on his toes. "Don't be modest. You managed to take down a fully trained troll wtich-doctor despite the fact that you'd never encountered the like before."

Blaze scowled, "Yeah, but only by practically electrocuting myself in the process..." Blaze snaked his head around towards Fang suspiciously, giving him a few cursory sniffs. "Wait... how do you know of the troll magician?"

Fang did not falter. "Melchior has already given his report. And to be honest, it was quite scathing." Blaze frowned, but Fang continued, "Fortunately for you and your testicles, the other riders were rather impressed with what you did. They'd given you up for dead when you hit the water."

Blaze opened and closed his jaws a couple times. What was Fang up to telling him this? What was his game? Who was Fang? The young fire-drake shook his head on his long neck. "I just did what I could. It was because of me that we ended up in the water in the first place." It hurt to admit it, but it was the truth. Blaze didn't want to be neutered for a single mistake, naturally, but neither could he pretend that what had happened was largely due to his own arrogance and recklessness.

Fang just smiled and took a few steps closer. Fearlessly, he put a hand on Blaze's paw and looked up at the big dragon. "You did well out there and I think you surprised more than a couple of your critics today."

Blaze raised an eyebrow as Fang continued on, walking around his length towards his injured leg. "I have critics?" he asked in a low voice; a few stones ground together in the dragon's crop as he did.

Fang chuckled as he approached the raw stitched wound on his haunch. He threw back his head and said, "Everyone has critics."

Blaze just snorted. When Fang removed a vial of red potion from his sleeve, however, the fire-drake became much more alert. "What is that?" he said with a slight growl in his voice as he partially shifted his weight on the tiles.

"This?" asked Fang innocently. "Why, it's just a basic healing potion. Granted it's not something we would normally waste on dragons, but I managed to sneak this out."

Blaze eyed the red tinged fluid in the large beaker. He could smell the residue remained around the stopper. "Healing potions are usually clear." he said from experience.

For the first time, Fang seemed surprised. "Ah... so you spotted that. Well... this one's been juiced up a bit."

Blaze moved his paw to a few feet behind Fang. It was subtle, but the effect was now that Fang was surrounded by red-scaled dragonflesh. "Juiced up with what?" asked Blaze ominously.

Fang swirled the contents of the beaker carelessly, "Oh you know... A little of this, a little of that, it's really rather compl-" the comment choked off in the elf's throat as Blaze moved in his face closer, letting his fangs hang out from his thin scaly jowls. Fang pushed Blaze's nose and dripping chops away with a firm hand. "Alright!" he cried, "I added a little of your blood. It ought to attune the potion to your system so it works better. That's all, I swear!"
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.title: First Aid

1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.content:
Blaze relaxed. He let out a moist breath which rustled the elf's robes. After a few moments, he sighed, "Fine, just do it. Can't be worse that what Moridin's already done to me..."

Fang opened his mouth, but whatever he was about to say seemed to die in his throat. A strangely mixed expression played over Fang's youthful face as he climbed up on Blaze's haunch. The elf sat on his knees at Blaze's knee and leaned over where the bolt had penetrated his flesh. Carefully, he spread the potion, which felt cool and adhered to the wound more like a powder than a fluid. The coolness dulled what pain there was and spread down into the muscle below. Fang asked that Blaze lift his leg so he could do the other side. The dragon complied, however noticed that the elf took several moments to examine his sex when he did so. Fortunately, after spending so long on this island, Blaze was beyond feeling indecent. A man didn't think twice about examining a stallion in such a matter right? Blaze supposed it was natural for the young elf, just as it was natural not to look in New Alveri.

Fang applied the potion to the other side of Blaze's haunch and left soon after. Naturally, his visit was not to be discussed with anyone else. Before he left, however, Blaze had one thing to ask the elf. "Do you know when I'll be able to see Honeysweet again?"

"Who?" asked Fang, turning from the exit.

"One of the drakka in the fire-drake harem..." mumbled Blaze, rubbing his forepaws together uncomfortably.

A new expression bloomed on Fang's face: Mutual understanding. "I don't. But I'll see what I can do. Good-bye Flamer-7"

"G-good-bye, Fang." rumbled Blaze after the elf.

***

Despite the first aid and Fang's subsequent administrations, Blaze did not escape reproach for his misdeeds during training. Not long after Fang departed, a dozen men in armor crowded into the chamber, Melchior at the head of them. "Don't think you're getting off so easily for disobeying orders, Flamer-7!" he shrieked. "Gloin! You know what to do."

"Gloin" was a stout dwarf who armed himself with a smooth, lubricated pole of alarming thickness. Blaze tried futily to scramble away - mostly by instinct - at the sight of it, but Melchior shocked him. The dwarf with arms as thick as a horse's leg, rammed the dread thing home. He knew what he was doing and didn't waggle it like some of the men did, but pushed it down hard and painfully deep. The men laughed as Blaze took it with sharp hisses of pain.
