"I think he likes it, don't you?" they would say and jostle the man next to him. The comments hurt almost as much as the pole did and Blaze remained stock still for fear of tearing himself on its girth.

Twenty minutes felt like twenty days and finally the stinking tip of the pole was removed from him. Some blood oozed onto the ground where Blaze lay paralyzed with pain, but he'd escaped having his vent torn. A shiver of disgust crept down Blaze's spine thinking that the Kleaves had gotten him the "best" to work over their candidate breeder male. Melchior at least seemed pleased with his catatonic state. He walked over and kicked Blaze in the teeth with his booted foot. "On your feet drake!" he shouted and before Blaze could even move, he shocked him. Twitching almost as badly as Flamer-6, Blaze staggered to his feet. As he did, the elf added. "That's the last time you'll make me look like a fool, dragon..."

Blaze thought he might be led to yet more tortures, but miraculously, he was only led back to his vault with the other prospect males. Once inside and free of the elf, humans and dwarf, Blaze climbed through the air to his ledge. At the first opportunity, he ducked into the back to have a good long soak in the pool to ease himself and try to forget the look on Gloin's face as he'd thrust again and again...
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.title: Punishment

1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.content:
With a mighty splash Honeysweet emerged from the fishing cove with her largest catch yet; a young porpoise weighing at least three hundred pounds. She was careful not to ruin the carcass by pressing down too hard, and waded back toward the dock with a sense of genuine pride. Gathering fish was usually a tedious affair, but she had a rare opportunity and a chance with this one, for her prey had been fast and agile.

She deposited the porpoise onto the large net where the rations for the day had been collected. Waiting for her at the deck was one of the handlers, a female elf by the name of Allorah. In terms of stature, she was far huskier than a typical elf female, and with a darker shade of hair than the typical gold color, which may have been a reason why she was a handler and not placed in a position of employment where she would be more visible. Given all the handlers she had witnessed thus far, Allorah was harsh, but at least she was fair.

“That will be all for today Honeysweet,” said the handler.

“Why so early today?” asked Honeysweet curiously.

“Words just come down that we’re going to have a visits from the males again,” she answered.

“Really?” she replied, her hearts skipping a beat and instinctively she closed her legs together.

“Yes!! Now go hurry up and wash up so you’re not smelling of salt and fish!!” answered Allorah. Honestly, if a male was indeed coming to visit, it was probably best not to wash up so that she’d be as anonymous as possible. Yet she knew better than to argue at this stage, and she made her way to the washroom.

***

Sparkles was already busy showering herself when Honeysweet entered the washroom.

Sparkles sniffed a couple of times and retched exaggeratingly, “Ewww…you smell like beached whale!!” she squealed.

Honeysweet snorted. “Obviously yeah.” She found it rather odd that anyone would be complaining about smell nowadays, and she’d come in smelling of things far worse than raw fish and salt water.

“So how did your hunt go?” asked Honeysweet.

“Three wild boars, eight dire foxes, two baby water buffalos and I just about had a prized bull when my collar activated!! Do you have any idea how frustrating that is!?” wailed Sparkles.

“Sorry,” shrugged Honeysweet.

“Come next hunt though, that bull will be the first one I kill!! I’ll make sure of it!!” she squealed.
Honeysweet smiled cooperatively, “I’m sure you will Sparkles!!”

Of course, Honeysweet knew that Sparkles’ ditzy, annoyingly optimistic persona was but a coping measure for her, yet the alternative was giving in to despair and committing suicide as Lily and Rosepetal had done.
Honeysweet remembered how much she’d cried when she found out that was to be her fate from her kidnappers, and that there was no chance of escape. Ironically enough, she had fled her clan to escape an arranged mating. He had been a rather dull individual that was more than twice her age, but not for the first time she wished she’d accept their wishes, rather than end up in this harem. Oh, the elder had warned her endlessly of what would happen to her if she defied the wishes of her clan!! Yet not even in his most dire imaginations could he have imagined that she would be faced with the Kleaves.

“Anyhow, do you know why they called us back from our chores so early today?” asked Sparkles.

“Didn’t one of the handlers tell you on your way back?” cried Honeysweet. Sparkles gave Honeysweet a blank look. “They’re bringing in one of the fire drakes to come…visit us,” answered Honeysweet.

“Oh right…I suppose I did hear something like that on my way back,” unfurling her wings slightly with a sheepish smile. Honeysweet couldn’t help but snort. Sparkles wasn’t necessarily stupid, but she was habitually absent minded.

“So, do you know who they might be bringing?” inquired Sparkles.

“How should I know? Personally, I hope its not that brute Flamer-2…” she growled.

“He was awful…” sighed Sparkles. The big drake had barged into the harem as if he were Gyramond himself, bellowing that ‘all these whores belong to me’, and was about to jump on top of Sparkles before the drake handler had shocked him into unconsciousness.

“Yeah…he’s the type of stereotypical male that all the old matrons back in male clan always warned that young drakka should stay away from,” cringed Honeysweet. Sparkles nodded in agreement. However, it wasn’t as if either of them would get a say in the matter. If it did turn out to be him, Honeysweet resolved to slash her neck open, even if it meant leaving poor Sparkles alone.

“What if its that other one? The cute one?” teased Sparkles.

Honeysweet wasn’t able to stop herself from uttering a startled yelp, before she attempted to cover it up with an averted gaze. “Which other one? There were at least three others that came to visit us.”

“Come on Honeysweet!! You know, the one that talked only to you!!” she re-emphasized, nudging her again.
“Right…Flamer-7… or whoever he was…” replied Honeysweet, trying to feign ignorance. There’d been something uncanny about him, though she still could not put a claw as to why that was. She couldn’t help but think back on how foolish, but at the same time, endearing he was, almost as if he really cared about what happened to all of them. Of course, there was the chance that it could all be an act; males were known to do anything to get what they wanted after all…

“Hey you two!! Hurry up in there!!” cried the voice of one of the drakka out in the larger chamber.
“All right!! We’ll be right out!!” answered Honeysweet. She closed tighty the water chute above her, shook herself dry, before exiting toward the harem. The three other drakka were already chattering amongst themselves.

“I couldn’t help but listen in on you two,” said Starry. “I don’t see how you can be so excited about a candidate male coming to see us. I mean, I’m sure you know full well how the breeder males treat the drakka around here.”

Honeysweet shuddered, “Yeah…I know.” The first time she’d peeked in on it, she’d been utterly terrified. Nowadays though, after months of being here, she was just hoping that they’d pick one of the fire drakes other than the brute, so she could just be done with it instead of having to wait and wait and live with the uncertainty.

“Honeysweet’s hoping that its cute one!!” giggled Sparkles.

Honeysweet tried to keep her expression neutral, “I-I did not ever say that now did I?”

“Flamer-7 right? He did seem earnest, but males like that are unpredictable,” said Starry, “I hope its that more mature one, Flamer-8.”

“I thought he was boring…” whined Sparkles. “Yet maybe because he’s closer to your age you see something we don’t.”

Starry shrugged, “Actually, I thought he was kind of boring too. Yet he’d know what he’s doing, if you know what I mean.”

“You mean he’s more stable right? Less likely to go on power trips.” replied Honeysweet. She supposed it wouldn’t have been too bad.

“You can hope all you want,” growled Cherry, “It might make you feel better for the moment, and even if the one you hope for gets chosen as the breeder male, don’t be too disappointed if it turns out he’s not quite the white knight you envisioned.”

“All they really care about is sticking their dick inside of you. They’re all such simple and base creatures. So long as you make them think they’re giving you a soul-shattering orgasm they’ll think they’re Gyramond’s reincarnation and that’ll make life more tolerable for all of us,” added Rocket.

“Mating shouldn’t be like that…” insisted Sparkles with a soft whine.

“Are you kidding me?” snorted Rocket, rolling her eyes. “But of course you’d say that. You’d never had a hulking brute stick it up you before. Trust me, the first time is the worst. You’ll wish that you died, and you’ll realize you aren’t worth a shit…”

“You don’t have to be so blunt about it” sighed Honeysweet.

“Blunt am I? You can wish for the sky if you want,” snorted Rocket, “In fact, I hope that Flamer-7 that you’ve been pining for gets chosen and that he turns out to be a brute like the rest of them. Hopefully, after you’ve cried and left you bleeding, you’ll still be aware long enough for me to say I told you so.”

“Enough you two, this isn’t helping things,” growled Starry sternly. Rocket rolled her eyes, but backed away with a huff, settling down to her corner of the harem and restarting her conversation with Cherry.

“Look you two,” said Starry in a very big sisterly way to the two younger drakka, in which in many ways she was, despite not being very much older than the two of them, “I know its not what any of us intended, but compared to the place I was before, honestly I’m grateful that we’ll only have to deal with one breeder male rather than have to serve many. Besides, we have solid rock over our head and a full meal a day, and that’s better than dying isn’t it?”

“I suppose you’re right,” answered Honeysweet.

“Don’t let it bother you so much Honeysweet,” answered Starry, pressing her head against Honeysweet’s comfortingly, “We’ll all get through this. You’ll see…”

However, their conversation died just then as male scent wafted into the chamber. Honeysweet’s breath caught in her through as her gaze was focused upon the doorway, and a large shadow appeared.
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.title: Honeysweet

choices: Tessa still thinks Ember should be traded
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.content:
Honeysweet moved away from Starry after the heated argument with the other drakka. She reclined on some of the rough stone surrounding the central exit at the bottom of the chamber. The stone vault in which she lived was feeling especially cramped today.

The sound of water filled the background. One of the wash chutes didn't close tightly enough and so trickled water constantly. The streamlet at least fell into the long "sex-pool" as Honeysweet thought of the dwarfish style straightedged pond and so did not flood the chamber. The sound of it had been maddening when she was first incarcerated here, but now it was actually a little soothing as the dragoness laid her scaly form across the unforgiving stone and awaited a possibly unforgiving suitor. "Please let it be anyone save Flamer-2. Anyone else..." she found herself praying in the tribal dialect of Draconic she'd been raised speaking.

Honeysweet remembered the tribe where she'd grown up. It had all seemed so quaint and primitive back then, but right now, with the benefit of hindsight and having seen the depths a drakka could be driven to, it seemed like paradise in memory. Back then she'd had a family and she'd had a name...

***

"Ember! Ember, there you are! What in heaven are you doing way out here?"

Ember lifted her head slowly, communicating through body language that she was only reluctantly found. Her clutch-mate and sister was intent on bringing her lonesome stargazing to an early end it seemed. Ember spoke in a bitter tone. "What does it matter to you?"

Her sister, whose given name was Tawa'hesia but went by the nickname "Tessa," alighted on the ledge where Ember was perched. Her claws crunched some gravel under her weight and she folded her wings, walking as far up as the narrow prominence would allow. "It matters to everyone where you are, especially your family."

Ember snorted. Right now, her two sisters, mother, and range of aunts and cousins who made up three-quarters of the small tribe did not feel like much of a "family." Ember looked her sister in the eye. "Oh, you mean just so you can make sure I don't escape before the ceremony."

Tessa seemed taken aback, she ruffled her wings uncomfortably. "Of course not! This is a high honor. You should be proud to accept the responsibility of the trade. You represent the best of what our tribe has to offer."

Ember rolled her eyes. "The best of what our tribe has to sell you mean."

Frowning, Tessa reached out her neck and gave the perched dragon a sharp jab to the base of her neck with her snout. Ember let out a "Hey!" in complaint. Tessa said, "I don't know why you're choosing to think about it like that. Imagine, a new life with people who aren't related to you and a strong leader who isn't your father..."

Ember bared her fangs and looked sidelong at her sister pressing close to her flank on the narrow ledge. "No one asked me if I wanted a new life!" Again, Tessa looked stunned. Ember got to her feet and rounded on her sister. Though they were hatched at the same time, Ember had the advantage in size, speed, and muscle mass. "My mother" she spat the word, "and the two other matrons and my father just got together one evening and decided that it should be me who is given to the other tribe. Do you have any idea what that means for me?"

Tessa backed away, clumsily moving her tail out of the way of her hindfeet. She stepped into long grass which reached to her knees and stopped when she bumped into a pine tree. "It's a t-time honored tradition. Every hundred years we trade with one of the other tribes. It keeps the blood fresh."

Ember smirked, happy that she could still intimidate her sister like this. Tessa knew that she was more than a match for her, on land or in the sky. "That and trading up on males."

Tessa gaped and then set her teeth. Growling more than a little she spoke, "How can you speak of father like that?!"

Again, Ember rolled her eyes. Tessa was remarkably naive about certain things. The tribe - which was not even a particularly large one - roamed well beyond the reaches of the New Alverian State which occupied large treks in the north and west of the country of Nod. It consisted almost exclusively of females and exactly one breeding male; currently there were two young males still hanging around, one still a juvenile and the other one seemingly uninterested in trying his luck out among the rocks and plains with the other rogue males. Father watched and lorded over the latter especially lest he ever get the thought into his head to challenge the old man for leadership.

And what a thin leadership it was! Any drakka in the tribe was larger and more muscular than the stringy, light-built male. His strength lay in maneuvering during flight, but a good tail swipe would send him flying, undoubtedly. In addition to his seed, the females of the tribe required little else of him. And everyone knew this! And yet they all bowed and scraped to him, as if deposing the last male somehow endowed him with the wisdom to make decisions. To Ember, the whole system was sickening; to the females, and even more so to the males. She still lay awake sometimes at night, wondering what ever happened to her brother, Nie'andre. Tessa would never understand. All she dreamed about was becoming a matron in the tribe and having lots of eggs with a strong leader who would whoo her and make life more bearable. Ember had different dreams...

Ember huffed and turned away. "You don't understand."

Despite all of the anger she'd shown her, Tessa sidled up to her sister, rubbing her flank against hers like a large scaly cat. "What don't I understand? You're frightening me, Ember."

Ember sighed. Tessa deserved better than to have her anger taken out on her. "I'm sorry." she attempted to ameliorate and moved her head to rub her chin against her sister's neck. "But don't you ever think... of leaving?"

"Leaving?" asked Tessa quizzically, "Leaving where?"

Ember frowned and took her head away. She looked again up to the star-filled heavens. "The City perhaps..."

Tessa moved away. Her jaw hanging widely, she added in revulsion, "Ugh... you want to live... with humanoids?" she shook her head. "They live in tiny little stick piles... and they smell."

"Not in the city they don't." Ember remarked. "And they say that dragons and humanoids live as equals side by side and no one tries to kill one another or break their eggs."

Clearly Tessa wasn't convinced. And who could blame her really. The towns and villages which dotted the landscape were largely separate from the roving dragon tribes. Whenever a tribe came to settle in an area to tend to ground-bound eggs, the locals either tried to bribe us to stop the thieving of livestock or they came with weapons in twilight - when our eyes were weak - to try to drive us off if they were bold enough. There was never very much conversation either way and tongues other than Draconic were rare in the tribe anyways. They hated us ubiquitously as pests at the least, as vandals and raiders at the worst. And for our part, we were largely disdainful of them and their brief little lives. It seemed hardly worth getting to know a humanoid, they shriveled up and died soon enough. Only the advent of steel weapons and magics which could bring down an unwary dragon forced us to live in tribes in the first place. Tales were still told of the long gone "good days" when a single dragon could roam the heavens and earth without fear of thieves or assassins. When we lived as intelligent beasts and gods of the sky and earth. There were no tribes then, each dragon was a force of nature unto him or herself, and our spawn could be released into the wild with moderate expectations of surviving to unveil their wings and ascend to godhood.

Now we carried our young on our backs to keep them safe from poachers with steel tipped arrows and sorcerers looking for ingredients for their witchery. We lived with a fear that none of us dared name and would openly laugh at, but had changed our lives nonetheless.

Tessa shook her head, a little loose skin rippling under her jaw, "And I'm sure that the streets are paved with gold as well... more likely broken eggshells!"

Ember hissed at the image. "Tessa! You have no idea do you?"

Her sister back up a little, leaning her rump against the tree and causing it to groan in the thin soil. She seemed a little ashamed of what she'd just said as well. "So go then! After the ceremony, you can take off and live in your Alverian paradise or whatever."

Tessa was angry, though because she thought Ember was being foolish or because she was jealous was uncertain. "But I can't," rumbled Ember, grinding the rocks in her crop. "Do you really think they'll let me leave once I'm traded? I'm sure lots of girls try to leave. They'll keep me prisoner."
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.title: My Name

choices: Stay with Honeysweet a while longer
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.content:
Tessa snorted and lifted her snout. "Well maybe they should."

"What?!" asked Ember, jabbing her face forward with glowing night eyes.

Her sister flinched, but remained surprisingly strong, she poked Ember with her wing talon to gain some more space. "Maybe they should keep you!" she cried. "If you're having delusions of wandering the country by yourself. It's not safe out there, Ember. Someone will kill you or rape you or worse!"

Now Ember's blood felt hot again. She shook out her wings and flapped them against her sister, sending dust and pebbles flying into her face. "Yeah, well maybe I think that freedom is worth a little risk. It's better than waiting around here, getting screwed by some macho little drake twice my age! It's got to be better than being traded away from everyone I know like I'm a goddamned horse! Or are you happy I'm being married away to another clan?"

Tessa seemed on the verge of tears now and Ember felt remarkably un-proud of herself. She blinked away the dust from her eyes with her water lids and said, sniveling, "I'm not happy you're leaving!" her voice cracked, "You're my sister! I don't know what I'm going to do without you!"

Ember felt like she was falling through space. Then hot tears leaked onto her own cheeks, leaving clean tracks in the dust, which coated them. When she moved forward, Tessa flinched and that hurt all the more, but she drew her into an unresisting embrace with her wings. "Don't cry Tessa. It's going to be alright." said Ember, but the words were hollow. She wasn't sure yet what she was going to do, but she was pretty sure it wasn't going to be alright.

In the end, both sisters wound up hugging and apologizing for harsh words on both sides. The tribe was small and you learned how to get along with each other when your world essentially consisted of 30-odd dragons. Familial bonds would ride out any tension... or so it seemed at least. Forbidden thoughts were running through Ember's head and for her, the situation was from from resolved.

***

The tribe had settled on some ledges on the step side of a rocky valley. Some digging had expanded the habitable regions on the various shelves which would support a dragon's weight while the tribe stopped so that Ember's first cousin Ysal'sul could tend to her eggs. It was before midday on Ember's last day of freedom.

Ember had not slept. Instead she had lain awake on her shelf between the comforting warmth of her mother and sister while they rested. It had been very hard not to be listless or to toss and turn. She'd lain still despite the discomfort and listened to the sounds of her family breathing. She was aware that this might be the last opportunity to do so. Inside, her thoughts raged in a dark storm.

Kesir'ria, Ember's mother, awoke first, which meant it was time for everyone to get up on the small shelf of bare stone and loose dirt. Kesir'ria was 350 years old, fading out of her breeding years, but not yet old enough to be a matron. Still, she'd undoubtedly been consulted before Ember had been chosen for the trade to take place tomorrow at dawn with the other tribe. Ember wondered what she'd said when they told her they wanted to take her daughter. Feeling a darkness grow a little inside of her, Ember imagined that her mother thought it a great privilege and nothing else.

Kesir'ria stretched, working the kinks out of her spine and then turned to Ember as if she knew she'd been awake. She smiled down at her daughter and despite her dark mood, Ember could not help smiling back. "Embre'ailie, you have not eaten in two days. Would you like me to catch you something? The cows in the village below looked especially fat."

The older drakka's voice was sharp and Ember's mother tended not to waste words. But simply by the offer, Ember knew that she was being buttered up. "No, you don't need to do that. There's no sense in getting the humanoids all riled up."

Her mother ground the stones in her crop and hissed a little over them, a disarming sound. "Psshh, it's worth treating my daughter one last time. This is a special occasion. Besides, my niece's eggs are due to hatch within a fortnight. These shelves will be cold before they can do much."

It was clear that Kesir'ria had already made up her mind. Ember smiled up at her and touched her with her wing, her mother seemed only a little surprised at the contact. "Go then. I'm sure we'll have a fine feast."

The drakka beamed down at her daughter like only a mother can and leaped off the side of the shelf to drift down the length of the valley to raid the village. Ember watched the wind carry her away until her large body seemed as insignificant as a gnat's. It was the last time that she saw her mother.

Tessa had gone back to sleep. The sun had already dawned by the time they'd made the flight back to the valley where the tribe currently resided. Wild dragons were most active in full day and deep night, skipping mornings and evenings, so Tessa was correct in trying to make up lost sleep. Ember stood. She was tired too and hungry to boot. But there wasn't any time left. She knelt her head down and nuzzled the top of Tessa's head. "Goodbye dear sister. I'll never forget where I came from."

Ember flinched when Tessa stirred, but it was only to curl up tighter and hug her tail to her chest like a juvenile. Before the tears could come, Ember threw herself off the ledge. For a second, she contemplated another form of escape, but then decided to unfurl her wings. She flew away, dead east, directly towards the jewel that was New Alveri beyond the horizon.

***

Honeysweet flashed back to the present, sighing. She wondered if she would have made the same decision again, knowing what awaited her with the Kleaves. All that she’d really done was to condemn her sister to marry that wretch back home instead. Indeed, she’d been horribly selfish. In fact, she’d been out of her mind when she’d said she would make it big. The only thing she'd made big, was the big mistake she'd made.

***

Ember stared up at the huge walls of New Alveri. Just beyond she could see its gleaming towers, its hustle and bustle, all its fabulous wealth and riches. The sights still left her with a great sense of awe since she had arrived at its outskirts about a couple weeks prior. However, the big problem now was getting int. Of course, that was easier said than done.

A gigantic dragon clad in full armor guarded the main gate, whose wings seemed to swallow the sky when fully unfurled. Alongside the behemoth were several humanoid guards with weapons. Of course, it had occurred to her to fly over the wall and into the city, yet several guard towers, not to mention dragons, also patrolled the perimeter 24 hours a day to keep out dragons exactly like her.

She was more than willing to work to try and get into the city. Yet the sort of ‘employers’ she’d been approached by were shifty eyed drakes telling her how smooth her body was and how they’d pay big money for her services. Ember had hissed at them each time. If she’d intended to be ravaged in such a fashion, she’d have stayed behind in the clan. Furthermore, when searching for work, she’d been at a horrible disadvantage as the requirements were that she know how to read and write in standard draconic, which was something that her clan had deemed unnecessary. In contrast, even the poorest of the draconic locals she'd seen passing by not only knew how to read and write, but also they spoke a vareity of the humanoid tongues.

However, she was running out of options. Hard reality had set in, as she still needed to find somewhere to sleep, something to eat and to drink. The first shocking reality was that in the area right outside the city, there were next to no wild animals that could be freely hunted. They all belonged to humanoid farmers, merchants or whatnot, so she had been forced to eat thin strays and carcasses. She would spend her nights in a dinky, exposed clearance on the edge of the mountain.

“Maybe I should just go back. Hopefully the clan will accept me back and won’t be too harsh…” she whispered to herself.

“Hey you? Looking to find a way into the city?”

Ember shifted her gaze toward the direction of the sound. It was a small little humanoid. Honestly, it had been the first time that she’d been directly approached by one of them, and Ember had to admit it was very brave of him to say so.

“What makes you think that?” snarled Ember.

The humanoid, Ember wasn’t sure whether it was a human or an elf- it might have been a mix, grinned, “I’ve been observing you watching up at the wall for quite a while now. You seem the ambitious sort that wants to make it big… I know a secret passageway through the mountains that leads directly into the city.”

“How do I know that this isn’t some sort of trick?” growled Ember. He reeked of suspicion.

“You don’t actually,” he flat out admitted, “Yet besides, if I end up lying to you, I end up dead don’t I? Plus, what do you have to lose by doing so?”
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.title: Outsider looking in

1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.content:
Honeysweet wanted to hit something when she recalled that encounter. Of course that humanoid hadn’t been faithful to his promise, yet she’d been too daring, too desperate and also too trusting that there wasn’t anything the lone humanoid could do to her physically. That humanoid; whom she’d never learned the name of, had indeed led her into a secret passageway through the caves. The last thing she had remembered was emerging into this warehouse and a blue mist. When she’d awakened, she’d found herself blindfolded and in chains, and on her way to sexual slavery under the Kleaves.

Her thoughts were interrupted when an unmistakably male scent hit her nostrils.

In came Flamer-7, his handler at his side, hand on the shocker. He was much larger than the last time Honeysweet had saw him, about her size now. She'd been one of the larger females in her clan, and the transformation was admittedly astonishing. While he was about the size of father now, he certainly wasn't as thick and muscular. When the now buff drake switched his gaze in her direction, Honeysweet couldn't help but gasp. There was that hunger in his eyes now, far more apparent than last time.

"Hello Honeysweet," said the drake with a fond smile and a deep masculine voice that made her stomach flutter. More ominously, his complete attention was focused upon her, not seeming interested at all in giving a glance toward the others. Honeysweet shifted her gaze toward the others for support, not finding any. The others understandably wanted as little to do with the potential breeder male as possible, and were basically placing all the burden on Honeysweet until the male handler decided he’d had enough time. She decided that perhaps it would be best to keep the potential breeder male engaged; so he wouldn’t try something violent, even if he didn’t seem the sort.

“You…would be Flamer-7 right?” answered Honeysweet, trying not to sound too interested.

“That’s right,” he answered, almost hurt that she'd seemingly needed a moment to recognize him.

"I…just wanted to make sure… You’ve grown quite a lot since the last I saw you, how did you grow so quickly?" she couldn't help but ask. She'd heard of males getting rapid growth spurts, yet this was ridiculous. He’d been rather skinny and even runtish before, but now he was pure rippling muscle. Flamer-7's gaze grew surprised for a moment, as if just realizing it himself.

“Nutritious food and lots of exercise of course, along with some additional… supplements” he answered, with a contrite grin that could not hide a distinct sense of discomfort. She’d heard of nasty rumors about how the males were experimented on and broken psychologically in order to turn them into sex-crazed beasts. Whatever the Kleaves had done to him, at least on one point she couldn’t help but note the substantial improvement of his figure, nor would she have to worry about her male lacking physical vigor.

“I expect I’ll still grow a bit more. Why a year from now, I might be the same size as a Sky-Swallower.”

“You’re joking right?” she retorted with a measure of alarm.

Flamer-7 puffed a plumb of smoke out of his nostrils, “I hope I am joking…”

Honeysweet couldn’t help but cough out a sound that was a mix between humor and uneasiness.

“Anyhow, has everything been all right for you and the other drakka? Are you all getting along?” he asked. “Maybe you could introduce me…”

Honeysweet gave a quick rundown of the others, whom while they allowed her to reveal their names, none of them seemed willing to include themselves into the conversation.

Out of the corner of her eye, she could see both Cherry and Rocket roll their eyes. They knew better than to openly display their disdain toward Flamer-7, lest on the off chance he actually become the breeder male and make them pay for it. Still, they didn't need to always act so...stereotypically whorish.

“Oh…don’t mind us…” said Rocket, “You two just continue acting all friendly now.”

Honeysweet could almost see the venom dripping out of her jaw as she said that. She couldn’t help but feel satisfied that Flamer-7 didn’t appear to want to have anything to do with them either.

Sparkles, on the other claw, merely watched with wide eyes, curious yet scared at the same time. Whenever the males had come to visit, her normally ditzy self dissolved into frightened silence. Starry perched herself next to Sparkles protectively, just in case Flamer-7 attempted to jump her like Flamer-2 had.

“Sparkles isn’t usually like this, she’s normally a lot more talkative,” appeased Starry.

“No doubt because she’s too much in awe at how handsome I am…” he answered with an amused snort. Honeysweet wasn’t sure whether it was genuine self-flattery, or self-deprecation. Yet she did want to shift Flamer-7’s attention away from Sparkles, so she decided to ask another question.

“How well do you get along with the other males?” she wondered.

“Considering only one of us can be the breeder male, we aren’t exactly making friends with one another. Don’t get me wrong, Flamer-8 and Flamer-6, aren’t the worst drakes in the world. We have this mutual understanding when the time comes for us to screw each other over, its nothing personal. In the meantime, we try to work things out so life isn’t quite so shitty,” he answered almost casually.

“What about Flamer-2?” inquired Honeysweet.

“Lets just say we’re not particularly enamored of each other…” he answered. Though he tried to keep his expression casual, there was no hiding the disdain and hate on Flamer-7’s face, the tensing of his muscles, the low growl that came out of his throat, but most of all, the way his eyes suddenly lit up was frightening. She was not surprised at this at all; in fact, there could be no two drakes that could be more different personality wise.

“Lets switch the subject before I start slamming my tail against the wall. Anyhow, mind telling me where you came from?” he asked. Honeysweet wondered if Flamer-7 was completely out of his mind, but for a moment she couldn’t help but think of her old clan, of Tessa, mother, her cousins and even father. She sniffled, doing her best to stifle a tear.

“Sorry, I probably shouldn’t have asked you that. You must miss them a lot.” Said Flamer-7 with genuine regret. The fact that it was not a superficial question only made her feel worse.

“Then why did you ask me that? You knew that I wouldn’t have been able to answer that.” she snapped, with more violence than she had intended.

Flamer-7 sighed, “Don’t know really. You strike me as the kind of dragon who values that sort of thing, especially in this kind of place. I’d just been thinking about you ever since that first time we met,” admitted Flamer-7.

“But why me?” Honeysweet’s hearts began to pound, but she managed to catch herself.

“Don’t know why really,” he shrugged, “When I saw you, you just seemed like someone who needed encouragement, that’s all. You remind me of many of the things I lost when I got kidnapped.”

“Really?” she inquired.

“Or perhaps, less glamorously, it’s a way that I’d be able to make you more open to being fucked,” he finished with an offhand smirk. “Can’t say you’re entirely wrong on that. You are very beautiful. Not just on the outside though, but also on the inside.”

Honeysweet blushed deeply, despite herself and the corniness of the statement. Of course, Flamer-2 had roared about how smoking hot all the drakka were and how he wanted to be inside of them, but hearing it from Flamer-7 was somehow different, almost as if he actually saw her as something beyond a fuck-toy.

Flamer-7 snorted, “I guess its just a way for me to fool myself into thinking that I won’t be like the other breeder males, if I survive that long, nor a tool of the Kleaves, and that there’s something to really fight for besides not getting my balls cut off.”

Starry had warned her of males that would put on a sympathetic act in order to fool the drakka, and served as a particularly sinister way to get them to roll over. However, his spiel had already suckered in Honeysweet, and she prayed to the Ancestors that he really meant those words. Like Flamer-7 had said, it was a way for her to pretend that things weren’t quite as awful as they really were, and not everybody here was out to hurt her. For the first time since she’d left her clan, she genuinely felt warm inside.

Suddenly... “You’ve had enough loverboy?” growled the voice of the drake handler.

“Ehh…sorry,” apologized Flamer-7, “You said look but don’t touch.”

“Anyhow, its been nice talking to you Honeysweet,” he said with a smile, “Hopefully we’ll be able to see each other again.”

He said that in such a way as if they were on the streets of New Alveri or something like that, as if the only things they had to worry about were disgruntled fathers, gossiping clansmates and other ‘normal’ things.

“You too Flamer-7. Take care of yourself until then…” she answered.

Flamer-7 answered with a nod, before he turned away. Honeysweet watched him every step of the way, wishing he could stay longer. Her brain told her that she shouldn’t invest her heart in hoping that Flamer-7 would get chosen, but she didn’t care any more. She needed something that she could keep fighting for, to be able to see beyond this horrible place and that there was the possibility of a new life, of a light at the end of the tunnel.
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.title: Someone to fight for

choices: Flamer-2 lies to use the weights
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.content:
Blaze walked back into the large vault where he was confined with the other male fire-drakes with something of a spring in his step. Wolf, who trotted beside him noticed and said as much when he pushed the door closed behind the two of them.

"Oh?" asked Blaze. "Well, who wouldn't be happy after seeing and smelling all those horny drakka!" Blaze feigned machismo, but Wolf was too insightful.

"Oh yeah?" he said crossing his arms. "I saw you in there. You went right for the tall one." He chortled. "I can't tell that much, but she has a smooth set of scales, and they tell me that counts. Curvy too I might add..." Wolf made a clicking noise with his cheek which disturbed the young drake, but not as much as the red scaled face with peered down at the two of them from over the ledge leading down to the entrance.

"Oh so the hot-shot has got a girlfriend, eh?" remarked Flamer-2. He was probably trying to be sarcastic, but he came across as just angry.

Blaze hissed and showed his teeth. "I have no such thing. They're just... they're just whores. That's all." Blaze figured that a lie would protect Honeysweet better than admitting to his love for her - and her body - but he was dismayed to have bungled his cover-up so badly.

Wolf just shrugged and walked out the smaller exit set in the big door. Blaze and Flamer-2 stared at each other for a long time. Finally Flamer-2 rose and paced away. As he went, though he muttered audibly. "They all belong to me... Even if they don't know it yet." Blaze did nothing in response, though the testosterone surging in his veins demanded satisfaction in the form of Flamer-2 face ground into the floor. But Blaze didn't want to fight unless he had to. He had to hang onto to that part of his old self, he just had to...

***

Four days after Blaze went to see Honeysweet, Blaze found himself in an unusual situation. His clawed hands gripped a rough steel bar and he pulled it towards his chest while lying carefully on his back. The heavy weights to the side lifted and the welded frame supporting it and the chains connecting them to the bar dangling overhead groaned, but was steady. Blaze felt the strain and burning in his chest... and, unbelievably, he liked it. Not just because it eased the spasming in his muscles either.

Blaze pulled down hard on the bar, barely budging the connected weights. Blaze had asked for all of them, and there were even a couple trolls sitting on the mass of iron until Flamer-6 shooed them away for their own safety. Blaze thought of Flamer-2, hoping to get himself angry enough to move the weight... but it wasn't enough. They fell with a clang against the floor. Dragons don't sweat, but to either side of him, the veins stretching through the leather of his wings were livid as they tried to cool his body. Blaze rested his head against the floor, or rather on the stilt that his horns provided. He knew Flamer-6 was watching, but the lame dragon didn't say anything. Blaze would have shouted at him if he had.

He drew in several deep breaths, trying to concentrate. He knew he could do this... When the idea came it was startlingly simple. With a grin, Blaze tensed his shoulders and pulled down. As he did, he imagined Honeysweet's face. He remembered the way she'd spread her long body out on the stone... He didn't need to imagine her in danger (he did that enough on his own though), just the simple memory of her from that day was enough to break through the wall. He pulled the mass of iron and rock high and then lowered it until it was just above the ground, then raised it again. He repeated this five times and then let it down softly.

Blaze snaked his way out of Flamer-6's hollow. Panting lightly, he nodded to the other dragon. "That's some machine you built." Blaze lifted a foreleg and flexed it, feeling the bad-good ache. "I like it."

Flamer-6 grinned. "It wasn't all me. Yayo'jin did the tension math for me and Bal'lal improved on my initial design."

Blaze ventured a grin himself. He'd been using the machine now for the last couple days and it seemed easier to like Flamer-6 now. It helped that Blaze just assumed that Flamer-6 was going to be dropped out of the program at one point or another; it was sort of obvious, though you couldn't tell by the way the twitchy dragon carried himself or how he spoke alone. Although he couldn't afford to let his guard down entirely, the less Blaze chose to view Flamer-6 as a computer, the less there was to dislike about the drake.

And really, all Flamer-6 seemed intent on nowadays was pissing off Flamer-2 as much as possible. Granted, it honestly didn't seem intentional - at least most of the time - but at every turn Flamer-2 was the one being snubbed. It had really started before Flamer-6 had completed his weight-training machine, but its construction just brought things to a head that much faster. The day it was built, Flamer-2 openly derided it and its makeshift appearance. However as soon as both Blaze and Flamer-8 seemed to be enjoying it, of course he demanded a turn at it. It almost exploded right then.

In exchange for its use, Flamer-6 wanted certain favors; an extra fish perhaps - the lame drake was still having to make due on the smallest cut of the daily fish pile - but what he really wanted was protection. From Flamer-2, however, he demanded that he stop eating the trolls that venture out of the safety of his tiny hollow. From Flamer-2's expression at the very idea that he could "owe" Flamer-6 anything, Blaze had thought that there was going to be a fight right then and there. Blaze was ambivalent about stepping in, but then Flamer-2 threatened to destroy the machine if he couldn't use it. That caused Blaze to jump down, followed shortly by Flamer-8.

"Oh, I get it. You're all ganging up on me huh? Why don't you fight me fair for once, you coward?!" The last was directed right at Blaze for a reason Blaze still did not fully understand.

Blaze hated having Flamer-2's attention turned on him, but for some reason, the bigger dragon had gotten into his head that Blaze was his biggest rival. Something about the young fire-drake just seemed to put Flamer-2 on edge, even more so than Flamer-6. However Flamer-2 knew that he couldn't take on all three of them simultaneously. "Just get out of here." Blaze had said then.

"Fine!" Flamer-2 had spat, "Why don't you all just chew on this then." Then the vile drake had just emptied his bowls right then and there, not even bothering to squat. Revulsion had coursed through Blaze at the display and he had to retreat to his ledge to escape the smell.

When Flamer-8 had alighted on his own perch, he'd remarked, "That dragon is insane."

Blaze had watched some trolls emerge from Flamer-6's hollow and begin to clean up the mess with makeshift shovels. Flamer-2, for his part paced back and forth along his half of the room. The young drake had shook his head sadly "I know he is."

When Blaze had finished his morning workout on the machine, three days after that first incident with Flamer-2, Flamer-8 stepped down to have his turn at it. The machine was re-giged so that the older drake could pull from opposite directions towards his chest. Blaze thought he was just showing off. However, this was interrupted by the opening of the vault door. Dr. Moridin appeared, so Blaze knew it couldn't be any good.

As it turned out, it was time for another series of injections. The only upside was that they did not inject directly into Blaze's spinal implants. Rather, he received just two, one to the neck and another in his rump. It was far more tolerable and Blaze hoped that it was a sign that they were beginning to wean him off the mix of unknown drugs he was on.

The elves had left as quickly and unannounced as they'd come and the dragons were left to deal with the side-effect by themselves. As always, Blaze felt hot, over-stimulated and hungry. Flamer-6's palsy worsened significantly and Flamer-8 was annoyingly blithe and unaffected as usual.

Afterwards, Blaze would always think it was the drugs that provoked Flamer-2's decision to reassert himself with Flamer-6. However, even without the steroids coursing through his veins, something like this was bound to happen eventually. Flamer-2 had been uneasy and unsettlingly quiet for the last couple days, ever since having been turned back yet again by the united front of the other three. It was clear that something was building to a head inside that dragon. Being locked in here with nothing else to do was just making it worse.

That very evening, Blaze found out just how far Flamer-2 had fallen.
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.title: Weights and Roids

1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.content:
The air in the vault cavern was still tense when the fish cart was pulled into the flattened center of the room. Blaze was actually hoping that Wolf would arrive with news of some new trial or such, anything to break the turbulent undercurrents between the various dragons. But it was not to be. Wolf left without saying a word and again the dragons were left to divide the fish among themselves. Despite the fact that the weeks had ground into them something of a routine, the actual dividing was still something of a free-for-all. Blaze and Flamer-8 went at the pile dumped out of the cart simultanenously, followed shortly by Flamer-2. As long as the hated drake didn't try something stupid like claiming the lot for himself, his presence was tolerated. Flamer-6 got what was left when they'd eaten their fill.

Blaze grabbed at a rather handsome looking porpoise and after just a few growls and hisses at Flamer-8, eventually got his way. He dragged the heavy fish into the air and up to his ledge to eat in peace. It was all he would eat today, but Blaze felt that the added privacy was worth a slight reduction in the total volume of meat. Besides, he'd grown to like the taste of dolphin blubber, very different from albacore.

As he ate, Blaze watched the feasting below with a cautious eye towards Flamer-2. He should have known something was wrong when he noticed Flamer-2 hanging back, eating more slowly. Although, slow for Flamer-2 still involved swallowing medium sized fish whole and biting full grown tuna in half.

"Hey cripple!!" snorted Flamer-2 suddenly.

"What do you want?" growled Flamer-6, eyes narrowing from the sidelines as he waited for the two larger dragons to finish.

"I want to use the exercise machine..." he demanded.

"Y-you do, do you?" answered Flamer-6 with mild surprise, "Again, my terms are that you won't harm any of the trolls ever again, and furthermore because you decided to shit on my territory you’ll owe me a full portion of albacore every time you want to use it,” he outlined.

Flamer-2 dug his claws into the stone at the increased cost. “How about I take a shit down your throat cripple?” snarled Flamer-2, his jaws still dripping with fish guts.

Flamer-8 grunted at Flamer-2 from across the already decreased fish pile and Blaze also stretched his wings from where he say on his perch. Both dragons weren't going to allow Flamer-2 to start this up again with the lame drake.

Then, Flamer-2 did something completely inexplicable. He turned his nose down to the fish at his feet. Then he grabbed one of the few remaining whole tuna in his jaws and with a powerful jerk of his neck tossed it to land before Flamer-6. Then he grabbed another, the last which was not already claimed by Flamer-8 and chucked it after the first. Blaze was honestly shocked by Flamer-2's acquiescence.

“Here’s your fish…” growled Flamer-2. Flamer-6 gasped with understandable surprise. He sniffed the fish, checking for any taint, yet apparently there was none. He set into a finer meal than he could have expected otherwise with obvious relish.

"F-fine... you can use it for this evening..." said Flamer-6 with obvious reluctance when he lifted his head from a half-finished tuna. Blaze had a very bad feeling about this. Flamer-2 willingly giving Flamer-6 a portion of his ration was very unlike the vile drake's usual behavior. Yet there was nothing he could do at the moment, save for hope that Flamer-2 would work off his steam lifting those weights.

Understandably, the trolls were reluctant to place themselves within the weights. They knew full well of Flamer-2’s appetite for their kind and looked to Flamer-6 uneasily.

Flamer-2 strode smugly over the remaining fish on the tiled center of the room. Flamer-6 watched the larger dragon carefully as he mounted the contraption, setting himself inside, but barely fitting due to his sheer bulk of muscle. Without question, the troll operating the assembly set the weight load at maximum. However, Flamer-2 paused before rolling over to grasp the dangling bar.

Blaze watched helplessly from above as Flamer-2 reached out with his forepaws ahead of him and wings behind. He grasped the stout bars of crudely shaped iron with claw and wing talon and pulled with tremendous and terrible strength. He tore the contraption asunder over his back. Three trolls fell from a crippling height to the unforgiving stone below and a broken chain whipped sending two more broken trolls flying and tearing another asunder completely. Another chain struck Flamer-2's flank, but his scales withstood the blow without breaking. Flamer-2 let out a roar of pain and bestial delight as the iron fell around him and Flamer-6 could only stand and watch, trembling.

"You lose!! Now nobody can use that stupid contraption of yours!! Nobody do you hear me?” roared Flamer-2 stepping over the ruin, heedless of the troll bodies under him. To add insult to injury and to prevent the remaining trolls from helping their fellows, Flamer-2 turned his head over his shoulder and belched forth a torrent of flame to engulf the ruin of the device. The shrieking of burning trolls filled the chamber then... but only briefly.

Yet Flamer-6 merely stared at the destruction that Flamer-2 had wrought with a blank stare. The only sound that filled the room for about a minute was the squeal of a twisted metal beam as it burned, dangling from a former support beam. When the heat had sufficiently changed its shape and texture, it snapped off and landed on the cave floor with an echoing clang.

“So, how does it feel cripple? Not so smart after all, huh? Maybe if you cry and beg, I might let some of your precious little trolls live…” he bellowed.

“You’ll regret saying that, bastard!!” roared Blaze, wings unfurling. His claws gripped the edge of his perch so hard the stone crumbled under them.

“Oh, are you about to come save your fuck buddy now?” growled Flamer-2.

Blaze bent down to leap into the fray, yet Flamer-6 snapped his gaze back up at Blaze, signaling with a grunt that he wanted to stand up to Flamer-2 alone.

“Is that it F-flamer-2?” said Flamer-6 emotionlessly. “Was this your juvenile idea of g-getting revenge and p-proving you’re better than everyone else?”

“HA!! I am better than you cripple!! Bigger, stronger, faster and more powerful!! I don’t need to follow your stupid rules!! The only rules that matter here is that I’m Flamer-2 and I am King!!” he roared and even launched a gout of flame up into the air for emphasis.

“Oh, is that what you think? A king? A k-king is able to make rational judgment, a king can control his emotions, a king can control his will. What you’ve shown me is that you’re not a king, nor are you even a slave. These are the actions of an animal.”

“An animal you say?” sneered Flamer-2, yet his voice didn’t carry its usual edge. He strutted forward and forced Flamer-6 to give way. "Well, I got the better of you. You're stupid machine is burning now and it's because of me!"

“Exactly. It's not worth g-getting upset over the actions of an animal. S-sure, in your case it can occasionally talk and boast, but it doesn’t really have any self control, identity, nor question its purpose. So long as you are allowed to eat, kill and fuck, you will be completely compliant, never questioning your purpose. That's why you're so perfect for the Kleaves...”

“J-just shut the fuck up!! You don’t know what you’re talking about cripple!!” Flamer-2 bellowed. The big dragon forced his way forward again, trying to impose with his weight and size, but Flamer-6 just kept moving away, hopping over his limp at times. He led Flamer-2 in a big circle around the middle of the vast chamber, and just kept talking.

Flamer-6 tilted his head sideways, his expression still impassive. Yet Blaze could see a glint in Flamer-6’s eyes, like he’d been wanting to do this to Flamer-2 for a long time.

“Is that so? Prove me that I’m wrong." The lame dragon cleared his throat and then did something completely unexpected. "My name is Ral’pherinox…” The moment he spoke announced name, a small red light appeared on his inhibitor collar and the dragon went stiff and fell over as a powerful current coursed through his body

Flamer-6 trembled on the ground, his eyes rolling back in his head. He bit his tongue and pissed himself. But after two seconds it was over and the dragon's body relaxed; though still he twitched a bit. Though it was plain that he was still in pain, Flamer-6 wobbled back to his feet and looked up at a flabbergasted Flamer-2.

“Y-yes…that is my n-name. I’d studied as an elemental engineer under my f-father in Damescara. Every y-year, during my apprenticeship we would design a complex machine, and after we were finished, we would destroy it. He taught me that its not the machines themselves that make us great engineers, but r-rather the drive to keep imagining and never letting old designs hinder the new. S-so no matter how many times you destroy my machine, no m-matter how many trolls you k-kill, I can always make a new machine. Its what makes us dragons, rather than animals,” continued Flamer-6.

“And what about you Flamer-2? You never did say what your real name was…” growled Flamer-6.
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.title: Are you a dragon, or a beast? Redux.

choices: Get help and then go save Honeysweet
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.content:
Flamer-2 snorted amusedly, but the snort was hollow, “You still think I’d fall for that old trick? I’m not about to be shocked to prove I’m stronger than you…”

“Yes…yes…the same old excuse as before isn’t it? Aren’t you the biggest and strongest dragon there is? The self-proclaimed King of this miserable hovel? Don’t tell me you’re afraid of that puny little human with his shocker now… Its your turn now Flamer-2…” Flamer-6 prodded.

The big dragon looked visibly shaken, alarmed that Flamer-6 had actually gone through with it. While he tried to maintain his arrogant sneer, Blaze could see the uncertainty and fear in his eyes. Flamer-2 actually seemed to shrink in Blaze's eyes.

“Screw you cripple…” answered Flamer-2. It must have sounded lame, even to him.

Flamer-6 smiled, “Oh? You’re letting a cripple like me get the better of you? What is your name? Yet if you are so scared of being shocked, perhaps only the first letter will do. Wait…you don’t know how to read draconic do you?" Flamer-2 growled and forced his claws through the thick tiles under him, but he stood as if rooted to the spot.

"How about the first sound of your real name? That shouldn't be enough to activate the collar if you're frightened.”

Flamer-2 visibly strained, his breathing growing heavy. The large dragon tossed his head and his eyes seemed distant, not even looking at Flamer-6 now. He let out a ragged breath, obviously struggling with something.

“Oh…I understand now… You don’t even know what your name is anymore do you? Its not your fault if you can’t remember who you are no name…” said Flamer-6 with mock sympathy, “Poor…poor animal…”

Blaze had never seen Flamer-2 so distressed and frightened and confused. The lame yet intelligent drake had just landed a blow far more devastating than any claw swipe, tail swoop or fire breath. In fact, Blaze even contemplated telling Flamer-6 to stop what he was doing, yet found that he could not.

“N-no-name! No-name! No-name! No-name!” chanted Flamer-6.

Flamer-2's head snapped forward and he let out a horrific roar. Before Blaze or Flamer-8 could react, the no-name drake charged forward and skewered Flamer-6 with his horns. Flamer-6 let out a choking noise as his body careened against the rock surrounding the lowered center of the room. Before the lame drake could resist further, Flamer-2 was on top of him and began raking him with his claws while also beating him repeatedly with his heavy tail.

Blaze let out a roar, and then bent down to leap off his perch. Yet his assault was short lived as his shock collar activated, sending him crashing to the floor in agony. It took a monumental effort on his part just to avoid breaking one of his wings as he landed, stiff and writhing.

“Stay where you are!!” bellowed Wolf. He'd pressed all three symbols on the control talisman at once, and all three able drakes had fallen to the ground. He then gestured toward Flamer-8 and Blaze. “If either you move until this mess is sorted out, consider yourselves out of the breeding program!!”

Blaze didn’t know of any other male fire-drakes on the island, yet he couldn’t afford to see this as an empty assertion. Plus, the thought of Honeysweet getting raped by any other male…

“But that bas-“ said Blaze still, lurching forward. Flamer-2 needed to pay.

“Flamer-8, restrain Flamer-7, so he doesn’t go rushing off for a fight…” ordered Wolf.

“Y-yes Master Wolf…” obeyed Flamer-8. Blaze merely gritted his teeth as the older drake deftly slid his tail around his neck while Wolf strode up to the insane drake. He surveyed the scene with anger and dismay. A growing puddle of blood was forming around Flamer-6, his gasps coming ragged and hoarse.

“It…looks like I won’t be in the breeding program anymore,” gasped Flamer-6. Wolf shook his head with something that almost looked like genuine regret, before focusing his attention on Flamer-2. In all honestly, Wolf had quite a lot of guts to confront an insane drake out for blood; or perhaps he was just lacking perspective of what had truly happened just now.

“So you’d finally gone and done it have you beast?” snarled Wolf. “In truth, I’ve been looking for an excuse to get your balls off, and I can’t say I’m not satisfied to find that you’ll get what you deserve.”

Flamer-2’s eyes focused predatorily on Wolf, and Blaze feared that the human had just signed his own death warrant. Flamer-2 didn't speak, but turned away from the bloody ruin of Flamer-6's body and took large steps towards the miniscule human. His jaws hung open and he salivated generously from them. An almost dead, detached film had infiltrated the big dragon's eyes.

Wolf backed away, while frantically slamming his finger on the shocking amulet. Flamer-2 grimaced somewhat, yet the animal seemed beyond pain, beyond fear. Flamer-6 had stripped away the last threads of Flamer-2's fragile sanity. Panic overtook Wolf when he saw that the collar was having little effect. With Flamer-2 looking angrier and more demented than ever, he then desperately tried to scamper back toward the door. Yet it was in vain, as Flamer-2 surged forward on longer legs and scooped Wolf up with his claw.

Flamer-2 breathed heavily as he spoke, as if words came with effort now “I've almost forgotten... the taste of human...”

“N-no, you don’t want to eat me… I taste terrible. Oh God…please not like that!!”

Flamer-2 dangled Wolf over his mouth like the morsel that he was and then deliberately bit off the human from the pelvis down. The man screamed horribly as his bowels began to fall from the upper half of him, bloodying Flamer-2's nose as he chewed twice then swallowed. With another snap of his jaws, he finished what he started.


By now, Flamer-8 had let go of Blaze as both dragons looked with horror at what Flamer-2 had become. Let it be said, that while none of the drakes would have shed a tear if Wolf had met an untimely demise, he hadn't deserved this. A moment passed and then red flashing Elvish runes appeared overhead on the ceiling. Blaze read the symbols for "Danger" as well as a call for arms.

Blaze braced himself for battle as Flamer-2 turned his gore stained face to look at him. The dragon's eyes were buggy with delierium and an absolute loss of a sense of self. He looked directly at Blaze and then said. "I'm going to have her..." he breathed. Then he repeated, much louder, flaring his great wings. "That whore is mine!"

Flamer-8 looked on in confusion, but Blaze knew exactly what Flamer-2 was talking about and his heart fell down into a dark pit. Before anything else could be said, Flamer-2 turned and dashed down into the overhang in the center of the room, towards the big iron doors. He reached his claw through the little door Wolf had entered and then pulled the bolt securing the larger set. Roaring without care, the hulking dragon burst through the portal and dashed down the hall. The breath rattled in Blaze's throat and his legs felt like jelly. He knew exactly where Flamer-2 was going.
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.title: The dragon with no name

1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.content:
Watching Flamer-2 exit through those big doors and go crashing down the hall made Blaze's neck heart skip several beats. "We have to stop him!" he cried, moving towards the portal.

"So go stop him then." remarked Flamer-8.

Blaze paused to look at him over his shoulder. The older drake was alternating between looking at his claws and staring listlessly off into the distance. Blaze shuffled his wings agitatedly. "You heard what he said, he's going right for the drakka!" he tried again.

"I figured as much."

Blaze gaped, aghast. "Don't you care?" he asked but inside, Blaze was already suspecting Flamer-8’s true motivations.

"I do care," said Flamer-8 rising to his feet and taking a few languid steps forward. "But the thing you need to understand is that Flamer-2 has already signed his death warrant. He broke out of here and even ate the dragon handler. The Kleaves are going to put him down ruthlessly."

Blaze danced on his paws, so eager was he to end this conversation and take off after the rogue dragon. "But not before he gets to the harem!" shouted Blaze. "We're almost next door to it now! He'll... He'll... before they get him..." He couldn't bring himself to say it, but the images forming in his mind were like a burning toxin. He imagined Flamer-2 with dear Honeysweet being crushed under his bulk. The big dragon huffing and grunting, the drakka crying and moaning under him. It made Blaze want to tear at his own skull!

"Of course I know what that brute is going to do."

"Then why won't you help me?!" Blaze shouted at his older lairmate. Spittle flew from his jowls; he was so incensed. Flamer-8's indifference at this moment made him seem almost as horrible as Flamer-2.

“Because its not worth getting yourself killed over some whore…” he snapped.

“WHAT!!” snarled Blaze, nearly launching himself at Flamer-8 right then and there. "She's not a whore!!"

Then, Flamer-8 seemed to understand, as he let out a huff, “She’s a whore like the rest of them. I know I sound like an asshole, but you get yourself attached to people too easily. Its not worth making friends here...”

He said it calmly and with nary a trace of emotion, save perhaps a twinge at the corners of his eyes. Blaze looked at him levelly, though uncomprehending. "So…that means…" he uttered, jaws agape.

Flamer-8 sighed raggedly. "Do I have to spell it out?" He shook his head. "You and I are still competing here. Now that Flamer-6 is dead and Flamer-2 is as good as dead, you’re the last obstacle to my becoming the breeder male for the fire-drakes." Blaze's eyes traveled unwillingly to the broken body of Flamer-6 where it lay almost forgotten against the wall, blood still spreading across the broken tiles. Flamer-8 continued. "To be honest, I would like to win fairly against you, to show myself as the superior dragon through my merit alone. You're honorable enough to deserve that, yet since I don’t think I will be able to convince you to stay, I might as well be the last dragon standing."

Blaze ground his teeth together. How could this be happening? He and Flamer-8 had almost seemed close - certainly closer than he and Flamer-6 had ever been - but then, all those times they had been united against the prodigious physical might of Flamer-2. Now that Flamer-2 was done for in the long term, it seemed Flamer-8 didn't need him anymore... It made logical sense, but it hurt emotionally nevertheless and Blaze found himself having to hold back tears at the betrayal he had known must happen eventually. "You're a heartless bastard, Flamer-8, may the Ancestors curse you to the powers below," said Blaze, but without much feeling.

Flamer-8 sniffed and rubbed his snout with a paw. "Don’t take it personally Flamer-7, I'm just trying to win. So if you want to go save your ‘girlfriend’ like you’re some fucking New Alveri Holy Knight, then go ahead and get yourself killed."

Something then struck within Blaze. He flashed back to how scared he’d been during the attack in New Alveri, how he’d fled like a coward when he should have helped. All this time, perhaps he still saw himself as the idealistic young drake who believed there was a clear line between right and wrong.

“You think this is even about winning or losing anymore?” snarled Blaze. “The life of somebody I care about is at stake and I’m going to do everything I can to protect her. If that means I end up getting castrated or killed as a result, whether by Flamer-2 or the Kleaves, so be it. But I’d never get over it if I let her get hurt when there was a chance that I could have done something to stop him.”

He then took a breath. It wasn’t necessarily Flamer-8’s fault. Even now, he wasn’t a bad dragon; he was just doing all he could to survive.

“Promise me one thing though. If the worst happens to me, and you become breeder male, then I’m counting on you to take care of Honeysweet and the others, and that you all will try to get out one day…” finished Blaze.

Blaze turned without another word, as Flamer-8 stood there frozen, conflicted, watching him stride away. At the open iron doorway, he heaved a great sigh. In the hallway, as in the main chamber, red flashed from previously invisible runes on the ceiling. "Danger-Danger-Danger" They flashed in Elvish. There were shouts and the sounds of armored feet approaching, though given the way sound echoes underground they may have been around the corner or clear across the complex. Stealing a glance back at the reluctant drake, Blaze dashed down the empty hallway, following Flamer-2's pungent odor.

Even if his sense of smell had been completely blocked, or he had not known the way to the harem there would be no mistaking the path Flamer-2 had taken. All he had to do was to follow the trail of blood. Blaze passed by several mutilated corpses along the way, mostly dwarf and human. Armed with only poles, clubs and other weaponry designed to torment rather than to fight, they hardly had a chance against the huge, insane fire drake. Flamer-2 had not paused to eat the unfortunate guards, but ratherÂ toreÂ into them as he passed. At a T-intersection, Blaze passed the remains of a small column of warriors. He could tell they’d been armed because they had armor on, but beyond that, he couldn't say. They were reduced to ash from a blast of fire which had filled the side tunnel. A few steps further, Blaze encountered a similar scenario and was slightly heartened that Flamer-2 was being forced to use up his flame, and which hopefully meant it had delayed him somewhat in his dash to the harem.

However after that, there were only a few corpses. The Kleaves, it seemed were done throwing small contingents of prison guards at the rogue dragon, and had decided to wait until they could marshal a sizable squad their elite warriors and likely other dragons besides. When they came for Flamer-2 next, it would be with overwhelming force. Blaze forced his claws on faster with a growing sense of dread despite the lack of bodies.

Blaze took a passage off the main avenue he knew led to the harem. He did not even pause to glance at the slaughtered humans who lay in bloody pieces outside the forced open iron doors. Beyond, Blaze heard sounds, which stopped his hearts cold. A high keening which turned his blood to ice, but also filled his shoulders and back with a sudden flush of strength and tension. Flamer-2 was groaning with feral anticipation, already preparing to make the most of his last few minutes of life, and indeed the keen of fear and dismay belonged to Honeysweet's! He prayed to the Ancestors he was not too late…

Blind rage took over then as Blaze rushed through the doors, heedless of his own safety, nor the prospect of facing a bigger, more powerful drake in single combat. Flamer-2 would die by his claw.
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.title: For the Sake of Winning

1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.content:
The inside of the harem was filled with movement and the flapping and rustling of great leathery wings. The drakka obviously knew something was wrong and yet fear or habit kept them trapped inside this room despite the fact that the doors were pried wide open. Nevertheless, Blaze had to give them some credit. They were avoiding the hulking mass of Flamer-2 like the plague. If they had been truly broken, they might have simply thrown themselves down before the huge male.

The room was already subdivided, though. At one end, the four drakka cowered, there wings spread and ready for flight. They had space between them and were ready to scatter, however, Flamer-2 was occupied at the other end of the room. He had cornered one of the drakka... Honeysweet. He had knocked her down onto her side; dragons could only copulate belly to belly. The mad-eyed drake was even now trying to get her to roll over, heedless of her wings pinned against the ground. Never-mind that sex on the ground was a mockery of how it was supposed to be done, the sight of Flamer-2 with his oversized claws on Honeysweet was enough to send Blaze into a heedless rage.

Flamer-2, occupied as he was, never knew what hit him. Blaze took to the air and drove himself forward with all the strength in his wings. He slammed into Flamer-2's side like a battering ram and even the big dragon's bulk could not stop him from flying off his feet and tumbling over the course, unworked stone at the sides of the harem; almost identical to the one in which he and the other drakes were housed.

Blaze held onto Flamer-2, roaring at the top of his breath, and they rolled once then twice. Flamer-2 yelled as one of his wings got pinned under him; it was a pity that Blaze heard nothing break. The heavier drake wound up on the bottom and Blaze scrambled forward over his belly, clawing at the drake along the way. He tried to estimate where Flamer-2's neck heart was. If he could get his jaws around it and end this quickly, he might have a chance...

But Blaze hesitated too long. Flamer-2 reached up with his hindclaw and laid them against Blaze's abdomen. With a mighty kick, he sent the lighter drake into the air. Blaze managed to catch himself with his wings. He dove right back at Flamer-2 as soon as he'd corrected his flight, but by then, the big male had already righted himself. He set his claws in the stone and braced for another impact. Blaze let out a roaring war-cry as he fell on Flamer-2 again.

However, this time the results were not so satisfactory. Flamer-2 swung up with his tail and caught Blaze right in the belly, sending the lighter drake sprawling to the ground with a mighty crash. A vibrating pain coursed through his body, his breath coming short and wheezy. Yet Blaze bit back the pain through his teeth and pushed himself back to his feet.

Just then, the huge frame of Flamer-2 suddenly came into his vision. Letting out a yelp, Blaze tucked his wings against his back and frantically rolled to the side, barely avoiding what would have been a crippling blow. Blaze had barely managed to recover when Flamer-2 swung completely around and slashed at him. Blaze managed to get his own claw up in time to stop it from cutting open his neck, yet the force and momentum from the blow knocked him backwards again.

Finally, Blaze leapt clear of Flamer-2’s range.

Flamer-2 was already charging forward like the berserk animal he was. Blaze hopped out of the way, onto one of the small ledges to his left, yet Flamer-2 was able to quickly change direction and re-routed himself toward Blaze. Frantic, Blaze looked for anything that would stop Flamer-2’s momentum. He scooped up a loose stalagmite unhinged from one of Flamer-2’s earlier charges and hurled it at Flamer-2. The awkwardly spinning object flew end over end and somehow managing to catch Flamer-2 through the wing membrane. The big drake howled, momentarily staggering in shock from the blow.

Hoping to take advantage, Blaze surged forward. He knocked the bigger dragon back a few steps, then connected with another blow right underneath the chin. Now, he was set up for the knockout blow.

“Go to hell Flamer-2!!” screamed Blaze. He did a 360 turn in a mighty circle, gathering all his momentum and swung his tail as hard as he could right at Flamer-2’s neck. Yet instead of the sound of his tailbone connecting against scale, Blaze instead met Flamer-2’s swinging foreclaw directly in the face.

Blaze vaguely remembered hearing a sickening yet all too audible clunk, similar to the sound of a solid block of concrete dropped into a field of mud. For a moment, Blaze forgot who he was and why he was here, consumed by the ringing pain in his head. He swayed on his feet drunkedly, Flamer-2’s visage blurring in and out.

Get up you idiot… get up!! Blaze thought desperately to himself. Flamer-2, rage and hate in his eyes, stomped forward to grapple him. Blaze shakingly slapped at him with an aimless claw, yet he found himself knocked off his feet back first on the ground.

“You…” snarled Flamer-2, his jaw open, “I’m gonna ravage you. I’m gonna kill you and eat you!! Because all pricks like you gotta die!!”

“I-is that all you have to say animal?” panted Blaze.

Flamer-2 lowered his face in close, and his eyes bulged nearly out of his sockets. Those eyes, they were now deeper than a mere animal rage, but it was a hate that ate at ones spirit, a hate that warped the mind. “You…I hate you so much. From the moment I saw you, you’ve been conspiring against me. You kept cripple alive so he could laugh at me, oldie so they could go 3 on one. Yes, just like that prick used to do; always smiling, always so smart, getting away with stuff, crying so momma loved him more,” he rambled. “Everything… it was all that pricks fault. So I tell him how much I truly hate him, how he doesn’t deserve to live. Then, the prick cries like he always does, and tells me that he loves me, so I tell him to go jump off a cliff. He does and I watch him splatter below. Then, they all blame me; and cast me out, but I’m glad that fuckers dead; dead like he deserves. And you…every time I look at you I see that prick, laughing at me. Well, who’s the one laughing now prick!? I’ll kill you again!!”

Blaze could only stare frozen as Flamer-2 tilted his jaw and aimed for his neck. Yet right at that moment, Flamer-2 let out a roar of pain. Honeysweet had snuck up from behind and managed to bite him right on the tail, hanging on for dear life.

“You fucking bitch!!” snarled Flamer-2, shaking her off with a violent swing, yet not before managing to bite off a sizable chunk of flesh. Blearily, Blaze staggered back to his feet. His left eye was closing rapidly, but it frankly could have been much worse. Yet to Blaze’s alarm and dismay, Flamer-2 had switched his attention toward Honeysweet, aiming his horns at her flank.

“No!!!” yelled Blaze. He charged forward blindly at Flamer-2. Yet he wouldn’t be able to make it in time.
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.title: No quarter

choices: Try to get the Kleaves to help
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.content:
Flamer-2, bleeding heavily from where the flesh on his tail was torn away ran after the drakka where she lay after he'd tossed her. Honeysweet was getting to her feet when the big dragon connected. She let out a shriek as his sheer mass bowled her over completely. The big drake got his teeth around her throat in a flash, but before he could end her, Blaze was there, leaping onto Flamer-2's back.

The big dragon's wings flared, but Blaze was already on his back, he bite his large wing muscles brutally and clawed at the many hard nodules lining Flamer-2's spine. Flamer-2 roared out in pain and backhanded Honeysweet who was still under him and struggling as well. The drakka went limp, then the big dragon bucked like a horse and twisted his head like a snake.

Even dragon scale would not defy Blaze. Before he was forced away by Flamer-2's snapping jaws, he tore off a large piece of the larger drake’s thick flight muscle. He roared with pain and rage, yet as Blaze jumped off his back, though, Flamer-2 decked him with his tail, sending him once more to the floor.
