Blaze landed on his belly, but although his body was aching from the fight, forced himself up with a bounce, he was still far too close to Flamer-2. The larger drake then swept his tail at Blaze’s feet, yet Blaze leapt up into the air to dodge it, and before he could swing his tail around and follow through with another swipe, Blaze frantically flapped his wings as hard as he could and floated away from his rival. Coasting on the air, Blaze swept away, trying to gain a new perspective on the fight, hoping that he’d be able to use his height advantage to find an opening. Flamer-2 tried to jump up and swipe at Blaze a few times, yet Blaze managed to nip at him before flapping away. Every time that Flamer-2 tried to follow him in the air, he’d slap down at Flamer-2, keeping him trapped on the ground. Hopefully, he’d be able to keep this up long enough to wear down the larger drake. Frustrated that he couldn’t follow, Flamer-2 then committed the most unbreakable of taboos.

Although he had seen Flamer-2 about to break the taboo before, the hellish gout of flame nonetheless caught him by surprise. Blaze desperately tried to bank away, yet in the tight chamber, there was little room to maneuver, and thus he still found himself singed by the outer margins. Somewhere, he heard a drakka shriek in dismay. Yet Blaze’s more dire concern was the throbbing pain on his left wing, which had taken the brunt of the fire. The wing twitched with agony as Blaze held it from his body, the leather was charred on the outside, burned all the way through in places. And the holes widened as he remained in the air.

With the wing unable to take his weight, Blaze tumbled to the ground, using one wing to break his fall. He let out a cry as he fell. Though it pained him to move it, he folded his injured wing to his side, the better to protect it. Flamer-2 strutted towards him. Blaze growled, defiantly.

"There’s nowhere to run!! I'm going to eat your dick first." said Flamer-2 as he approached. "And then your hearts and then shit on your corpse. Then once I’m breeder male, I’m gonna sire an army of slaves and then take over the fucking world!! All will bow down to me!!"

"Shut the fuck up!" shouted Blaze, but his voice lacked spirit. He was really hurting...

He raised his tail and stumbled a bit, realizing that his left foreleg was pretty badly burned as well. The scales there were dry and curled away from the skin at the edges; fire-drakes had a natural resistance to fire, but even they were not completely fire-proof. Sensing weakness, Flamer-2 charged forward again, yet Blaze, biting back the pain, managed to swing with his claw and catch the side of his head. Yet to Blaze’s dismay, the brute paid it no heed. He tackled Blaze and he went down. He struggled a bit, but Flamer-2 put down his claw on his neck. Blaze couldn't breathe! There was no sound besides the big drake roaring in hateful triumph and drakka crying in the background. Flamer-2 reared up, claws flashing in the torchlight. His jaws were open wide and dripped a foamy mixture of blood and saliva, ready to deliver on his promise. All Blaze could do was wait for the end.

Just then a new cry broke the relative quiet. A shape came flying out of the doorway just as Flamer-2 was falling upon Blaze. It was Flamer-8! The two dragons collided chest to chest and Flamer-2 was knocked back. Without the mad drake's oppressive bulk on him, Blaze slowly staggered back to his feer.

However, Flamer-8 had ended up in an extremely vulnerable position in his all out leap to save Blaze. Before Blaze could do anything, Flamer-2 quickly whirled around and gripped Flamer-8 firmly around the neck, tearing through the scales and arteries in the process, and threw him to the ground. Then Flamer-2 reared back and slashed him across the neck, and an obscene amount of blood filled the chamber, and Flamer-8 gurgled, clutching at his throat. "Shit!" thought Blaze. "He must have got him around the neck heart." While the neck heart was more a muscular valve than a true heart, injury to it could result in unconsciousness, paralysis, coma or outright death. Flamer-8 wasn't going to be able to fight again for weeks at the very least, most probably ending up castrated, and perhaps even dead. It dismayed Blaze that Flamer-2 had managed to defeat Flamer-8 so easily.

The hulking dragon stepped over the limp body of Flamer-8. His shoulder was streaming blood from where Blaze had bitten him as was his tail. From the look on his face, Flamer-2 was delirious, but no less deadly. "Ha!! That’s what you get with messing with the King!!” snarled Flamer-2. “Got anymore... Fuck buddies? Eh?" He breathed. He stumbled a bit over his own claws, yet his vile arrogance had returned, and Blaze was still in worse shape than he. The young drake backed away.

It was then, in his peripheral vision that Blaze saw the watchers. There were a number of Elves, mages and warriors alike, standing in the doorway, with two hulking bronzes behind them. Blaze's mouth dropped.

"How long have they been there?!" his mind shrieked. But they made no move to either assist or hinder. The Kleaves were waiting for this drama to play itself out. He then realized that this entire life and death struggle had possibly been staged from the start, and Blaze’s rage at having been used by the elves in this manner made his fire bladder pulse like never before. It felt hot and overfilled, in fact.
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.title: Redemption

1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.content:
In that moment, looking back at Flamer-2, Blaze realized that he really had to use everything he had to win, even if it meant violating one of the deepest ingrained restrictions that he'd lived with since the time he'd hatched. To a human, the feeling might have been similar flinging off one's clothes in public or punching someone in a fine restaurant, or mutilating a young child and feeding on their flesh; but really it was all of those combined into a vile sense of wrongness.

When Blaze felt his neck swell with the liquids being squeezed from the sacks in his chest, he felt a new surge of rampant emotion. Pain, there was in abundance, but there was much more than pain. Flamer-2 needed to pay for making not just his and everyone else's lives miserable. He needed to pay for Flamer-6's life and possibly Flamer-8's now as well. He needed to pay for his macho assertion of dominance over the frightened drakka, he needed to pay for touching Honeysweet! But even more than vengeance, Blaze knew that Flamer-2 had to be put down now or many lives would suffer, not just these drakka and not just the eggs he would sire into slavery. Flamer-2 was a slave to his instincts now; the perfect servant for the Kleaves. Now that the competition was reduced to just he and Flamer-2, would the elves really put down their last fire-drake? The very thought was intolerable. Blaze had to give everything he had to prevent that future. He had to make the Kleaves realize just who they were dealing with, and that they would pause before trying to use him like a tool. If that meant that the Ancestors would forever curse his spirit, so be it! So be it!!

When Blaze opened his mouth, a raging fire burst forth as he'd never seen before. The flames were dark, beyond the ultraviolet. The tongues licked forth, heavy and thick like snakes and the flame followed behind like water, or rather a tidal wave. The flames raged out of control and seemed to grow a life of their own the moment they left his mouth, scalding his tongue and making Blaze's eyes water. Flamer-2, now truly fearing for his life, tried to make a run for it, but a moment later was completely engulfed behind the expanding torrent of black flames. There was yelling, like Blaze had never heard before, but didn't pity him in the slightest. In fact, he deserved to suffer even more.

Eyes quite literally glowing red, Blaze directed the terrible black flames toward the ground, because he just couldn't stop it. However, even there the stone shortly began not only to flow, but actually melt into the ground. It was a devouring flame, a terrible, magic inferno and Blaze spent himself utterly, emptying even his prodigious fire-sacs. Blaze collapsed to his knees, struggling to remain conscious. Sometime during that last little while, Flamer-2 had stopped screaming and struggling, but Blaze couldn't concern himself with the drake. He emptied his dinner into the hot magma pit he had just created and then fell over onto his side, gasping.

That was when he saw Flamer-2, or what was left of him. The huge dragon’s remains lay not far away, still wreathed in black flames, eating at it like acid. Although at this point there was little left to gnaw on other than his blackened skeleton and the stone on which he rested. The stone under Blaze cracked and the young drake looked in alarm to see the dimly glowing pit he'd made slowly growing, gaining a life of its own. In its center, there were two spots of bright light, like hideous eyes.

Someone shouted from the doorway. "Dear Gods! He's created a fire elemental!"

There was a commotion, but Blaze could hardly pay attention. The ground cracked again where he lay and the tiles shifted, angling towards the glowing pit. Blaze looked at the eyes in the center. They were filled with wrath and they filled Blaze with fear, but also a sense of terrible familiarity. They were his eyes, distorted by heat and anger, yes, but his eyes nevertheless. Blaze watched as Flamer-2's skeleton fell in and quickly evaporated in an ugly fume of black smoke. Somehow, the sight of it instantly drained all the anger and rage he’d felt, replaced by emptiness and despair. Blaze slid a little towards a death of his own fabrication, he supposed it was right and proper to be destroyed by something he created, especially when this something was so terrible.

But then there were claws around him, firm, yet gentle, and a sweet scent in the air. "Honeysweet?" Blaze asked blearily.

She only grinned down at him and dragged him further away from the magma pit. “Please, I need you…Flame. Let go of your anger, let go of your hate…” she whispered. Her melodic voice was like the song of a siren, easing him away from the abyss. Blaze gave a few shuddering breaths, returning to himself. The fire elemental began to waver, the ground underneath cooling back into rock, the fire being silently re-absorbed into Blaze.

His vision flashed as Blaze staggered, desperately trying to catch his breath. Slowly, heavily, Blaze lifted his head. Honeysweet was at his side, now equally covered in blood and gore as he was. Off to the side, the other drakka pressed themselves against the wall, sidling away from the growing puddle of blood, and from Blaze as well. Oh Ancestors, there was so much blood. Then, he switched his gaze toward the source of the blood.

There lying on the ground was Flamer-8. He was not in good shape to say the least. His neck had been flayed open, and was pouring out an obscene amount of blood. Nonetheless, Blaze staggered to the striken dragons side.

"Looks like...you’re back to normal eh wonderboy?" gasped Flamer-8 with wry grin.

Blaze coughed out a hollow laugh at the label, before shifting his gaze back toward the wound.

"Oh Ancestors…” sighed Blaze with dismay.

“Guess…guess this is it for me isn’t it? Y-you’re the winner now… You’d…you’d be Lord Flame now, not Flamer-7 anymore,” he commented almost off-handedly.

"Don’t say things like that!! Y-you're going to be all right Flamer-8..." stammered Blaze, "You're not going to die...you're...you're..."

Flamer-8 gave him a regretful look, and Blaze realized that there was nothing that could possibly be done to save him.

“Why 8? Why did you do it? You didn’t have to save me. I never asked for you to die on my account. So why?" he cried quietly.

The older drake hacked out a clod of blood. He laboriously shifted his weary gaze, first toward Blaze, and then toward Honeysweet, and grinned contentedly.

"Because...it was… the right thing to do..." he whispered. With that, Flamer-8 drew his last breath, and quietly died. Blaze shook his head and gently closed Flamer-8s eyes.

Blaze silently formed a prayer with his claw, “May the Ancestors protect your spirit Flamer-8, my friend. May they…may they protect us all…”

It was only then, that Blaze realized that he had never learned Flamer-8’s real name, and likely never would. Now, all the others were dead, and he was the only one left. He supposed that he should be glad that he’d get to be the breeder male now, but there was only regret. Regret because, had he been able to meet these same dragons, in another place, Flamer-6 and Flamer-8 might have been friends, just like he had been with the other dragons back in the orphanage and Flamer-2 merely a rival instead of a beast that had to be killed. Yet regardless of what he thought of the others, the fact was, their suffering was over, while Blaze had to continue to endure at the wretched hands of the Kleves.. He wished that he could simply curl up and cry to his hearts content, yet found that he could not.

The Kleaves and their bronze drake auxiliaries were still standing there, watching with both a sense of fear and awe, yet ready to strike should Blaze get any belligerent ideas. Warily, Blaze gazed at them. He’d given everything he had in defeating Flamer-2, and frankly, he had nothing left to give, physically or emotionally or spiritually.

“Flame!!” shrieked Honeysweet, holding him up with concern. Blaze felt her stagger under his weight, panting, his vision growing dizzier and dizzier. He felt dreadfully weak.

Right then, he spotted Fang step forward from the crowd of Kleaves, and Blaze watched him approach almost sleepily. Their eyes met, and Blaze felt as if he were being drawn in. For a moment, he thought he felt Fang speak to him through his eyes, promising to save him from himself, to help harness that power he’d unleashed, yet he couldn’t be sure; it might have been a dream. A moment later, Blaze slumped to the ground, spent.
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.title: End in Fire

choices: I'll bring her in right now (Mature content advisory)
1112111211211111111211111111211111112121.content:
Blaze awoke with a start. He blinked a couple of times. He did not find himself surprised to see Fang seated on a stool right in front of the bed of leaves and hay that Blaze was laid upon.

“Ah…so it would seem you are awake, Flamer-7, or should I say…Lord Flame…” he said with a grin.

“I’m in the medical ward aren’t I?” said Blaze hazily.

“That’s right… In fact you’ve got a whole chamber for your exclusive use,” answered Fang.

“I’ve…still got my balls right?” he continued.

Fang tilted his gaze sideways. “Obviously.” Blaze ground his groin against the floor, relieved to find that everything was indeed where it was supposed to be. “You’ve certainly got the devils luck. The rest of you seems to have recovered quite adequately as well. You’re all set to undergo all physical activities again.”

He stood up and flexed his wing, the one that had been partially caught by Flamer-2’s flame. It still felt raw, but it was well on its way to a full recovery. Frankly, the only body part he would have even thought about trading for his balls was his wings, for a dragon who could not fly was not truly a dragon anymore. He also had gained a small collection of scars from the fight with Flamer-2, including two furrow marks right underneath his left eyes, but those were the type that drakes and New Alveri would pay many gems for, rather than disfiguring. He supposed that he should feel lucky that he’d come off as likely as he did; one wrong move and he could have easily ended up like Flamer-8.

“Did the doctor do anything to me while I was asleep?” asked Blaze, worriedly.

“Oh, he dropped by every now and again to monitor my treatment of you, but you’d be feeling quite a bit worse and probably be lacking your balls at this moment if he had right?” answered Fang.

“Good point…” replied Blaze.

“Unfortunately, he won’t be accompanying us when we travel to our new facility…”

“Oh…that’s too bad…” answered Blaze, not bothering to hide the irony in his voice, “That also we’ll be moving to another island like they did with the other breeder males right?” answered Blaze.

“Indeed,” answered Fang, “Its one of the more volcanically active ones, if I’m not mistaken… Its not as big as the one we’re at nor does it have the same facilities, but you’ll certainly have more room to move around for yourself, and the quarters you and the drakka will be staying in far more accommodating.”

Blaze huffed, “They way you say it, one would think we were headed for a vacation on a tropical paradise rather than the next step in the Kleaves mad quest for world domination…”

As always, Fang took the almost defiant statement in stride, “Come now, surely we’re not all just insane caricature’s are we? Besides, there are surely worse arrangements then I’ve described, as you probably know all too well…”

He decided to let the matter rest, “Don’t need to remind me. Now that Wolf is dead, I’m assuming you’re going to be my handler from now on?”

“That is correct. I might not look like it, but I’m a very competent fire adept, and needless to say I’ve become very intrigued with the level of elemental energy that you’ve displayed, particularly in your fight against Flamer-2. With my help, I’d like to understand more about the ability you possess, and we’ll both learn how to control and harness that power at will.”

Left unsaid, of course, was the likely fact that Fang would most probably want to use that ability in taking over New Alveri. However, since Fang had personally seen it to become Blaze’s handler, he was even more constrained in his ability to attempt escape than he’d been under Wolf. Fang, seemed to fully understand Blaze’s psychology and his thought patterns, plus he was far more competent and cunning than Wolf had been. While Wolf had been boastful and blunt with his discipline, Fang was very unassuming, and it was difficult to fathom exactly what he could be thinking. Thus, if Blaze truly had began to contemplate a serious escape attempt, Fang would definitely be the first to learn of it. However, Blaze didn’t really feel the desire to harm Fang, because the truth was, he had been the only Kleave to actually treat him like a dragon rather than an animal, which counted for a great deal. He also liked to think that Fang was staking a lot of his position within the Kleaves on Blaze and whatever abilities he might have, so there was the potential of using that fact as leverage.

“So…when exactly are we leaving?” asked Blaze.

“Tomorrow morning,” answered Fang, “Most of the supplies and cargo are already packed. It was mostly waiting for you to come to…”

“Really? Well, um, before that happens, would it be all right if I could see Honeysweet before we leave?” asked Blaze.

“You’ll certainly have plenty of time to spend with not only her but also all the other drakka when you get to the island, but she’s been really worried about you since your fight. We nearly had to shock her once to keep her away from you so you could get treatment” said Fang, wryly.

Blaze’s eyes narrowed, “You didn’t do anything to her right?”

“Aside from making her desperate with worry, she’s perfectly fine. Truthfully, I’d never thought I’d ever see an instance where a breeder male managed to gain the genuine affection of one of the harem females, and vice versa. In fact, if you’d like, I can have her called in for you right now,” said Fang.

“Would…would that be all right?” asked Blaze, his body perking up all too evidently.
