1141211111111111221211111112111111111112.content:
"Thanks for helping me out Lady Scabia..." I said to her after my scrape with Fangorn.

She humphed, "Better that I would not have had to get you out of that at all. You should know better than to get drawn into pointless banter with that wretch..."

"Sorry Lady Scabia..."

She let out a sigh and shook her head in exasperation. "Still, it must be nice, to be so young and beautiful..." I heard Lady Scabia muse under her breath.

"Hmmm?" I uttered, a bit confused.

"Never mind that," she growled curtly, "Lets get the healers to tend to your wound. Furthermore, you still need to get your physical done, so as long as you're here, you may just as well get that taken care of as well. The sooner you can get it done, the better"

“Oh... right..." I answered, shifting nervously. I had forgotten about the physical exam during my mission. Furthermore, I had also been wondering why Lady Scabia had led me though a long corridor that had seemed out of the way from the rest of the medical ward, and had passed by several other perfectly good rooms. It seemed that she wanted me to be somewhere that I wouldn't be overheard or peeked at.

"Now then, I'll be waiting for you back at the lobby. Be sure to do everything that the healers tell you to do all right?" said Scabia. I walked into the room.

A human nurse clad in robes was present. She introduced herself as Callia, and after informing her why I was here and giving her my ID number, she set to work.

"Anyhow lets take a look... Would you lay down on your belly please?" she asked.

I did so, and allowed the healer to gaze over it. She worked quickly and efficiently, cleaning up the blood and grime from the wound and then rubbing a strange liquid upon it. The alkaline smelling liquid stung a little, and I could hear the slight sound of bubbling, before it went numb.

"Was there poison in the wound?" I asked.

"No, just a bit of rust and grime. The rubbing alcohol managed to neutralize it. Don't mind me asking, but where did you get the idea your wound had poison?"

I told her about Lorath and how he'd sent me straight to the Medical ward.

"Really? I heard that a lot of dragonesses like him, but I'd never heard of him actually going out of his way to see to the well being of one dragoness in particular," she commented.

I couldn't help but feel heartened. "I'm just happy he seemed geniunely concerned about me," I replied. Unlike a certain stalking, arrogant, pervented bronze drake....

By then, the nurse had just about finished healing the wound. “There we go!! You should be able to return to your normal duties without any issues tomorrow.”

I couldn’t help but grunt with satisfaction. As grueling as today’s mission had been, I was keen on getting back into the fold straight away.

The nurse gazed down at the file again. “I’ve also noticed that you haven’t undergone your physical yet. I'm guessing that's why you're in this room then?”

I clicked my jaw together. “Err...yes...”

"Fortunately, Lady Ornaryz is currently free, so if you’d like I can schedule you to have it taken right now…" she answered. If I didn’t know any better, I could have sworn that I saw her eye twinkle for a moment. I lowered my gaze at the human and frowned.

“Why her in particular?” I asked, more as a means of testing the human.

“Well, you see, Lady Ornaryz specializes in caring for the specific needs of dragoness’…”

My eyes widened, and my mind fluttered with wild imaginations. “I suppose I should just get it over with then…” I sighed.

“Anyhow…I’ll just call her over then…” said the nurse, leaving the room. A few minutes later, a motherly looking Silver Dragoness entered the room. She possessed very soft, refined features, and furthermore, I also noticed that her claws were also neatly trimmed.

“You must be Darzhja. Very pleased to meet you,” she said, with a slight bow of the head.

“Likewise,” I responded, trying to hide my anxiety.

Lady Ornaryz smiled kindly, “I can’t be that scary now can I? Don’t worry, the first part of the exam is pretty straight forward…”

She closed her eyes, and a moment later, her claws became encased by a thin film, so as to not accidentally scratch, and also to ensure cleanliness. She gently placed her claws under my neck, checking for something. They felt rubbery.

“In the meantime, tell me about yourself…”

Thus, while she measured my height, weight, length, wing length, heartbeats and other rather routine tests, I told her a little bit about myself and what I thought of the Knights. She seemed like a very trustworthy, kind and sympathetic dragoness, so I felt comfortable telling her my opinions.

As for the exam itself, while they did check up on us back at the orphanage, oftentimes they were perfunctory and rather rough, by contrast Ornaryz was very precise and thorough. I couldn’t help but be rather amazed at how deftly she could manipulate the various medical instruments with her claws, with nearly the expertise of a humanoid, and combine it with the use of magic so that nothing was left unchecked. All in all, that part of the exam was hardly as bad as I feared.

Next, came the invasive part of the exam, the part that required the skills of one dedicated to the particular needs of dragonesses.

“You’re going to do what!?” I all but shrieked at the healer, my wings unfurling and tail tightly coiled.

Lady Ornaryz kept her calm stare, as if she had fully expected my particular reaction. She calmly explained what was going to happen, and why this part of the exam was important. Oddly, being informed made me feel a bit less on edge, and that I could be assured that she knew what she was doing.

"Y-you're not going to do it here now are you?" I asked.

"No, we have special facilities to perform this exam... if you would follow me..."

I shuddered, but at the same time I couldn't help but be curious as well. She led me to an isolated room, in which she sealed the entrance with a spell. When I saw the contents of the room itself it I couldn’t help but flinch. In the center of the room was a large padded table that was tilted at an angle, and next to the table was a series of rather invasive looking medical instruments. All together, the room resembled something out of Fangorn’s most perverted dungeon fantasies.

"It won't hurt will it?" I muttered.

"Absolutely not," she assured.

"I-I'm still going to be...well... you know..." I stuttered, shifting my gaze away.

"The procedure will not alter the physical structure of your birth canal in any way..." she continued.

"Oh... all right..." I said.

"I know it can be pretty daunting, especially for younger dragonesses like yourself. What I find helps a patient relax during the exam is to concentrate on their breathing. Now then, do you have any other questions before we begin?"

I took a deep breath. “Lets do it…”

The healer positioned me on the examining table, placing me on my belly with my hips angled upwards and spreading my legs apart. My tail was then gently nudged upwards and held in place with a hook. Had Fangorn been present in the room (which by the Great Dragons Above he was not) and witnessed it, his head probably would have exploded, or he’d try to... actually, I probably shouldn’t be thinking of Fangorn right now. Especially not right now…

Thankfully, it didn’t hurt, but it did feel rather…strange, and admittedly even oddly soothing to be prodded and poked in that place. Every so often, Ornaryz would utter an intrigued hum. Briefly, I wondered if she was a bit skewed in her orientation. Maybe she was, maybe she wasn't. Again, something I probably would be better off not thinking too much upon.

Then, out of the corner of my eye, I noticed her roll forward that invasive looking metal rod and I nearly balked.

"Now then, give me a nice, slow exhale..."

I exhaled, willing myself not to flinch. I kept my eyes closed, and tried to think happy thoughts to keep my mind focused off that unsettling cramped sensation in my abdomen. I let out a short, staggered breath as what felt like a brush gently turn in a circle inside me, followed by a tapping noise.

"You're doing great Darzhja, we're almost done..." Ornaryz said encouragingly. There was a bit more poking and prodding, only this time she rubbed my abdomen while doing so.

Finally, the exam was over, and I was gently taken off the table.

“Now then, I still have to test the results, but on the surface everything appears to be normal," said the doctor.

“That’s… great!!” I answered, not really knowing what else I should say.

“It wasn’t that bad now was it?” said Ornaryz with a smile, leading me out of that room and back into the lobby.

“I…suppose it wasn’t,” I answered.

“Anyhow, we’re all done here. You'll be scheduled for your next physical exam either five years from now, or before any mission that requires you to be away from the Temple for an extended period of time," said Ornaryz.

I nodded, and returned to Lady Scabia, who had started to look rather impatient.

"About time. I swear that dragoness enjoys her work a little too much..." she mused. "Anyhow, now that you've got that taken care of..."
1141211111111111221211111112111111111112.title: Uncomfortable positions

1141211111111111221211111112111111111112.content:
"You've got the rest of the day free..." finished Lady Scabia. "You'll be having training tomorrow so be sure to get a good nights sleep. Afterwards, meet me at my lair so we can discuss the results of the mission."

"Very well Lady Scabia..."

With that, I left the hospital ward. It was getting rather late now, so there wasn't that much time to do anything else before going back to the dorms in any case. However, there was still enough time to go get something to eat, so I flew over to the hunting grounds. I picked out a fat, juicy steer and set down to eat it. I wondered if Lina had finished interrogating the mercs.

As if merely thinking about here triggered her appearance, heard the sound of a familiar 'poof'.

"Darzhja!! I’m back!!" squealed Lina, twirling her body in the air before settling next to me.

"Lina!! How did the interrogation go!!" I called out.

"Well, we found out quite a bit about the mercs intensions. However, we’ll talk about it more tomorrow with Lady Scabia. As for now, Darzhja, I want to introduce you to someone special!!" she squeaked excitedly.

A faerie drake instantly poofed into existence next to her; like Lina, he resembled a typical hatchling than a full-grown dragon, and possessed green scales similar to Lina’s, only with a slightly bit darker. In fact, he looked as if he could have been Lina’s sibling, and it wouldn’t have been surprising if they actually were related by blood.

“Ein'theil!!” she squealed.

"Very pleasant to meet you Darzhja!!" he chittered. “So you’re Lina’s new lairmate? Wow you’re big…” he cried. I'm fairly sure he meant it as a compliment, yet if Fangorn had said it, it would have earned him a slap. Thankfully, I wasn't speaking with Fangorn here.

“That’s right. I only got here yesterday so I’m still trying to find my way around here and get to know everyone here. Lina’s really helped me out get my bearings straight.”

“Mmmhmm!! Because that’s what best friends do!!” squeaked Lina. To emphasize this, she poofed on top of me and gave me a winged hug. Though I did think she was going overboard, I nonetheless grinned at her.

To my surprise, I also noticed a halfling riding on Ein’theil’s back. He was so small that I hadn’t even noticed him until now.

“Oh!! I’d also like to introduce my partner Peteringe!! Say hi Peter!!” he cried.

The halfling gazed up at me, seeming a bit intimidated at how much larger I was than him. “Oh…um…hello!!” he said shakily.

“Your partner?” I asked, wanting more specifics. The one I’d had with Elandor seemed to be only a working relationship, yet I sensed that Ein’theil not only had that but also a genuine friendship.

“So, how long have you been working together?”

“A-about six months now. I’ve been training to be a mage, and part of my training is to partner with a dragon whose also specialized in the magical arts.” Said Peter. Truthfully, I didn’t have the highest opinion in humanoid mages, especially the ones that specialized in using dragon parts, but he didn’t seem all that bad.

“Are you also living together?” I asked.

“That’s right!!” said Ein’theil, “Since we’re already partners, studying together, it makes sense that we share the same lair.”

“But once we become full-fledged Knights!! I’ll be the one sharing your lair and making little ones with you!!” squeaked Lina excitedly. I couldn’t help but cringe somewhat at her exclamation, and moreso when Ein’theil answered it wholeheartedly. When seeing those two together, I couldn’t help but be reminded of two hatchlings going to a lair made out of candy than a betrothed pair. I suppose that was normal for Fairie Dragons though, so it probably wasn’t my place to comment.

I hated to break up their little conversation, but I noticed the shadows begin to grow long and the sky glow red, “Its getting rather late now, so we should probably be headed back to the dorms now,” I commented. Since I had missed that first day of training, I likely had a long day ahead of me.

“Oh all right…” said Lina, not wanting to be parted with her betrothed, “See you tomorrow my shiny prince!!”

“Likewise, my sparkling princess…” cried Ein’theil, twirling together and nuzzling, before reluctantly separating. The rather dazed halfling apprentice mage, Peter, also gave a rather timid goodbye. The entire way back, Lina had a dreamy look on her eyes. It must be nice, to have someone that already loved her.

When I arrived with Lina back at the lair, most of the other dragonesses were already headed back to their respective lairs as well. I hadn’t had the chance to speak with any of the other dragonesses for more than a few moments, and I reckoned that I should take the opportunity to get to know the rest of them.

I yawned once I got back to my lair, laying upon my stomach.

“So Darzhja, how did the rest of your day go?” asked Lina, eyes glowing excitedly. Frankly, I didn’t find it particularly exciting; perhaps it was exciting in that my argument with Fangorn had been rather explosive, and also the physical… However, I didn’t want to tempt Lina into using fairy dust on me, so I decided to just tell her.

“I bumped into that wretch Fangorn again at the Medical Ward…”

“Oooooooo!!” she squeaked excitedly, twirling in the air, “What did he say to you?”

I rolled my eyes. “Some rather rude and perverted things. I swear, that jerk is absolutely obsessed with stalking me. Its driving me completely crazy!!” I growled.

“Driving you crazy hmmm? Sends your heart racing now does it?” she teased.

“You have an over-active imagination Lina. Besides, Lorath is a hundred times nicer than Fangorn anyhow!! I wouldn’t mind going out with him,” I added.

“Lorath is very nice, and a lot of dragonesses like him. Yet I bet that you were thinking about Fangorn rather than Lorath when you were having your physical…” she continued, looking ready to burst into excitement.

I froze for a moment, before catching myself. “You have no idea what you’re talking about. Don’t tell me that while that weird nurse was sticking that awful metal thing inside you that you were fantasizing about Ein’theil,” I snorted.

“But I was Darzhja…could you not help but imagine just how big and hard his…”

“LINA!!” I shrieked, baring my teeth. Lina began giggling wildly again. At that point, I knew I probably shouldn’t spur her own, so I decided to calm myself.

“I’ll admit it Lina. As much of an arrogant jerk he is, Fangorn’s hot. In fact, I don’t think I’ve ever seen a drake as good-looking as he is. I’m not expecting him to be Lorath and be smiling and sentimental all the time, or anything like that, but would it kill him for him to be polite once and a while?”

Lina seemed to think about it for a moment. “Yet if Fangorn was kind and polite rather than a stalking, perverted jerk, would you really be thinking about him all that much?” she countered.

“I don’t know...” I said, trying to imagine Fangorn being chivalrous and proper like a normal Knight.

I let out a yawn, as I laid down upon my stomach.. I didn’t want to think about Fangorn right now. Besides, I'd probably bump into him again some time soon anyhow, and then I would deal with whatever snarky thing that comes out of his mouth. It had been quite a long day, and tomorrow would likely be another long day as well.

I heard a poof, and once again Lina reclined on top of my back, preparing to go to sleep.

“Sweet dreams Darzhja…” she whispered.

I snorted out a laugh. Whatever dreams I ended up having, Lina would likely have something to do with them. “You too now Lina…”
1141211111111111221211111112111111111112.title: Fairy mischief

The sergeant makes you fly extra laps
1141211111111111221211111112111111111112.content:
The trumpeting sound of of the morning bugle awoke me from a rather fantastic and more overtly sexual than I was used to. I couldn't help but begrudge the little dragons who was now flitting about the room in her usual excitement the ability to manipulate my dreams… and also her perkiness in the morning. I was still sore from yesterday - Everywhere, it seemed, and I do mean everywhere - and I felt like putting my head back under my wing as soon as the clarion call of the morning tunes began to play.

Lina, however wouldn't have let me even if I had had the option. "Get up sleepy head!" she squeaked landing heavily on my head. I drew the line when she reached down with one of her fine claws and proceeded to lift one of my heavy, scaled outer eyelids.

I rose, shaking my head and growling a bit in my agitation. But with that signature 'poof' Lina was already gone and at the entrance to the lair. She grinned mischievously. "Wanna race again?"

I walked slowly ahead, stretching and gave a big, toothy yawn. I scratched at my shoulder with my hindleg and a couple of coin sized loose scales clinked onto the stone floor. I didn't really look in the mood and Lina's face fell slightly. Then, with a silly twist of my head, I stuck my tongue out at her and charged down the hallway ahead of her.

I didn't really think I had a chance of winning. Lina's ability to fly in the cramped space as well as teleport should have ensured her victory no matter if I cheated with a head start. Still, feeling foolish all the while, I spread my wings slightly to block Lina getting around me. I assumed she would just poof ahead of me and that would be that. However, she didn't. "Hey! Move your wings, Darzja!" squealed the pint-sized dragons. Down the hallways leading to the dorms, past the shower with its flowing trough of water and into the common room, Lina remained behind me, unable to get past my outstretched wings. That was the day that I learned that Lina's short-range teleport ability was also limited to where she could see. It was a useful lesson to be sure, and one that I took advantage of at the times the little dragoness proved to be extra bothersome.

I'd won, but my only prize were glares from the other females as they proceeded in dual lines out to the landing. I struggled to compose myself, but ultimately failed, what with Lina slamming into my haunches, laughing and dropping sparkling dust into the air. "Not fair!" said the faerie dragon as she crawled up my back, her little claws gripping my scales like a hatchling.

I felt comfortable enough to shush her by now as I moved to the rear end of the quickly moving line.

"Having fun with your lairmate, newbie?" said a dragoness whose dark red body was covered with long black spines which had a tendency to rattle as she moved, "We have a sand pit downstairs to play in if you two are interested."

The joke earned a laugh from both her and two other females nearby and though I was larger by half than the venomous dragoness, I did not want to pick a fight with her. I remained silent though I glowered down at her, mantling my wings a little to emphasize my size. The effect was largely ruined when Lina crested my shoulder and lying on it, said, "At least we know how to have fun and are not so stuck up like you, Tsarra!"

The venom quilled female lifted her nose haughtily, though the way her quills lifted betrayed her true mood, "Spoken like a hatchling, Bite-Size."

Tsarra began to walk away with her fellows and I allowed two more females to get ahead of me to put distance between us as we all shuffled forward to the landing. "I hate it when they call me 'Bite-Size'" muttered Lina.

I was stirred to touch her gently with my wing. "Don't worry about it, Lina. You're more of a dragoness than the three of them put together." Lina said nothing, however and sat on my shoulder as we made our way out into the light.

Though not the very last like yesterday, I was stalled in leaving due to my size. Sky-swallowers were really the only breed bigger than the Regal Bronze and as such I was larger by almost a third than most of the others here. They skittered around me and I was too hesitant in proceeding to make a lot of head way in the unorganized flow of apprentice Knights. Whatever respect my size might have afforded me in the group seemed lost by my choosing to associate with Lina.

At any rate, it was not long before I reached the landing. I spread my wings, almost filling the platform while Lina simultaneously poofed out into the air. I dove and quickly overtook the smaller dragon. The sensation of the wind filling my wings made me forget about any social awkwardness in the cave.

Before I landed once more in the dirt of the training yard, Lina and I were separated. It seemed that the smaller dragons were placed in the forward rows with the larger in the back of the dual columns. As I was landing, my eyes immediately settled one a blue, now unarmored, figure in the male column. Lorath had his head turned to someone a little further down his row. I looked and saw Fangorn two dragons down from him. Lorath was saying something, but Fangorn seemed not to hear at all.

I was puzzled and wanted to hear what they were talking about, but my place in the female column was beside two female sky-swallowers and I could not see over their bulk. But anyway, I was soon too busy to care what it was the two males were or were not talking about.

It was the shovel-clawed male with the missing eye who started us off. He landed heavily, I could feel the shock of it through the earth in my toes, and began to walk from right to left - male to female - ahead of the collums. His foreclaws dug into the earth as he moved, "You all are still the sorriest excuses for new recruits that I have seen in my life." The sergeant spoke loudly enough for all to hear. "Limp, unmotivated, lazy, fat," at that he gave a hard look to the silver dragoness in the row ahead of me, "weaklings. None of you are worthy to be called a Holy Knight." He turned on us and there was not an apprentice that didn't flinch. "It's up to you to prove me wrong. Now give me some wing extensions, and don't stop until I say!"

It took a moment for me to get going, having missed the previous day, but I just copied everyone else as they moved their wings first up and then out, up, then out. It was uncomfortable after a while, I wasn't used to moving my wings in that way. I dug my claws into the dirt and continued, though despite the burning. The sergeant traveled up and down the rows, pausing here and there to yell at someone who was doing the exercise incorrectly or tell them to go faster if they were having it too easy. The red veins in my wings grew livid, cooling me as my wing muscles burned. It seemed I'd barely made it through the first exercise before we were called on to stretch our wings forward and then back. Halfway through this exercise, were were told to do push ups with our claws while simultaneously moving our wings.

I had difficulty in doing this, somewhat in the way that a human might have trouble rubbing their stomach while patting their head. I tripped and my chest hit the dirt. I struggled to recover, but with my wings flailing about, I'd caught the attention of the sergeant. He moved down to the last row. "Are you taking a nap, recruit?"

"No, sir!" I said

"Then get out of the dirt and show me some stamina!" shouted the one-eyed dragon. He was smaller than me physically, but I felt as small as Lina under his withering glare. I tried but then felt my forelegs give out again under me. If I just had a couple minutes, I could get the hang of the motion, but I didn't think I'd have that much time.
1141211111111111221211111112111111111112.title: Morning drill

1141211111111111221211111112111111111112.content:
However, instead of the one-eyed sergeant addressing me, a pitch black Deathwing came forward. A miasma of gloom and hate seemed to emanate out from her, and I felt as if every positive feeling and happy thought had been sucked out of me. She seemed to fulfill every negative stereotype I had of Deathwings; hateful, malevolent, masochistic and enjoyed causing suffering. The entire exercise came to a halt, as even the one-eyed sergeant seemed uneasy around this malevolent dragoness.

"Oh? If it isn’t the wench who decided to miss the first day of training,” she said, pacing next to me.

“Madam, I was called away…” I began to insist. Bad idea. Her eyes narrowed, and she swung her hook-shaped tail and slapped me across the flank. I gasped as a piercing pain filled my body. “I do not want to hear whatever pitiful excuse you were prepared to give me. You missed the first day of training, and for that, you shall suffer.”

"Yes...Madam..."

Her eyes narrowed, unsatisfied. I only realized now, that since I had missed the first day, I didn't even know her name.

"That's Lieutanent Shadia to you wench."

"Yes Madam!!" I shouted. She hissed, still unsatisfied. Then, she turned toward the rest of the recruits.

"Because of this slackers incompetence, you will all give me ten laps around the perimeter of the Temple!! Furthermore, there will be no break for the recruits afterwards as I expect you sergeants to get them back to their exercises immediately," she hissed. They all took off, but not before giving me dirty, murderous glares.

"So...how does it feel? Watching the other recruits get punishment because of your incompetence,” she growled, her head next to mine. "Now then... I want you to give me eleven laps. I will be watching you closely, and should you be the last to arrive…" She angled her tail blade and held it over my neck, grinning.

I grit my teeth, desperate to get away from Shadia, and I took off, scared out of my mind. I flew as fast as I could, powered not by a desire to prove myself as a Knight, not to let my other fellow recruits down, or to not shame everyone back at the orphanage who was cheering me on, but by a primal, all-encompassing fear. Yet also I wanted to show that sadistic driller that she wasn't going to push me around like this, and I imagined the look on her face when I would return and she would have no reason to punish me worse than what she already had in store. Thankfully, I wasn’t last, if only because I was able to get ahead of the plump looking silver dragoness.

When I had returned, all but ready to collapse, the the driller gazed at me, looking for any excuse to punish me further. I was determined to give her none.

Meanwhile, the drillers had already begun a new excruciating exercise. The human magicians had conjured a series of suspended beams, and the apprentice knights were ordered to wrap their tail securely around these beams and lift their entire body up and over so that their jaw would touch the tip of the tail without the aid of ones wings. I quickly found that it was an extremely difficult exercise, especially for the larger breeds of dragons like myself that had so much more bulk to lift up. I could only do about four or five before collapsing in exhaustion.

As promised, the Lieutenant took a special interest in tormenting me at every moment of the exercise. She would snap at me for the slightest mistake. She would taunt me ceaselessly, with the most degrading insults imaginable. Yet the most insidious thing she would do is that while I was doing that one last tail up, she would slap at me with that hooked tail of hers, causing me to lose my grip and knock me to the ground, and in such a way not to cause as much pain as possible without it being a disabling injury.

“Tell me recruit. Do you hate me?” she taunted. I couldn’t help but take notice of her eyes, eyes that took exquisite pleasure into causing pain and suffering to helpless victims.

I did hate her, but I was not about to give in to her.

“No Mam…” I growled, biting back the pain.

“Is that so? Then perhaps I have not been going hard enough on you. Rest assured wench, I will make sure that you suffer. I will break you wench. I will watch as the hope fades from your eyes, your resolve shatter, as despair overtake you as you beg for mercy. Then you may truly realize just how utterly worthless and meaningless your existence is.”

I couldn’t help but give a shuddering breath. I had expected the drillers to be means, and indeed the sergeants were mean, yet this dragoness did not seem to have a single shred of decency.

She then grinned maliciously, and said with a would-be sweet voice, “It can all be over right here recruit. No more pain. No more suffering. No more of that depraved, Lieutenant Shadia. You can go back home to your normal life…”

For a moment, I honestly did think about giving up. Yet the fact was, I didn’t have a home to go back to. Nobody had ever said it was going to be easy, and if I could not over come this driller, even one as unusually malevolent as she was, then there was no way I could be a Holy Knight.

“You can’t break me!!” I spat defiantly.

Shadia sniffed disdainfully, “We shall see then…”

The lieutenant then led the recruits to the obstacle course, located within a large, specially made chamber within the Temple walls. This involved climbing upside down along a cliff face that had been doused with oil, followed by slogging through a narrow, claustrophobic passage, followed by navigating through a hazardous labyrinth of razor sharp rocks, more climbing and then leaping across a series of suspended pillars without the aid of ones wings. I wish I could say that I stumbled only a few times, at which I would have to repeat that stage of the course all over again, but thankfully, I wasn't the only one either.

The entire time, the Lieutenant hung over me like a black cloud, slapping and insulting me the whole way. What made it more infuriating is that when she performed the course with me, she did so with the greatest of ease, as if to emphasize just how incompetent I truly was. She didn’t get tired, not even slightly, so much so that I wondered whether she was drawing dark energy from the powers below or something of that nature.

Finally, after the obstacle courses, we finished things off with ten more laps around the temple. Of course, the Lieutenant made me do fifteen laps, with her watching the entire way. At long last, the lieutenant released me from her vile clutches. I was covered head to toe in filth, exhausted, and could barely move.

Amazingly, it was still right around the early afternoon when the exercises were over. There was still time before I had to meet with Lady Scabia again, so I took the time to…
1141211111111111221211111112111111111112.title: The lieutenant from hell

1141211111111111221211111112111111111112.content:
Incredibly sore, I hobbled my way through the air and all but crashed heavily on the landing to the female dorms. Everyone else, even the plump silver had gone in ahead of me having had to finish with only ten laps around the Temple grounds to my fifteen. My wings ached so it took me twice as long to fold them, my legs felt like lead and my back hurt so that I walked in stiffly. I dragged my tail, spirits low, but not broken, not yet. I spoke to no one as I dragged in dirt and dust; thorns and small rocks fell out from my scales as I walked to the showers. I thought only of the cool water as if I could shed all of my miseries as easily as the filth covering my body.

I walked in on a golden dragoness who was utilizing the water trough which flowed through the middle of the room. Modesty was different in dragons than humanoids, after all, we went about the world comfortable in our flesh and never felt the need to cover ourselves. As such she didn't even pause as I moved to the side, looking for a particular symbol on the wall. Perhaps it was because she was a fellow metallic or perhaps it was just because she felt sorry for me, but she brushed a wing against my filth ridden body and said, "Don't give up, you did good out there."

I grinned and nodded and she exited the chamber. That little comment meant more to me than she could possibly know. I touched the symbol carved into the rock of the stone with my foreclaw and immediately water began to cascade from a chute above me. It was diverted from an underground steam, I knew, that serviced the female dorms as well as the kitchens and various other chambers located below us. It was all top notch dwarven work and I recognized the heavy straight lines of their rune-work. Though honestly, I sometimes had to wonder at the wisdom of placing a constantly flowing waste chute so high up above other facilities, even if they were kept separate; hopefully.

I was not thinking too much about dwarven plumbing at the moment, however. As the water began to cascade over me, all I could absorb was the pure bliss of the cold, clean water flowing over me. Though my back was sore, I reared up against the wall and faced the heavy, oncoming stream, enough that a humanoid would be bowled over if it were in the way. I opened my mouth and drank, closing my eyes against the blasting water. I shook my wings and the water soothed my burning muscles and my overheated body. I knew not how long I'd stood under the flow, but eventually, I was interrupted...
1141211111111111221211111112111111111112.title: Welcome Shower

1141211111111111221211111112111111111112.content:
With the water rushing into my face, I perceived nothing amiss until a scaled hand grasped the end of my tail. I whirled immediately, the water continuing to slam into my back, ready to rend and tear. However, the person who had grabbed my tail simply giggled and teasingly let go; I let my jowls fall to cover my long fangs. Before me was a lithe female, her scales a dark shade of violet with a very long face and slanted eyes. She was staring at me with the water pouring down on me with a weird expression; almost hungry.

I was not in a mood to be trifled with if this was some sort of game to her. "Hasn't anyone told you that it is rude to stare?"

"Hasn't anyone told you how good you look dripping wet?" replied the strange dragoness smoothly.

I was thrown off balance by the remark which was not what I'd been expecting at all. The 'compliment' made me feel immediately uncomfortable.

In my moment of hesitation, the other female moved in closer, brushing her shoulder against mine; water splashed down her side. "The Lieutenant really took a liking to you today didn't she?" she said, finishing with a titter.

I breathed in the other female's odor and despite the water dampening the atmosphere, I could smell her unusual musk. It reminded me of how Lina's smell intensified when she talked about Ein'theil. I was uncomfortable with her being so close, yet her mentioning of the vile, black winged devil who'd driven me like a beast of burden all day was enough to set me ranting. "Like? Like?! She nearly drove me into the ground today! I can barely move and I stink like a horse!"

"Worse than a horse actually. Here, let me scrub your back for you." The violet dragon reared up and put her claws on my back as the water continued to rush unabatingly downward. My back sagged a little under her weight and there was a low thrumming in her throat as she slid her claws over my wet scales.

I moved away, out of the stream and shook my wings. I was breathing a little harder than I had been before. "Hey, what's with you? I am perfectly capable of washing myself, thank you." I held my wings protectively about myself.

I seemed to disappoint the violet female with the slanting eyes. She tilted her slightly and muttered under her breath, "…perhaps a bit too forward…"

"What was that?" I asked.

"Oh, nothing sweet heart. Anyway, I was meaning to tell you that getting picked on by Madam Shadia is actually a great honor. She must really see something special in you to drive you so hard."

I snorted a small plume of smoke. I noticed the way the water sparkled as it struck the violet female's scales and the way her wings bent under the weight of the water. "It seemed like she was just trying to get me to quit."

The violet just grinned, turning her snout to the side. "That's how it is with Madam Shadia, her 'favorites' all end up either quitting or advancing to the higher ranks."

I coughed and spat into the water trough which was foaming with rapids from the torrent of the shower flowing into it. "Well I'm not quitting. Not ever."

"Good for you, beautiful." said the dragoness. "By the way, my name's Thereesa."

"Darzhja." I said perfunctorily, still not sure what to make of this strange female.

"See you around." said Thereesa as she turned and began to walk away. I watched her drip onto the slick stone floor and the way her tail swished side to side as she moved. She turned her head before she exited the washroom and winked at me. "Don't hesitate to call on me if you ever need a hand with those hard to reach spots."

I rushed back under the waterfall and let the cold flow drown out my thoughts as I finished my shower.

After I was starting to feel more than a little waterlogged, I headed back up the tunnels to the lair I shared with Lina and found the faerie dragon already in a light doze within. I asked her about Thereesa while we were both taking a moment to rest in our lair. She told me that she was the sort who preferred the company of other females, and I felt like a complete imbecile. Still, afterwords, I thought about her exotic, captivating eyes and her nicely formed face, her long black tongue… The look Lina gave me was horrendous in its shrewdness.

I shivered and distracted myself by asking when our appointment with Lady Scabia was.
1141211111111111221211111112111111111112.title: An Wet Encounter

choices: We don't have any for today, a special event is planned
1141211111111111221211111112111111111112.content:
"By the Ancestors!! I nearly forgot!!" squeaked Lina, "We're supposed to be meeting her right now!!"

I leapt out of my reclining position and immediately sped for the exit, Lina fluttering behind me.

Lady Scabia was waiting for us in her lair. We both bowed before the large dragoness.

“Darzhja. Lina. You are just in time…”

"What about Auntie' Celianeithe?" squeaked Lina. I assumed that she was talking about her own mentor.

"I apologize Lina, but unfortunately, she was not able to make it to this briefing. She’s been asked to interrogate the high value prisoners.”

“Just as I thought…” sighed Lina.

“What do you mean?” I asked, confused. "Well, remember how Lorath asked me to help get information out of the prisoners? As it turns out, the rank and file mercs didn’t have any specific information, yet the mercenary captains and the other more important managers of the warehouse had uncommonly powerful magical resistances that I wasn’t able to penetrate.”

“So…that means that some very powerful magic users managed to seal their minds, or something like that? So that they wouldn’t be able to give out any information even if they were captured?”

“Indeed,” said Scabia, “That can only mean that what you and Lina uncovered yesterday is but the tip of a large, well-funded criminal network. Its possible that the same people that were discovered with the cargo may have also had much to do with the attack on New Alveri…”

“I only gave this mission to you out of the expectation that it would be only a routine inspection, and I didn’t anticipate that either of you would end up facing the perils that you ended up facing. However, I must commend you both for performing as well as you did considering the circumstances,” she added.

“Has any news come about concerning Elandor’s whereabouts?” asked Lina.

“So far, he has remained silent…”

“Does that mean he has been captured?”

“Not likely. Were he in a position that he would be captured, he would have sent us a distress signal to let us know. His silence can only mean that he is simply going undercover again for an indefinite period of time,” answered Lady Scabia.

“Still, it was our fault that forced him to go undercover in the first place,” I said.

Lady Scabia shook her head. “No Darzhja. If you recall, I specifically told you that if on the off chance that the shipping company you were to investigate did contain stolen hatchlings, their safety was the first priority beyond all else. Elandor understood this, and indeed would have been appalled had you decided to save him instead of the infants.”

“Assuming this organization is larger than we imagined, that must surely mean there are other eggs under their control,” I growled. The mere thought of it sent a wave of fury through my veins.

“Indeed. The interrogation has managed to get leads on other warehouses, both in and outside the city limits, but the reasons for it still remain a mystery. Furthermore, since the attack, a number of fledglings have also been kidnapped as well.”

The events played out in my mind; the city exploding, Iskierka, Blaze. My eyes widened, “Wait a second!! Blaze!!” I exclaimed, wings unfurling.

“Hmmm?” asked Scabia.

“He was one of the fledglings I grew up with in the orphanage. He went missing during the night of the attack and hasn’t been heard from since.”

“Do you think he could he have been kidnapped just like the eggs were?” said Lina.

“He was heading back to the orphanage when he was last seen. Blaze might be a reckless troublemaker, but he’s far from helpless. If he was directly attacked, he would have fought with everything he had before allowing himself to get kidnapped, and hiding a young drake was different from hiding hatchlings.”

“So, if these smugglers could manage to kidnap not only helpless little ones, but adolescents as well, that could only mean these people had to be extremely dangerous…”

“We’ll do anything we can to stop these people…” I snarled. Had she given me a mission right then and there, I was ready to take off immediately and fight. “I know you are, but now that we have a better idea of the magnitude of this conspiracy, all the missions concerning these cases would be delegated for more experienced knights. You’ll both still have to prove yourselves capable of taking on these tougher missions by completing your training as initiates as well as performing your daily duties.”

I grumbled. Even so, I knew the reasoning behind it. I had barely been a Knight for little more than a couple of days now, and Lina was hardly longer than that.

"Patience. If you demonstrate that you both continue to work hard, then you’ll get your chance.”

“Then, we’ll work harder than anyone else, so that we can get involved in stopping the smugglers again!!” I answered. Lina nodded in agreement.

“One last thing!!” cried Scabia. “For your involvement in this mission, the Nine have also seen it fit that you get rewarded properly also. You’ll both receive fifty pounds worth of gemstones for completing your mission. In addition a couple of mothers have claimed their little ones, and wanted to thank you both for protecting them from the smugglers, and have also given you twenty pounds of gems each for your services. The gems have already been transferred to both of your accounts…"

“Oh wow!!” I called out. Honestly, I hadn’t even thought about the monetary reward, and I actually had been content if the only reward had been the satisfaction of doing my part as a Knight. Still, I had expanded my horde in a single mission, more than I previously had gathered in my entire life thus far. Obviously, this was but a drop in a bucket compared to how much the more experienced Knights made.

“Thank you Lady Scabia!!” screeched Lina.

“I’ll expect nothing less from both of you…” she nodded. “I will inform both of you when I need your services again. Until then, return to your daily tasks at hand.”

Lina and I bowed respectfully and then left the premises. Now that the meeting was over, there was still plenty of daylight left.

“I know this may sound like a dumb question, but what are our daily duties?” I asked Lina.

"As for today, there is going to be...
1141211111111111221211111112111111111112.title: Mission evaluation

1141211111111111221211111112111111111112.content:
As Lina and I winged our way back over the green fields of the valley, I could not help but feel a renewed sense of determination, but also apprehension. It seemed that my future as a Knight in training was spreading out before me. I'd had a brief taste of what it meant to be a knight on my very first mission, and as terrifying as it had been, I longed for more action, to make a difference. To be redirected to more common and mundane duties about the Temple, while more appropriate for my station, seemed a reduction, a waste of my potential.

There was so much going on about the city, what with the missing eggs and fledglings. With Blaze still not accounted for, the happenings were even more close to my heart. How could I hope to concentrate on our current task Lady Scabia had given us? I wanted to get out there and fight. I said as much to Lina as we flew, the smaller dragon holding a spell to allow us to speak to each other over the rushing wind.

"Darzhja, you can't think about things like that." said Lina. I could hear her plainly in my ear, though she flew comfortably in my wake behind me. "You have to remember that we're still just apprentice Knights. We need to work our way up to handling situations as sensitive as this."

"But we've already proven that we can handle them!" I insisted. "There are lost eggs and hatchlings out there. They're more important than the fact that we don't have a lot of experience."

Lina sighed raggedly. "I know how you feel, Darzhja. Believe me I do, especially now. But… but we can't just go out there and change the world. We'll get ourselves or others killed."

Lina's voice was high-strung with emotion so despite the fact that I was still burning inside for missions grander than inspecting the female dorms, I decided to drop the issue. I knew from our experience in the warehouse that although a capable magician, Lina was quite frightened and stressed out by even the prospect of open combat.

We were almost at the landing, in fact Lina, in her preferred method of landing had already poofed herself down while I circled, dropping speed and flapping my wings rigorously for my landing, when something that she said rose back to my mind. "Lina, what did you mean earlier when you said that you cared, 'especially now.'" I asked, the cupping the air above the landing with my wings as I lowered myself down.

Lina tittered, the fleshy tendrils under her jaw waving in the breeze I was stirring. She turned her head away girlishly and said, "After the inspection." I was not so ignorant at this point not to have my suspicions, but I kept them silent and moved into the common room, folding my massive wings against my back.

Inspecting the dorms was at once a high honor and an embaressement. Most of these other females had been here much longer than Lina or I, so the fact that we were inspecting their living areas was testament to the honors we had won in the warehouse. However, we were not honored in the eyes of our peers in the slightest. The other girls gave us nasty looks as we poked about the decorative rocks and shelves for contraband or spoke of the cleanliness or hygiene of the often unadorned caves - dragons did not have much need for furniture - as needed.

Certain of the veteran apprentices, such as the venomous female I'd encountered this morning were particularly… well, venomous. I was sliding my tail blade under a rock which served as something of a couch for Tsarra and her two lair mates in order to lift it when the spined female said, "So how does it feel to be a hero already after just a few days here, Newbie?"

I clenched my teeth as I lifted the large rock. I supposed that word of my mission was going to get around sooner rather than later, and linger especially in the ears of those who didn't care for a young new hotshot. I said nothing and continued to look under the 'couch.'

"They said that you already lost your first rider. How does that feel? Knowing that you got an elder humanoid killed?"

I growled and let the stone fall with a crash. A large crack ran across it so that it was nearly in twain; one of the other females who lived in the large chamber yelled. I said, "I suggest that you get your facts straight before accusing other people of things they didn't do. Hearsay is unbecoming."

Tsarra's spines lifted just as I adjusted and loosened my stance for fighting. I hadn't the slightest idea how to fight a venomer, but I supposed now was as good a time as any to find out.

Just then, Lina appeared between us, scattering dust over our snouts, my muscles relaxed almost involuntarily and Tsarra's spines smoothed against her scarlet hide. She turned her head away. "You're not worth the effort, Newbie" she snorted.

Lina brushed against my head, leading me back out of the chamber. "Come on, there's nothing here." she said hurriedly. I grunted and followed.

Each lair did not take long to inspect, but there were a lot of them. In the webbed hallways in between each, I asked Lina about the interrogation process. I was actually morbidly interested in whatever harsh methods of extracting information out of the miserable mercenaries had been used, but I was disappointed when I heard that Lina mostly just sat in a small room, fanning her wings while another Knight, usually a human or an elf, asked them questions. I also tried to pry out the secret Lina was keeping from me, but without much luck in that field either.

Naturally, most of the lairs were empty, just as Lina's and mine was - although, considering my size there was not a whole lot of room for anything else besides me and Lina - although some were richly decorated. I shuddered a little when I met with Thereesa again. She winked at me and licked her chops with that black tongue of hers. She actually had a small private room as it turned out that Thereesa was expected to graduate to full Knight quite soon. The room itself was dazzling to the eyes, covered as it was with glowing purple runes of a unique and stylistic design. "My own calligraphy." commented the violet dragoness. So it seemed that Thereesa was a skilled magic user as well. I searched only perfunctorily and left with as few words as I could, my hearts pounding. Lina, infuriatingly lingered and had a long conversation with her as I dawdled in the hallway.

"Oh, she definitely has the hots for you, Darzhja. She said she likes big girls." laughed Lina.

"Shut up." I said, and the smaller dragon let the matter drop.

Although there were many caves which could have used sometimes significant cleaning, there was only one which contained any contraban. The silver dragoness with the bulging waistline had stuffed what looked like half a cow into a crease in the wall and then covered it with a large boulder. Her name was Heliana as Lina informed me and she was shaking with fear when I moved the the large stone, revealing the hidden meat.

"Heliana, what is this?" I asked.

"Oh! Oh no, you weren't supposed to see that..." she said dejectedly, her voice full of embarrassment. "I-I just get hungry at night is all."

Lina fluttered up, "Please tell me this is the other half of your daily ration."

The way she refused to make eye contact made it clear that this cow was most definitely in addition to her regular ration.

I wasn't sure how to handle the situation, the fat silver female seemed embarrassed and repentant. I didn't know if I had the heart to turn her in.

Lina spoke again. "Heliana... you've put on fifteen stone since I was invited to the Temple. Tell me, are you... you know..."

A worried look crossed her face. She admitted that...
1141211111111111221211111112111111111112.title: Dorm Inspection

1141211111111111221211111112111111111112.content:
"Yes, I'm pregnant..." she stammered with a small voice.

My voice went numb. It did not come as a surprise when she said this, but nevertheless I was now in a position that I did not want to be in.

"How did it happen?" squeaked Lina.

Heliana curved her gaze away, holding her belly as she sniffled.

"I...did something so stupid. I was so happy that I'd passed the trials, that I..."

"W-who was it that you...you know..." I cried, keeping my head next to hers.

"I...I don't want to talk about it..." she stammered with a small voice.

"Did he force you?" I snarled.

She shook her head forcefully. "He's a good dragon. He'll...be shocked, but he'll...understand" she cried. By the ancestors I truly hoped so. Having never known my own parents, the notion that any parent would leave their little ones rankled.

"What is his..."

Lina placed a tiny wing over my mouth, and I instantly shut my mouth.

"I figured that this would happen sooner or later," she sighed, seeming resigned to her fate.

"I'm sorry Heliana, I really am," cried Lina, "But...since you're pregnant, by regulation we're going to have to report you to the Lieutenant."

I could already imagine just how horrifying that would be for Heliana.

"Lina, Darzhja," cried Heliana, "Don't blame yourselves. All it means is that...I'll just have to wait a while until I can resume my training!!" she finished, trying to force a grin. I wished I could say something to make her feel better, but I couldn't say anything. The only thing we could do was accompany her and as she plead her case.

As we walked through the halls, there was a forlorn feeling that pervaded the hallway. A few of the dragonesses peeked outside, giving Heliana sympathetic looks. This may very well be the final time they ever saw her, at least as an apprentice Knight, and as we passed by, they all wished her good luck, even that whore Tsarra.

The Lieutenant had a lair closeby the dorms. Decorating her wall, were a number of metallic contraptions designed to inflict the most painful torture imaginable, while the rest of her hallway was a dull, gray color.

"Report..." she hissed.

"All the dorms have been properly inspected, however there is a matter we wish to bring to your attention." I cried, trying to keep my wits about me. "We found an extra ration of meat stashed away in Heliana's lair..." I added.

Shadia's eyes narrowed, as they switched toward Heliana, then toward her bulging belly. She looked as if she wanted to die right then and there.

"You're preganant aren't you?" hissed Shadia. Yet her voice lacked the usual chilling edge to it.

"Yes Madam..." she answered. I was surprised at the amount of poise she showed.

"You understand the consequences do you Initiate?" sighed Shadia.

Heliana nodded.

"Darzhja, Lina," growled Shadia, "Please leave my chamber now."

"But Lieutenant!!" I wailed.

"This matter is no longer your concern. I shall deal with this matter personally!! Rest assured, all responsible parties will be held accountable. Now, back to your lair you two!!" she hissed.

"Yes...Madam..." Lina and I responded glumly. We left the room back to our chamber, in a dour mood.

I laid myself upon my belly. "I wish we could have done more to help her..."

"What's going to happen to her now?" I wondered.

"She...won't be able to undergo her training program throughout the duration of her pregnancy. Whoever the father is will be forced to pay for the cost of raising them. Best case scenario is that he agrees to marry her, but if not..."

It was painful to imagine what the worst case might be. In the brief time I had known her, Heliana had been a kind dragoness, putting others before herself. Still, even with the best case scenario, it was numbing to know that her dream of Knighthood would be cut short.

Thus, that night, I prayed for her. Prayed that all would be well and that she would one day be able to become a Knight again.
1141211111111111221211111112111111111112.title: Dream cut short

She received information about her mysterious past
1141211111111111221211111112111111111112.content:
"What?" asked the round bellied silver female.

"You know…" Lina was having a hard time just coming out and saying it.

"Pregnant." I finished for her.

Heliana's eyes flew as wide as saucers. "What?! No! No, I'm not… how could…" She tossed her head to the side, affronted and embarrassed, "I mean, I've put on some weight since coming here…" She ran a long set of claws down her bowed out torso. "But it's so stressful being in training! You know that. So… so I…"

"You eat to make yourself feel better." Lina provided.

Heliana nodded sadly, her lovely white wings falling a little.

My heart went out to the new recruit, it really did, since Heliana was one of the few who had shown me kindness since coming here. But the half carcass in the corner of the cave represented a very serious crime, and from the looks of the silver's waistline, this was far from the first time she'd stolen extra food.

She sat then, and I could not help but wince a little as I observed her big tummy make contact with the ground. Heliana was certainly not the sort of shape one imagined when thinking of a Holy Knight. She pleaded with me and Lina, "Please, isn't there anything you can do for me?"

I swallowed roughly. "Heliana, we're going to have to take this in…"

"Oh please! They'll kick me out of the knights for sure! Lieutenant Shadia always give me such dirty looks. She's got it out for me!"

I snorted, "I think she's got it out for everyone, actually."

Lina, floating on the air, sidled up to the large silver female. She said, "I know this is embarrassing for you, but maybe you can explain-"

"Nobody understands what it's like." Heliana blurted then. "My father's been trying to get into the knights for 300 years. When he tried to sign up, they said that they were only taking young dragons. He told me that joining the Knights was the best thing in the world for me. But it isn't! They drive me like an ox and everyone's so much prettier and thinner…" Her voice was cracking and a few warm tears like crystals slide down her cheeks. "I feel better when I'm eating.... It makes it bearable for one more day."

I sighed. Being a Knight was the one thing that had driven me almost since I'd known what a Knight was. However, in the few days I'd been here, my definition of a Holy Knight had been reshaped utterly. I had chosen a hard path, my reward for chasing an impossible dream. I could not fathom quitting myself, but I now understood that being a Knight was not for everyone.

Of course it was not Lina's nor my place to ask that question. Not here, not now. I stepped forward and embraced the silver dragoness with my wings. I held her for a few moments and she stopped sobbing.

"We're going to have to report you for having contraband in your room." I said. "But maybe we can look over the fact that you stole the cow."

Lina piped up. "If we get your punishment issued and served tomorrow, then there probably won't be any time for anyone to double check the husbandry mandates. The numbers are always a little short anyhow." she finished with a small laugh.

Heliana grinned, but didn't laugh. "Thank you two so much. I really appreciate this."

I smiled toothily and walked over to the carcass. "Just make sure that you keep your appetite under control from here on out." I said and took the half-cow between my jaws.

Lina said "And maybe flying the morning drills won't be so hard if you manage to drop a little weight." Heliana snorted sardonically and the faerie dragon shrugged. "Well… cleaning up this blood couldn't hurt for starters."

Heliana sighed, looking conflicted and in deep thought. As I carried away the stolen cow, I wondered if she would stay and stick it through or if I would have to say farewell to one of the few dragonesses around here who valued my company.

I was forced to file my report under the watchful glare of Lieutenant Shadia who led the female dorms. A dragon cult scribe took down my words as I dictated; humans proved to be quite capable in regard for paperwork - dragon sized vellums and writing skins would take up many times the space of papers and parchments. Shadia snorted when I reported Heliana's offense. "I knew that fatass was hiding food somewhere. We have little need for anyone to be testing the foundations of our caves."

I thought that was unfair, considering that a Sky-swallower was still much heavier than Heliana could ever be. But I said nothing to that regard.

"Tell me, where did she get the carcass?"

Her onyx eyes seemed to peer into my soul, scorching it with its iciness. Lina saved me, saying, "It was the other half of her ration, Lady Shadia. Heliana said that she gets hungry at night."

The Deathwing scowled and was silent. Then she said, "Then that flying hippo should eat the whole thing in the evening as intended. The caves are dirty enough without drakka butchering their kills on the stone." Shadia snorted some smoke and became silent. After a few moments, we realized that we were dismissed. However, I could almost feel her eyes burning my back as I retreated hurriedly.

I laid down on my scaled stomach once we were back in our own lair. I was worn to the bone so that I did not even mind Lina's weight as she settled atop me. However, I wished that it was as convenient for me to find a soft resting place. Curling my tail in the same direction as my head in the oval shaped space, I said, "Well, the inspection is over."

Lina already started laughing, her claws dug into my hide with her excitement. "It is."

She was milking it for all it was worth. "Well…?" I was obliged to ask.

Lina, unable to contain her secret any longer burst out...

1141211111111111221211111112111111111112.content:
"I just found out that I'm going to have little ones!!" she squealed, hugging herself.

My eyes went wide and I let out a gasp. "You're pregnant!!"

Lina nodded happily, rubbing her belly. I wasn't sure whether I should congratulate her or be alarmed. I suppose that I just found it rather strange to rationalize a dragoness the size of a hatchling was herself pregnant. Despite the fact she'd had a betrothed, I was also a bit shocked she'd had her first long before I ever would. Lina had always been going on about how she and Ein'theil were going to make little ones together, but I'd always assumed that they would at least wait until they'd both become full-fledged Knights. Apparently I was wrong.

"Yet...if you're pregnant what happens when the Knights find out? What if they decide to kick you out or something?" I cried, deeply concerned. It would be horrible if they expelled her from the Knighthood because of pregnancy.

Lina hummed, not the least bit concerned. "Actually, that was part of the reason why I ended up becoming a Knight..." she replied.

"Really?!" I called out, eyes bulging.

"Remember how I told you how Faerie Dragons are rare? Before the Knights took over, my kind used to be hunted by rogue magicians who wanted to increase their own power, along with loggers who used to cut down our meadows, so much so we were almost wiped out. Even after the Knights took over, what remained of my kind scattered and went into hiding in order to protect the rest of us. My egg hatched in my own little meadow, and lived with all the Sprites and the little magical creatures. I loved it there, but it was also very lonely. Then, Auntie Celianthe came to the meadow...I'd never seen another Faerie Dragon before!!"

"She's your mentor isn't she?" I commented.

"She told me about what became of my kind, and that through the Knights they would be able to restore the Fairie Dragon Clans to what they were before. She also told me that I would find my wonderful Prince at the Temple..." she cried, her eyes growing dreamily.

"So, the Knights invited you to the Temple to breed because your kind is rare?" I gasped. Had a recruiter made the exact same offer to me, I would have been immediately suspicious, and I was flabbergasted that Lina could be so trusting. I supposed it was one of those peculiarities about Faerie Dragons.

"Mmmhmmm... They'd also train me how to use my abilities, but what really sold me was that for so long, I feared that I'd never get to meet another male of my kind, that I'd never get to have babies. So when the day came that I met Ein'theil... it was love at first sight!!"

She let out a squeal. I tried to imagine what it was like had I never met another bronze drake before, and vice-versa. When seen from that perspective, it was little wonder why Lina had taken to Ein'theil right away.

I then gazed about the chamber, making sure nobody was eavesdropping, "So...w-when... um...exactly did it happen?"

Lina blushed, swishing her tail back and forth, "Remember the morning? Before our first mission?"

I remembered Lina pointing him out and then excitedly fluttering over to that ledge where her mate was, and had then watched them start to roll around in the bushes.

So that's what she'd been doing...

"I was so happy that I had a lairmate that I told Ein'theil about it, and he was so happy for me, and I happened to be in season, so then..."

She let out a high pitched moan as she reclined on her back, "Oh, it was so wonderful Darzhja!! To come together with him like that, and feel him pour his sweet nectar into me, and then feel the life bloom within me... And...and... I'm going to be a momma now!!"

"By the Ancestors its all so overwhelming!! Knowing that there's going to be babies depending on me to care for them!!" she gasped. It seemed that only now did she appreciate the enormity of the task that now laid before her.

"Don't doubt yourself for an instant Lina. I know what a wonderful dragoness you truly are. The little ones will be truly blessed to have you as their mother," I assured her, curving my head next to hers.

Lina heaved, tears streaming out of her eyelids, before pressing herself against me. "Oh Darzhja, you have no idea what this means to me. Thank you. Thank you. I... I..."

Words couldn't possibly describe that shared feeling I felt for Lina. I was just so happy, content, that I could be part of a significant moment in a dragonesses lifetime, more so because it was a dear friend. If I ever found that significant other, I wondered if I would also be this elated if I found out I had little ones.

Then she let out a heave, seeming to calm down, "Thanks Darzhja, I feel a lot better about things now, now that I got this off my chest. I won't be laying for quite a while, so we'll still have lots and lots of fun together!!" she squeaked. My jaw dropped and I let out a shallow laugh, knowing full well what Lina's version of fun meant.

Her eyes took that mischivous glow again. "So Darzhja, Thereesa was telling me just how comely you looked in the baths..." she tittered.

"If you're implying that I roll that way, you're wrong..." I snorted, my eyes narrowing.

"Are you sure?" she giggled, her eyes glowing.

"What? O-of course I'm sure!!" I retorted, yet there was a brief uneasiness and hesitation. That opening was all she needed to egg me further on.

Lina leaned her head closer, "Oh come on...wouldn't you be the least bit curious to see what it might be like with another female?" she murmured. To my chagrin, I couldn't help but imagine such naughty thoughts. I remembered all those glowing runes that decorated the dragoness' room; perhaps the magic that glowed from them had something to do with her odd orientation? Maybe if I allowed Thereesa to slake this lust of hers, she would calm down and get over me, instead of continuing to pester me about it... In fact, maybe it might be fun just to try it out once...

Out of the corner of my eye, I noticed the mischievous Faerie Dragoness clinging onto my neck, extending her tongue and licking the underside of my jaw in a very lascivious manner. My wings unfurled in alarm, and she purred back hungrily, tail swishing from side to side.

"Lina!!" I snapped, lashing my claw at her as I rose to my feet. The faerie dragoness giggled madly as she poofed out of my reach, dancing about the dorm. Lina was back to her usual tricks, knowing exactly how to manipulate my fantasies. For such a tiny, happy go lucky dragoness, she could be surprisingly perverted when she set her mind to be. Nevertheless, I couldn't help but smile. I wouldn't trade her for anyone else in the world.
1141211111111111221211111112111111111112.title: Lina's a momma!!
